loans.name: Maricris

texts.en: Maricris A. is from the village of Bagontaas, Valencia City. She is 33 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Maricris owns and operates a specialized retail business selling herbal food supplements in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Maricris joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is only 19 years old. At her young age, she is now married and has a one-year-old child. She also learned how to farm properly because as she said, she has to earn for her family. She cultivates her land for rice crops. She currently needs farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers for her farm. She also asked some laborers to help till the farm.

Daisy joined CEVI and requested a loan of PHP7,000. With this loan, she can now buy the farm inputs she needs and she can pay the laborers who helped her.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and pay the laborers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn Y., 62, is married and lives with one of her children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She sells desserts and works as a farmer, making US $3 each day, while her husband also does some farming and works as soldier, making about US $3 each day as well. Sorn Y. is asking for a loan of US $200 to purchase another farmland to grow more rice. She sees this new rice field as a good economic investment and will use it to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase farmland.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga tiene 36  años y junto a ella vive su esposo y sus hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace más de 13 años, ella y su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de tejas y ladrillos, y cada madrugada empieza su labor, primeramente calientan el horno durante dos horas, previos para prepararla la cocción de los moldes que ya están listos, este proceso de cocción dura de dos a tres días aproximadamente. El gran esfuerzo que realizan tiene su recompensa cuando ven logran vender por millares su producción en las ferias de construcción de su ciudad. En el futuro Dominga espera su  propio terreno para poder instalar su fábrica de tejas y ladrillos de manera permanente. Este es su catorceavo crédito con MFP, y siempre ha demostrado ser una persona muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, además que es muy apreciada por sus compañeros de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de los insumos y materiales para la fabricación de sus ladrillos, como leña, y aserrín.
texts.en:
Dominga is 36. She lives with her husband and their children in her own house. She and her husband have been making tiles and bricks for over 13 years. Every morning they start their work by first heating the oven for two hours. They do this to prepare it for baking the molds when they are ready. The baking process lasts for approximately two or three days. The great effort they put forth has its recompense when they sell their production by the thousands at the construction fairs in their city. In the future Dominga hopes to have her own land to be able to set up a tile and brick factory in a permanent manner. This is her fourteenth loan with MVP. She has always shown herself to be a very punctual person with her payments. Also, she is greatly valued by her colleagues in her communal bank. She will use the loan to buy supplies and materials like wood and sawdust to make her bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make bricks

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida P. is a widowed woman who supports her family by running a pig fattening business. She lives in Sitio Maninihon, Brgy Guinhalaran, Silay City, Negros Occidental with her only child.  He is 30 years old and already has a family of his own.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1988 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Zenaida is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can expand her business, buying more piglets and more feed. This will be her 26th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Zenaida aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Berta es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Berta viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que vende en su puesto del mercado Chorro, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su sobrina.
Berta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Berta son construir el segundo piso de su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Berta is a member of the Tarpuy communal bank; Tarpuy means "To Sow" or "To Plant" in Quechua. Berta lives with her life partner, is 45 years old and has 4 children. Berta travels to the various markets in the region to sell fruit. At those markets, she buys grains that she sells in her stall at the Chorro market. Her niece helps her with the sales. Berta needs 1000 soles to buy grains. Berta's dream is to build a second storey on her house and that her children complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1980 à Ségou, Monsieur Idrissa S. est comptable de formation, marié à une épouse et père d’un enfant. Il vit chez son père  dans le quartier Darsalam I  de la préfecture de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).  
Monsieur S.  fut contraint  avec le décès de son grand frère qui aidait son père à  gérer  leur pharmacie, d’arrêter  son stage, pour remplacer son frère défunt au niveau de la pharmacie. 
Les médicaments faisant parties des besoins de première nécessitée dans nos pays sous-développés, il est très sollicité par ses clients et sa notoriété est sans égale à Koutiala. 
Pour augmenter  son stock de produits pharmaceutiques, il décida de faire recours à l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son 1er prêt  individuel. 
Monsieur  S. compte acheter différents produits pharmaceutiques (médicaments) avec ce prêt. 
Il s’approvisionne  auprès des dépositaires agrées  de Bamako (capitale du Mali). Il  vend  les médicaments, tous les jours au niveau de la pharmacie sise au grand marché de Koutiala,  à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes, généralement  au comptant. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200.000FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt, utiliser  le reste pour  acheter  de la nourriture et investir dans ses activités.
Il ambitionne solliciter un financement plus important  qui pourra lui permettre d’agrandir non seulement sa pharmacie et par conséquent augmenter son chiffre d’affaire lui permettant  ainsi d’améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Born around 1980 in Ségou, Mr. Idrissa S. is a trained accountant, married to one wife and the father of one child. He lives with his father in the Darsalam I district of the Koutiala prefecture (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mr. S. was forced by the death of his older brother, who helped his father manage their pharmacy, to abandon his training. He replaced his deceased brother at the pharmacy. Medicine is one of the primary needs in our underdeveloped nation; he is very much in demand and his reputation is without equal in Koutiala. In order to increase his pharmaceutical stocks, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, through which he is requesting his first individual loan. Mr. S. plans to buy various pharmaceutical products (medicines) with this loan. He gets his supplies from approved agents in Bamako, the capital of Mali. He sells medicine everyday at the pharmacy located in the main market of Koutiala, to a clientele of men and women who generally pay in cash. He plans to clear a monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA which he plans to use to repay the loan, and to use the rest to buy food and invest in his business. His goal is to seek more substantial financing which will allow him to not only improve his business and therefore his turnover, but also his quality of life.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase medicine

loans.name: Iris Onelia

texts.es:
Iris es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su dos hijos en el sector La Calera, una zona agrícola considerada como area rural y que queda situada en el distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cinco años se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral. Ella cría ovejas y aves de corral en la parte posterior de su domicilio, las engorda y luego las vende a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos adicionales con los cuales cuenta la familia, ya que su esposo trabaja como peón agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para sacar adelante a los suyos.

Iris desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas animales para engordarlos y seguir vendiéndolos y así percibir más ingresos. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer muy entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir junto a su aesposo una hectarea de terreno agrícola. Todos las acciones y esfuerzos que ella hace las realiza pensando en el bienestar y porgreso de su hogar.
texts.en:
Iris is a 34 year old housewife who lives with her husband and two children in the La Calera sector, an agricultural zone considered as a rural area, situated in the district of Pitipo, Ferreñafe province, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For five years, she has been engaged in the raising and sale of farm animals. She raises sheep and chickens behind her house. She fattens them and then sells them to traders who come to the area. This business is an important source of additional income which her family counts on since her husband works as a low paid agricultural laborer, and the income he receives is not sufficient for them to get ahead.

Iris wants to increase her business by buying more animals in order to fatten them and continue selling them. That’s why she is applying for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles that will help her achieve her objective. She is a woman who is very devoted to her family. Her greatest desire is to be able to acquire, along with her husband, a hectare of agricultural land. All her actions and the efforts that she makes are carried out thinking about the wellbeing and progress of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals for fattening and sale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: A. Marie est née le 02 Janvier 1972 et est mariée à SEFOU Wassi. Marie est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais Marie a un autre enfant à sa charge.  Il y a environs trois ans que la famille s’est installée au quartier Yagbé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Marie a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Mais depuis trois ans, Marie mène comme activité, la vente de produits de SOBEBRA (boissons alcoolisées, sucreries). A côté de cette activité, Marie prépare et vend de la nourriture à PK 3 à Cotonou. Marie s’approvisionne en boissons à la SOBEBRA. Marie  a obtenu une fois déjà un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Marie sollicite un deuxième prêt afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’élever le niveau de son activité ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroître sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenu.
texts.en:
Marie A. was born 2 January 1972 and is married to Wassi SEFOU. She is the mother of two children, all having attended (or still attending) school. Marie herself has attended school to secondary level. She also has another child under her care. Three years ago the family settled in the Yagbé borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple shares family expenses. For the past three years Marie has been selling SODEBRA products (alcoholic beverages, soft drinks). As a parallel activity, she prepares and sells food at PK3 in Cotonou. She gets her bottled supplies at SODEBRA. Marie has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was repaid in full. She is now requesting a second loan to increase her working capital and raise the level of her activity. This will allow her to expand her customer base and generate more revenue.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy non-alcoholic beverages and mineral water

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is married with a son. She is a small entrepreneur from the town of Vasilyevka. Tamara sells clothing merchandise and household retail items in one of the local marketplaces in her town. She has been in this business for three years. Her gross income amounts to 8,600 Grivnyas a month.  

Tamara is requesting a loan of 10,300 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise and keep her income stable as a result. We believe consistent demand, outstanding credit history and entrepreneurial enthusiasm will guarantee loan repayment without any delinquencies.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal A. is 24 years old and married. He and his wife live in Gaza. He has a shoe store in Bet Hanoun. 

Nidal needs this loan to increase his working capital. It will allow him to provide more shoes which will increase his sales and increase his budget.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Lyroche

texts.en:
Lyroche F. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 44 years old. Lyroche is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Lyroche owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Lyroche has been engaged in her business for over 7 years already.

In 2009, Lyroche joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Lyroche has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lyroche is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lyroche from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en: Mr. Pha N. lives in Lvea Sar Kandal village in Kandal province. He is a 40 year old farmer who owns more than one-hectare of land. Mr. Pha N. supports his family by cultivating rice to sell on the land and also has a side job as a motorbike taxi driver. He has a problem because his field is far away from the irrigation system. So to improve production, Mr. Pha N. is applying for a loan to dig a well. His wife, Mrs. Yoeurn Chak, is a housewife who makes delicious food for her family. They have six children, three of whom are attending the local public school, while the others are too small to work or study. He and his wife are in the photo.

loans.use: To dig a well.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with four daughters who all attend school. She has been operating her tailoring business for five years with the help of her spouse who is employed as a tailor. With the Ksh 20,000 loan, she wants to buy materials of different designs to suit her clients' needs. She earns her other source of income from her husband's salary.

Elizabeth sells to her neighbors and passersby from home. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She hopes to have her own plot of land in the future; she currently rents a house with electricity but no piped water. Elizabeth decided to join Yehu because of the accessibility to sustainable services to improve her living standards. She cites food and electricity as her greatest monthly expenses.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of cloth materials

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace B. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Mary Grace is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish, home-made peanut butter, viand like longanisa in the local community. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase products for her sari-sari store. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Grace. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products for sari-sari store

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; La  socia vive en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Beatriz; ella tiene 41 años de edad y La socia es natural de de San Sebastián,   ella es soltera y vive sola, la socia trabaja como profesora en una escuela primaria en el distrito de San Sebastián, ella adora su trabajo y es considerada una excelente profesional, La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar materiales de trabajo para enseñar a sus niños diferentes almanaques y preparar sus clases de forma más dinámica.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Our associate is part of the “Kantu de San Jeronimo” communal bank and lives in the province and department of Cusco. She is Beatriz, is 41 years old, and a native of San Sebastián. She is single, lives alone, and works as a teacher at an elementary school in the San Sebastián district. She loves her work and others consider her to be very professional. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy working materials to be able to teach her schoolchildren from different books and also make her classes more dynamic. [Beatriz] infinitely values and appreciates this loan which will allow her to grow with her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies with which to teach in school

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 43 años, vive con su pareja Leonidas, de 69 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos,  pero sólo vive en su casa propia con dos de ellos, pues el mayor ya tiene su propia familia. Cada mañana para ella, empieza un nuevo día lleno de retos, ya que la arveja, habas, papa, maíz, avena y gladiolos, son los productos que siembra desde hace 20 años, junto a su esposo, pues para ambos su prioridad es cubrir los gastos domésticos y  la educación de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta a Lidia, es cosechar papa y arveja porque son los frutos que mayor demanda tienen en el mercado de su ciudad, las cuales le dejan ganancias considerables y seguras porque tiene comerciantes mayoristas, quienes conoce la calidad de sus productos y no dudan en comprar su mercadería. Como sus ingresos son rentables, desea en adelante sembrar en mayor cantidad papa, arveja y gladiolo. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y esta contenta de laborar en su grupo comunal, con las personas, que considera responsables, honestos y solidarios. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de guano de ave de corral, para sembrar en la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Lidia is 43 years old, and she lives with her 69 year husband, Leonidas. They have three children, but only two of them live with them in their own house. The oldest has his own family. Every morning she starts a new day filled with challenges. Peas, beans, potatoes, corn, oats, and gladiolas are the products that she has been planting with her husband for 20 years. The priority for both of them is to cover the household expenses and their children’s education. What Lidia likes the most is harvesting the potatoes and peas because there is a greater demand for them in the city’s market. They give them a sizable and secure income because the wholesale merchants know the quality of their products, and they do not hesitate to buy their merchandise. As their income from the crops is profitable, she wishes to plant a greater quantity of potatoes, peas, and gladiolas. This is her third loan with MFP, and she is happy working with her communal bank. The people are responsible, honest, and supportive. She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of poultry guano for the next season’s planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of poultry guano

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Mrs. Socheat C. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Vantha Vong, have been married since 1996 and have two children who attend school. The family lives along National Road No. 1, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Socheat has been a garment factory worker for more than nine years, while Mr. Vantha Vong has been a vegetable farmer for more than fifteen years. Socheat is requesting her second loan in the amount of US$ 700 to use as business capital to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his vegetable farm. He will be able to continue increasing his productivity.

loans.use: purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her husband's vegetable farm

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 20 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijo alguno. Vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, específicamente en la localidad de Santa Rosa. Jorge se caracteriza por ser creativo y trabajador, pese que solo tiene secundaria completa, no pierde las esperanzas de estudiar una carrera como ingeniería de sistemas, con el propósito de que pueda tener su propio empresa y pueda ofrecer sus servicios. Es por ello que lo ve como un negocio rentable, además en su localidad no servicio alguno, pero es consciente que debe ir paso a paso. Hoy se esta dedicando a la heladería que tiene sus padres, en donde está laborando de manera constante, fruto de su esfuerzo percibe un pago justo, su rutina diaria es de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 4:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde y su punto de venta lo realiza en su propia localidad a un precio competitivo.  En un futuro próximo anhela tener su propio tienda de venta de computadoras, repuestos, servicios de reparación y demás accesorios, con la finalidad de que tome un posicionamiento agresivo en su localidad. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir de manera puntual con sus respectivos pagos, además está conforme con su banco comunal, debido a las buenas decisiones que se llegan a dar. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en adquirir frutas e insumos, para su respectiva elaboración de helados tropicales de la zona.
texts.en:
Jorge is 20 years old, single, and doesn't have any children. He lives in his parents house, which is located in the beautiful Ayacuchana jungle, specifically in the town of Santa Rosa. Jorge is known for being creative and hard-working. Even though he only has completed his secondary education, he doesn't lose the hope of studying for a career as a systems engineer, with the intention of being able to have his own business and to offer his services. In his town there aren't any services of this type, and he sees it as a profitable business, but he is conscious that he must go step by step.

Today, he is working in the ice cream shop that his parents own, where he is constantly working. The fruit of his effort is a fair pay. He works daily from Monday to Saturday, from 4am until 6pm, and his shop is in his own town nd he offers a competitive price. In the near future, he hopes to have his own shop selling computers, spare parts, repair services and other accessories, with the aim to take an aggressive position in his town.

This is his first loan with MFP, and therefore he assures he will pay it back in a punctual manner with his respective payments. Additionally, he is happy with his community bank, due to the good decisions that they give him. With the loan he is requesting, he is thinking to invest it in buying fruits and supplies to make tropical ice cereams of the region.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and supplies to make ice cream

loans.name: Mario Ezequiel

texts.es: Mario Ezequiel se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, desde hace más de 9 años, la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda y domicilio, pues Mario es un hombre trabajador pues le gusta mucho el campo y su trabajo. El se gana vida de la manera más humilde con su negocio. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria como leche, cuajada, crema y queso. Mario todos los días se levanta temprano para realizar su trabajo por lo que tiene buscar el alimento diario para su familia.
texts.en:
Mario Ezequiel has sold dairy products for over 9 years. His business is located in his home. Mario is a hard-working man who really likes the countryside and his work. He makes his living in a very humble way with his business. This loan is for the purchase of necessary basic material such as milk, curds, cream and cheese. Every day Mario gets up early to work, since he has to work for his family's daily bread.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma G., from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City, is 38 years old, widowed, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling food, daily use products and viands for different meals in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting her third loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Vilma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional inventory & working capital

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kerlyn Roberta

texts.es:
Kerlyn Roberta T. G. tiene 20 anos. Es soltera y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. 

Kerlyn es socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.
  
Kerlyn es agricultura. Tiene siembras de cacao y maíz. Realiza las compras de sus productos en Mata de Cacao cada 15 días. Solicita el crédito para invertir en los insumos y abonos para el mantenimiento de cacao. Con el apoyo del préstamo podrá cultivar sus propios cultivos de cacao. Su sueno es seguir adelante con su trabajo agrícola. También espera terminar sus estudios universitarios. 

Le gusta escuchar música, ver televisión, y leer.
texts.en:
Kerlyn Roberta T. G. is 20 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents in El cantón de Chillanes in the Bolívar Province.

Kerlyn is a member of the communal bank “El Placer de Ser Amigos”, which is located 20 minutes from the San José del Tambo parish. There are 15 members, the majority of which work farming cocoa or have their own small businesses

Kerlyn is a farmer.  She sows cocoa and corn.  She buys her products every 15 days in Mata de Cacao.  She is applying for the loan to invest in supplies and fertilizer to care for the cocoa.  With the help of the loan she will be able to grow her own cocoa crops.  Her dream is to make it as an agricultural worker.  She also hopes to finish her university studies.

She likes to listen to music, watch television and read.

loans.use: Invest in supplies and fertilizer to care for the cocoa

loans.name: Kigunda Bakyara Twekambe Group 1-Rukungiri

texts.en: 50 year old K. Joy belongs to Kigunda Bakyara Twekambe group 1- Rukungiri. She is a widow and has 9 kids. She preoccupies herself with farming as a source of livelihood. She does her farming in Kanonko cell-Rukungiri. To get started in this business 8 years ago, she used savings from her poultry enterprise. Each month this business generates her KES 200,000. With this loan she says she is going to buy manure to improve her banana plantation.

loans.use: The purchase of more manure to improve her banana plantation.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man with four children who are in school.  He farms for a living.  He has managed to educate his children and buy a piece of land through Faulu Kenya.  He has been running his business for twenty years and employs two people.  He has requested a loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pipes.  He hopes to be a farm produce exporter in the future and has a five-year plan to own a truck.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and pipes

loans.name: Kirera Twebeiseho Group

texts.en: K. Lydia belongs to Kirera twebeiseho group in Bushenyi. She is 40 years old and married. She has 3 children, all in school. K. Lydia is a farmer dealing in beans and maize from her home and she has been in this business for 5 years. She deals in the sale of coffee from her home as well. She is a very hard working lady and she needs a loan to be able to buy beans and coffee for resale.

loans.use: Buying beans and coffee for resale.

loans.name: Bazaroy

texts.ru: Шамакова Базарой жительница района Кубодиён. Ей 42 года. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Муж и старший сын находятся в России на заработках. Сама Базарой занимается животноводством. Она закупает скот и разводит их у себя дома. В основном Базарой разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количества. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Bazaroy S., 42, resides in Kubodien. She has secondary education and is married with 5 children. Bazaroy's husband and eldest son are working in Russia. Bazaroy herself if engaged in animal husbandry. She buys the cattle and breeds them at home, mostly for sale. Having done this work for 6 years, Bazaroy is applying for a loan that would allow her to purchase more livestock and increase turnover.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and fodder

loans.name: Hugo Daniel

texts.es:
Hugo es un padre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo en la ciudad de Reque, una zona de movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de tallado en piedra y a la elaboración de lápidas. Este trabajo consiste en tallar piedras para hacer decoraciones en fachadas e interiores de viviendas, por otro lado, aplica sus habilidades para elaborar lápidas fúnebres. Sus habilidades le han permitido hacerse más conocido en la zona, y sus servicios cuenta con una demanda estable.

Hugo ha tenido un crédito anteriormente financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En esa oportunidad el pudo adquirir algunos materiales y herramientas que necesitaba para poder satisfacer de buena manera la demanda con la que cuenta. Con las ganancias que obtuvo en su momento de estas actividades ayudó a su esposa a instalar poco a poco una bodega en donde ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos de uso diario, entre abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad.

Actualmente Hugo desea adquirir mas productos para ampliar su bodega ya que la demanda de este negocio se ha incrementado últimamente, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar nuevamente un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo. Hugo se encuentra bastante agradecido con las personas que colaboraron con el y le ayudaron a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hugo is a 33 year-old father who lives with his wife and child in the city of Reque.  This is an area with considerable commercial activity which is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  Hugo provides a stone cutting and gravestone making business.  He cuts stone to make decorations for the outside and inside of houses.  He also uses his skills to make gravestones.

Hugo's skills have allowed him to become very well known in his area and he has a stable demand for his services.  Hugo has had a previous loan funded by Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa's seed money.  On that occasion he acquired some materials and tools that he needed to meet the demand that he had.  With the money he made from his business he helped his wife to set up a small grocery store where she sells all sorts of daily-use products such as groceries and essentials.  Hugo would currently like to acquire more products so that they can expand the store since demand has increased lately.  For this reason, he is requesting a new loan for 2000 Peruvian soles which will help him to achieve his goal.  Hugo is very grateful to the people who help fund his loans and help him to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To acquire more merchandise to expand his grocery store as demand has increased lately

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly L. is from the village of Macaopao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Nelly is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nelly owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods,snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Nelly has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Nelly is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Nelly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Mencia

texts.es: Mencia tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en una casa alquilada. Vende comida típica de su tierra natal, en este caso, anticuchos y lo hace de manera ambulante. Es entonces desde la esquina de su casa y a partir de las tardes hasta altas horas de la noche, siendo este trabajo continúo por casi 4 años. Ella considera que este negocio es una buena opción de desarrollo que la ayudó en tiempos de necesidad económica y que actualmente la ayuda a sostener  a sus hijos. Hoy sus platillos se venden rápidamente, siendo esta la razón  por el cual desea adquirir nuevos implementos que la ayudarán a vender con mayor  frecuencia. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más ingredientes  para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mencia, 38, lives with her husband and four children in a rented house.  She sells food typical of her birthplace, in this case, anticuchos (skewered roasted meat), in an ambulatory fashion from the corner near her house starting in the afternoon and continuing until very late at night.  She has worked at this continuously for almost four years.

She considers this business to be a good option for development in that it helped her out during times of economic need and it currently helps her support her children.  Today, her dishes sell out quickly.  For this reason she wants to acquire new tools that will help her sell more.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she can count on financial support because she has always been responsible with her payments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all its members are responsible, mutually supportive people.

She thanks all those people who will fund the loan she is asking for which will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the requested loan to buy more ingredients for her business.

loans.use: To buy tools and ingredients that will help her stay in business.

loans.name: Ma. Brenda

texts.en:
Ma. Brenda is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two businesses: making and selling rope and selling vegetables. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,800. Ma. Brenda is borrowing PHP 12,000 to purchase raw materials. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Brenda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Loma Bonita Group

texts.es:
La señora Francisca Jiménez  Juárez, vive en la Colonia Juan Sabines, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México. Vive en unión libre con el seño Óscar Cruz Muñoz, con quien procreo dos hijas que a un están a su responsabilidad y son: Sandra Nayeli   de diez años y la más pequeña es Mariela de seis años.

    Ella invierte el préstamo en a compra de quesos, así como también la venta de pescados y camarón, para luego venderlo en el mismo Municipio, la cual lleva practicando siete años y nueve meses  en la que comenta que le va bien.

   Para iniciar esta actividad  y emprender este trabajo  lo animo  una de sus compañeras  a dedicar su tiempo en una pequeña actividad en la que se pueda ayudar.

   Con la ganancia que va obteniendo lo invierte, en la compra de más pescado, pará que ha sí realice  su venta más días a la semana  y mejor sea su ganancia.

   Lo que desea es que con la ayuda de Dios y esfuerzo  su  actividad aumente para que  así pueda  obtener ahorro de la que pueda sacar adelante sus hijas.

   El grupo se llama loma bonita y se integra de tres señoras que cada una tiene su respectiva actividad.

      Francisca Jiménez Juárez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de quesos  y mariscos, como son: pescados y camarones, para venderlo en la misma región.
 
     María Ysabet S. García: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ropas para,  damas, caballeros y niños.
 
     Asbeli del Carmen A. S.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ropas para venderlo en la misma localidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisco Jiménez Juárez lives in the Juan Sabines colony, in Copainala, Chiapas, Mexico.  She has a common-law marriage to Mr. Oscar Cruz Muñoz and they have two daughters in their care: Sandra Nayeli, 10, and Mariela, 6.  She plans to use the loan to buy cheese, fish and shrimp to sell in the city.  She has been doing this for seven years and nine months and says things are going well for her.

She began her business when a co-worker suggested she get involved in some small activity that could help her get ahead.  With the earnings she obtains she buys more fish and, in this manner, can sell more and more each week increasing her income.  With the help of God and her own hard-work she hopes to increase business and save enough money to provide for her daughters.

The group is called "Loma Bonita" and is comprised of three women who each have their respective businesses.  Francisca Jiménez Júarea will use her loan to buy cheese, fish and shrimp.  María Ysabet S. García will use the loan to buy women's, men's, and children's clothing.  Asbeli del Carmen A. S. will use the loan to buy clothing which she will sell in the city.

loans.use: To buy cheese, fish and shrimp

loans.name: Los Forjadores Group

texts.es:
Señora Lourdes Melecia S. Y., socia D. L. alcancia comunal "Los Forjadores" D. L. localidad D. Concepcion en Huancayo.
Lourdes S.; divorciada, tiene hijos mayores D. edad que ya tienen familia, elL. vive con uno D. ellos ya que no cuenta con vivienda propia.
L. señora Lourdes se dedica desD. su juventud a L. agricultura y a L. ganaderìa; elL. todos los dìas atienD. al ganado, llevàndolos al campo, donD. D. paso supervisa los cultivos D. sus chacras. Tambièn orD.ña su vaca para vender L. leche.
El crèdito que solicita serà para L. compra D. animales menores.
(En L. fotografìa, L. señora Lourdes esta vestida D. chompa color rojo, y es L. primera D. L. derecha)
texts.en:
Lourdes Melecia S. Y. is a member of the communal bank named "Los Forjadores” located in the community of Concepcion in Huancayo. 

Lourdes S. is divorced and she has grown children who have families of their own. She lives with one of them because she doesn't have a house of her own. 

Lourdes has been an agriculturist and farmer since her youth. She attends to her livestock every day, taking them to the fields. While she is there she also checks on her plantations on her land. She also milks cows in order to sell the milk. 

The loan will be used to purchase small livestock. 

(In the photograph, Lourdes is dressed in a red jacket and she is the first person on the right)

loans.use: to acquire livestock

loans.name: Sonia Maydeli

texts.es: Sonia Maydeli Z. V. de 21 años de edad, vive con sus padres. Su madre es ama de casa y su padre se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra. Es una familia humilde con diversidad de necesidades económicas pero que día a día  luchan por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Sonia  es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y emprendedora. Ella tiene bien claro  que la única forma de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia a superarse es trabajando. Hace unos algunos años que se dedica a la venta de frutas en el desvío La Flecha  del Departamento de Morazán, trata de tener variedad de frutas tales como: piñas, bananas, mangos, sandías, entre otros. Su puesto se encuentra en un lugar estratégico ya que es muy transitado por los habitantes de la zona. Además muchas personas la conocen y tienen confianza ya que siempre está pendiente de ofrecer calidad  tanto en sus productos como en la atención que da  a sus clientes. Su sueño es abastecer su negocio para que el cliente siempre encuentre lo que busca y la prefieran cada día más. No cuenta con recursos propios es por esta razón que solicita a INTEGRAL este crédito con la confianza en Dios que los resultados van a ser favorables y su vida y la de su familia se van a ver beneficiadas gracias a sus esfuerzos.
texts.en: Sonia Maydeli Z. V. is 21 years old and lives with her parents.  Her mother is a housewife and her father buys and sells scrap metal.  They are a humble family with a variety of financial needs, but they work every day to improve their living conditions.  Sonia is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  She is well aware that the only way to get ahead and help her family is to work.  For the past few years, she has worked selling fruit at the turn for La Flecha in the Department of Morazán.  She tries to have a variety of fruit such as pineapple, banana, mango, watermelon, and others.  Her stand is located in a strategic area, as it is very frequented by area residents.  In addition, many people know and trust her because she always offers good quality products and customer service.  Her dream is to stock her stand so that her customers always find what they are looking for and they prefer her more and more.  She does not have resources, which is why she is requesting this loan from Apoyo Integral.  She trusts in God that the results will be positive and that her and her family’s lives will benefit from her efforts.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit such as pineapple, banana, mango, watermelon, and others

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma A. lives in the Naguru neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two orphans). Fatuma lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.   

Fatuma has a business of selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works six days out of every week. Fatuma sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Fatuma has requested  a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of cabbages, passion fruits and yellow bananas.   

She also generates additional income through selling piped water.

The main business challenges for Fatuma include transportation and the rainy season.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cabbages, passion fruit and yellow bananas

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 37 years old and married with a five-year-old child. He owns a bicycle which he uses as transportation to distribute bread. Joseph has been running his business for eleven years and has one employee. He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya for educating him about business management. As a result of his training, he has been able to improve his business.  

Joseph is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to add to his stock of bread. In the future, he hopes to own a bakery.

loans.use: to buy bread to distribute

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married woman living with her husband and one young child. She is from Lebanon. She has been working as a baker for over 15 years. She prepares delicious freshly baked goods. She cooperates with her husband who works as sweets distributor to earn good income in order to satisfy the family needs.

 With her requested loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, she will develop her shop and increase her productivity by renovating her tools and purchasing added products such as flour and thyme. She estimates that the loan will help her increase her profits by 15%.

loans.use: to renovate her tools and purchase added products such as flour and thyme.

loans.name: Estela Piedad

texts.es: La señora Estela, oriunda de la Colonia  San Carlos a unos 15 kilómetros de la  localidad de San José, su actividad es la venta de sucumbe bebida tradicional de la localidad, ella vende  en la feria de alasitas, convive con el sr. Jorge el cual es albañil tienen 1 hijo pequeño, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. estela comprara un refrigerador para poder conservar sus productos e insumos para la elaboración de sus sucumbes, es una persona responsable, la señora esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo económico que le brinda para tener una mejor calidad de vida y seguir adelante superándose.
texts.en:
Señora Estela is a native of the Colonia San Carlos neighborhood about 15 kilometers from San Jose. She works, including at the Alasitas Festival, selling sucumbe, the traditional beverage of the area.  She lives with Señor Jorge who is a bricklayer. They have one young son. 

With the money from this loan Estela will buy a refrigerator to conserve her products and the supplies she uses to make the sucumbes. She is a responsible person and is grateful to the institution for the economic assistance it has provided to help her have a better quality of life and to continue working to improve her situation.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
46-year-old Gemma is an entrepreneur from Surallah, South Cotabato. She earns a living by growing vegetables and raising pigs and chickens. Gemma sells her harvest and raised pigs at her town's local market. She sells chicken eggs as well.

Gemma's loan will be used to buy feed, vitamins and fertilizers. She hopes to have a productive business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and fertilizers.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans has operated a barber shop business for the past five years. His potential customers are neighbors and passers-by. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business: the number of customers visit his barber shop decreases during the rainy season. He dreams of establishing another barber shop in the future. 

Evans is unmarried and lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase four cartons of powder and two machines used in hair cutting. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase four cartons of powder and two machines used in hair cutting

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
54 year old Asaph's business philosophy emphasizes the virtues of hard work and perseverance. The last two years, this father of two has been showing his mettle in the cutthroat motorcycle transportation business in Bushenyi. He started bearing a hand in this business to earn his wherewithal for survival. Prior to that, he was engaged in the lucrative banana sales trade. He is still involved in the banana business because he is able to earn substantially from it. Therefore, he sees no reason to dispense with it. He has a banana plantation where he grows the bananas that he harvests and, at length, sells. 

It's only been two years in the motorcycle transport business for Asaph but, with his sky-high optimism, the sky may be the only limit! Success, he believes, is on the horizon. Among his other calling cards, his close friends speak highly of his tenacity, determination and his good-humored way of going about his business. Asaph says his weekly profit totals up to 70,000 Ugandan shillings. 

Asaph says he is going to purchase another motorcycle with this Kiva loan. He reckons this will enable him to earn more money than he currently does. When asked how he will operate two motorcycles concurrently, he gives an answer that most people with two or three motorbikes will vouchsafe:  his plan is to get a close, trustworthy relative to ride and operate his bike.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (orphans).  

Aisha has a beauty salon business.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week.  Aisha sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale trade. Aisha has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves.  

The main business challenges for Aisha include seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rents, school fees and   feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves

loans.name: Eléonora

texts.fr:
Eléonora est une femme  âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un gestionnaire. Elle a 03 enfants. 
Eléonora travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes teintés depuis 1999. Elle achète les produits à LOME. Elle travaille avec 01 personne.
Eléonora a requis son premier  cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes.
texts.en: Éléonora is 42 years old and the mother of three children. She is married to a manager. She has been a retailer of colored pagnes (West African cloth) since 1999. She buys her supplies in Lomé. She has hired one person. Éléonora came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy pagnes.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros, 47, has a grocery store. Her business arose as an alternative source of income for her home and she has now had it for over four years. Milagros has three grown children.

Most of her customers come to buy the various products she stocks, such as basic grains, snacks, soft drinks, juices, matches, salt and products for the home. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy the said merchandise.

Milagros dreams of continuing to grow her business and of increasing her inventory every day.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, drinks and spices.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.es: El señor Adrian tiene 40 años de edad, el es el tesorero de la alcancía comunal Ebenezer, esta alcancía tiene 7integrantes, todos son trabajadores responsables en cada uno de sus negocios. Adrian tiene su propio grupo musical que  se llama Instrumentos Musicales de Viento, el da presentaciones todos los fines de semana, con este trabajo ya tiene 15 años, y ha logrado con mucho esfuerzo darles lo mejor a sus dos hijos que ya se encuentran en la universidad, juntos con su conviviente tiene también el negocio de ventas de quenas y zampoñas, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a podido comprar su lote y construir su casa, con este ultimo préstamo piensa en comprar materiales y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en: Adrián, 40, is Treasurer of the “Ebenezer” communal bank.  This communal bank has seven members.  All are responsible workers in each of their businesses.  Adrián has a musical group called “Instrumentos Musicales de Viento” and he performs every weekend.  He’s been in this business for 15 years now.  Through much effort he’s managed to provide the best for his two children who are currently in university.  Together with his spouse he also has a business selling flutes and panpipes.  Thanks to his effort and dedication he’s been able to buy a lot and start to build his house.  He intends to use this last loan to buy building supplies and to enlarge his business.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 42 years of age and married. The couple have been blessed with five children. Nowadays, three of her children are still school-aged while two are already married. 

Marivic has been operating her charcoal sales for one year and she is able to earn P2,000 a month. She uses her income for their daily needs, allowances of children and payment of electric bills. She would like to improve her business so that she can send her children to college level of education.

In this regard, she is aiming to buy charcoal for her retail business but due to insufficient funds she is requesting a loan in the amount of P8,000. This amount would really help her to improve the business she manages. So she is hoping that she can maintain her business to be able to give her family a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for retail business.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel, a 30-year-old single mom with one child, lives in Cabgan, Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur, far from town and accessible only by boat. For the past six years, she has owned and managed a sari-sari store to earn a living, making about PHP 9500 each month.

A member of GDMPC for three years, Razel is requesting a loan of PHP 25000 to purchase goods for her store. She hopes to expand her business in the future and build a house.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Nilton

texts.es: Nilton, de 32 años, convive con Maribel de 28 años, viven juntos en casa propia junto a sus dos queridas hijas Katy y Nelly, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. Nilton, un hombre que se esmera por dar lo mejor a su familia, se ocupa haciendo movilidad en los anexos de la ciudad de San Francisco, lleva trabajando 05 años con lo cual logra dar el sustento a su familia. A diario sale muy temprano de su casa para que pueda captar pasajeros ya que hay mucha competencia con los compañeros de trabajo. A Nilton, le gusta su trabajo porque perennemente esta transitando en diferentes anexos de la ciudad de San Francisco y considera que lo más difícil es cuando hay días que no transitan pasajeros ya que es la necesidad de llevar un sustento a su vivienda. Pero aún así Nilton, esta dispuesto a seguir adelante ya que es la única forma de poder solventar a su familia. Su plan a futuro es en mejorar la construcción de su casa para así ofrecer seguridad a su familia. Este será su sexto crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en lo cual se siente muy agradecido. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, podrá comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, fierros.
texts.en:
Nilton, age 32, lives with 28 year old Maribel.  They live together in their own home with their two beloved daughters, Katy and Nelly.  The children are the motivation for their efforts.

Nilton is a man who tries very hard to give his family the best.  He works providing transportation in the annexes of the city of San Francisco.  He has been working five years, and with his work he has managed to support his family.  He leaves his house very early every day in order to be able to get passengers.  There is a lot of competition with his work colleagues.

Nilton likes his work because he is always traveling to different annexes of the city of San Francisco.  He feels that the days when he does not have passengers is the hardest part.  This is because he needs to have passengers in order to support his household.  However, Nilton is still prepared to get ahead because this is the only way to be able to support his family.  His plan for the future is to improve the construction of his house in order to give his family more security.  

This will be his sixth loan with MFP, and he plans to be very punctual with his payments.  He does not want to cause any problems for his communal bank, in which he feels very grateful.  He will use the 3,000 requested soles to buy construction materials like cement and iron.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice runs a food stall business in Kampala, Uganda. She has been in this business for two years, and she works six days out of every week. Eunice sells her products on a retail basis from her home. She and her husband have three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She also takes care of her sister.

Eunice has requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use her loan funds to buy more tomatoes, onions, bananas, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Eunice include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis and to start sales in neighboring villages.   

Eunice lives in a home that she owns: the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her primary monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, onions, bananas, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
La Sra. Clementina tiene 62 años y quedo viuda hace diez años, tiene tres hijos mayores Rossana, quien es Docente, Marlene es Abogada y Jimmy cursando actualmente el último año D. la carrera D. Derecho. 
Anteriormente poseían una despensa en su domicilio que no pudo mantener cuando quedo viuda, con los años y con los préstamos D. la fundación se dedico a la venta D. joyas. Comenta que tiene ya varios clientes que siempre compran D. ella las joyas que venD., por lo que le gustaría poder tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. joyas D. plata, con lo cual podrá aumentar la variedad que tiene y D. esa forma podrá atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
Clementina, 62, was widowed ten years ago.  She has three adult children: Rossana who is a Teacher, Marlene who is an Attorney and Jimmy who is currently in the last year of Law school.

They used to have a home-based grocery store but when she was widowed she was unable to keep it.  With the passage of the years and with loans from the Fundación she went into jewelry sales.  She comments that she has several customers who always buy the jewelry she sells from her so she’d like to have more variety available to offer her customers.

She asks for the loan to buy silver jewelry to increase the variety she has on hand in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy all sorts of silver jewelry for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
At age 19, Jonalyn got married. Now age 39, she is still married and blessed with three children. Her children are in high school and elementary school. Jonalyn's priority in life is to prepare for the college level of education for her children. She wants to see that her children will become professionals some day.

Jonalyn runs a rice-farming business with an area of five hectares. She and her husband manage their farm. She has been in this business since she got married. Jonalyn and her husband are conducting some field activities to minimize their labor expenses. Since they don’t have enough capital to hire laborers, Jonalyn is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers and herbicides, and pay for the labor costs of rice farming.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers and herbicides, and pay for the labor cost of rice farming.

loans.name: Candida Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Candida se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general tiene 50 años. Ya tiene 2 créditos con Fundación que le han ayudado para aumentar su inventario en su negocio. Con este  nuevo préstamo comprara ciertos artículos del hogar, calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general, prendas de oro y plata y ropa interior. Nos cuenta que negocio le está dando muchas satisfacciones, está viendo el fruto de su trabajo y se siente feliz porque puede ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Sra. Candida sells general merchandise. She is 50 years old.  She has had two loans with the Fundación which have helped her increase her business inventory.  With this new loan she will buy certain household items such as shoes, cosmetics, general clothing, gold and silver items and underwear. She tells us that her business gives her a great deal of satisfaction. She is seeing the fruit of her labor and she is happy to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy household items such as shoes, cosmetics, general clothing, gold and silver items and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase clothes and footwear.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 28 years old. He lives in the village of Bardubani (West Georgia) with his parents. Teimuraz works as a fitter in the village. He gets work fitting doors and windows. Along with his main job, Teimuraz is actively involved in family agriculture. The family has two milk cows. They produce cheese and sell it locally to dairy product retailers. The family also has a vineyard of one hectare. Teimuraz and his father make wine, which is sold on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Teimuraz has requested credit to finance some renovation works in his house. After the renovation, the family will enjoy better living conditions and after hard days of work, will be able to spend evenings in a better, more comfortable, house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for renovation of his house.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Thelma works hard to support her family. She has a peanut candy making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the buying and selling of livestock and from pig fattening. Thelma is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her peanut candy making business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 38 years old, married to Jennifer and they have three children. He has been in the business of water distribution using a hand cart for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He is applying for his first loan with KADETL ltd. of KES 20,000 to buy  a donkey for pulling the  cart. He was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. He hopes to use the profits to complete building his house and to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to own a water tanker to distribute water beyond his locality.

loans.use: To buy a donkey and a donkey cart for transporting water for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina Mujeres Luchadoras están en el Quinto Ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, con 19 integrantes. Es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables entre ellas, tienen un gran espíritu emprendedor para realizar actividades que les ayudan a fomentar su compañerismo.
Rosa es una de estas mujeres trabajadoras y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de Carbón. Dice que de un tiempo para acá el carbón tiene mucha salida, ya que hoy en día el gas es muy caro, por es monto este negocio y gracias a este ha podido ganarse el sustento diario. Su propósito es seguir ayudando a su familia, y hacer, por medio de su trabajo, que tengan una  vida digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carbón, y de esa forma tener en stock, para cuando su cliente se lo soliciten. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva, por la ayuda que les da.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called Mujeres Luchadoras.  The 19 members are in the fifth cycle of Fundación Paraguaya's program for women entrepreneurs.  It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very unified, supportive, and responsible.  They have a great entrepreneurial spirit to carry out work that helps them promote companionship among themselves.

Rosa is one of these hardworking women, and she tells us that she works selling charcoal.  She says that charcoal has been selling for some time because today gas is very expensive.  This is why she set up this business, and thanks to this she has been able to earn herself a daily living.  Her goal is to continue helping her family and, through her job, give them a dignified and decent life.

She is requesting the loan to buy charcoal to have in stock for when her customers ask her for it.  She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the help they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 23 year old married woman who supports 2 family members from Al Nasser Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for materials for making the sweet, She wants to increase her family income. In the future she is planing to open a shop for selling her products, she hopes to buy a home.
Since Hiba is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for materials for making the sweet

loans.name: Tharcisse

texts.en:
Tharcisse is 27 years old. He is married with 1 child age of 3 yeras, Not yet go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 4 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase his savings and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en: Financial constraints alongside the want for a better life and good quality education for her 4 children are only a few but valuable factors that encouraged our Nazeeran  to start her business selling animals by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation.  Nazeeran  is 47 years old; she is a married woman.  She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 30000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales

loans.name: Lili

texts.en: Lili is married with five children. Two children are working. Three are in school. Lili has a shop which started with her first loan in 2004. With sunsequent loans she has been able to expand the shop. On her previous loan she purchased stock, cememnt for the floor and a fridge. She also makes buns which she sells from her shop and around the village. Once a week she travels to a nearby village where bingo is held and she runs a store there. Her sales on that night are 100 buns and 50 donuts along with drinks. For this loan she needs to repair her car (Toyota Pickup) which is used for deliveries and to transport buns to the bingo evening.

loans.use: Repair motor vehicle and ingredients for baking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rosemary Wanjiku Munyua intends to buy animal feeds and other dairy supplements

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Mrs. Uch R. is 51 years old and is a mother of 5 children. She lives with her husband in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. To supplement the family's income, she and her husband raise pigs and other domestic animals. Pig raising is a main business of this couple and it typically contributes around $4/day in revenue. Three of their children are construction workers, while another one (pictured here because Uch R. is unavailable) is a student and cooks meal for her family.

Uch R. is asking for $1200 to increase the number of her pigs and to buy a simple motor-bike to transport pigs from and to market. With the increased number of pigs, this couple hopes to have enough money to improve her family's quality of life one day.

loans.use: To  purchase some more pigs to raise and a motor-bike to transport pigs to sell at the market

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice a young mother of two children. She is an active member of Gatangara Pluto women group. She is a responsible member of the group and she has benefited a lot from the group. She has a small retail shop which supports all her family basic needs although staining with small stock. She is hoping to get a loan and boost her small business and she believes one day it will be a wholesale business. She is willing to repay her loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Alice would like to add more stock for her small retail shop.

loans.name: Marleni Norma

texts.es:
The diligent search for a source of additional income has been a permanent and difficult task for Norma. After trying her luck at a variety of occupations, she decided to work in the area of agriculture and livestock; sowing potatoes, corn, and spruce. Her annual harvest have given her great satisfaction, as it has improved her family situation. Now that Norma has experimented, and acquired the necessary knowledge regarding these activities, she would to expand her activities, planting larger quantities of potatoes and corn so that she can increase her earnings next year and continue to improve her family’s quality of life. She would like to install a study room for her town youngest children who are still of school age. Norma is requesting a loan of $375 dollars in order to optimize and improve the quality of her product and her home. She has agreed to repay this loan within 6 months. She appeals to your good hearts in her request to make her dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

La diligencia y búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos adicional significó una tarea ardua y permanente para Norma. Luego de tentar suerte con muchas otras ocupaciones decide establecerse en la actividad agrícola y ganadera; las siembras de papa,maíz y capirona que realiza anualmente la han llenado de satisfacciones ya que gracias a esta actividad ha ido mejorando su situación familiar. Norma luego de haber experimentado y adquirido el conocimiento necesario respecto a esta actividad desea ampliar su campo de acción y sembrar mayor cantidad de papa y maíz para obtener el próximo año mayores ganancias y de esta manera seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia e ir implementando un cuarto de estudio para sus 2 menores hijos que aún se encuentran en etapa escolar .El pedido que hace Norma es por una suma de 375 dólares con los que desea optimizar y mejorar la calidad de sus productos y de su hogar; este monto se compromete a pagarlos en un lapso de 6 meses. Ella apela a sus corazones a fin de poder hacer realidad su sueño.
