loans.use: Credit request to plant fields of spruce, potatoes, and corn to earn more income.

loans.name: Ajao

texts.en:
Ajao R. is a dynamic man of 53 years. He is married and the father of 8 children. Ajao lives with his family in Attecoubé, a populated suburb in the northwest of the Abidjan district.. Ajao has been a butcher since he was 24 years old. Ajao's family is a happy family; all his children have been or are currently in school and are well educated. He considers sending all his children to school as a life challenge. Ajao does his business in the Attecoubé open market. He requests the loan  to purchase a couple of cows.
He has been in the AE&I microcredit program since June 2005 and has been an excellent performer since then.

loans.use: Ajao Rasaki will use the loan to purchase cows

loans.name: Camila

texts.en:
Camila is an experienced entrepreneur that has been selling ice cream for two years.  She has five children, two of them boys that have their own families.  The girls live with Mom.

Camila trusts in the power of persistence and hard work.  She says that everyone who needs to have success must struggle.  She purchases ice cream outside her community and resells them within her house, or sometimes close to a public school.

Camila is requesting a loan to purchase more goods and a small freezer.  The one she used to keep the ice cream in is not hers but rented.  She thinks that’s a good investment and that before long she can significantly increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Loan will be invested in the purchase of a small freezer for entrepreneur's business.

loans.name: Salamah

texts.en: Salamah is 42 years old and a mother of one child. Her husband, R., is a coolie at a workshop and earns very little. To provide extra income for the family, Salamah makes cakes upon order at her house, earning US$16 a day. She also makes and sells fried snacks. Salamah needs a loan of US$75 to increase her cake business capital. As a member of MBK, she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Increase of business capital

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina I., from Edo State, Nigeria, is married with 4 children. She is 41 years old and has been in the business of selling clothes since 1994.  She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Busanzi. A. North C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Olivia A.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more commodities. Olivia is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a police officer for work. She has 4 children ranging from age 3 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Olivia makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start a piggery business.

Olivia is joined in her small group by Esther N., Jesca N., Jane B., and Hanifa N.. Esther N. has a business buying and selling produce and wants to boost business. Jesca N. is currently operating a business selling rice and wants a loan to boost business. Jane B. operates a restaurant business and wants to purchase more utensils and foodstuffs. Hanifa N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add more food.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin is married and has two children, 7 and 3. He started the business because he needed an extra income to pay for operations that his children, both of whom were born with heart problems, had to have. His income before didn't cover all their expenses and his wife couldn't work because she had to care for the young patients. Though the kids are better today, they still need medical care. The business started 6 years ago with the sale of used clothes brought from the United States. Martin later expanded the business, adding new clothes, accessories, gifts, etc., which now generate larger revenues.

Martin is applying for a US$950 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to stock the business. With your help, Martin can continue his business and his children can continue to receive the medical treatment they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Martin E. es casado y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 años. Inició el negocio Por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso extra, ya que sus dos hijos nacieron con problemas en el corazón, y requerían de varias operaciones, y con lo que el ganaba no le alcanzaba, además su esposa no podía apoyar al gasto familiar ya que cuidaba a los dos menores enfermos, hoy en día aunque están mejor aun reciben atención medica. El negocio comenzó hace 6 años con la venta de ropa usada que traía de Estados Unidos. Posteriormente fue incrementando su negocio con la venta de ropa nueva, accesorios, regalos, etc. Y actualmente esto le genera mejores ingresos.

Solicita un crédito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para mantener surtido y estable el negocio. Con tu ayuda Martin seguirá con su negocio y sus hijos no suspenderán el tratamiento medico.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en: Faridah is a businesswoman who sells traditional attire called Kanga and Vitenge in Kariakoo.  She has been in business for the past five years, and her profits have helped her to place her five children in school, build her own house and sustain her living. She is now in need of a loan in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Vali

texts.en: Forty-one-year-old Vali V. breeds sheep in the Bilasuvar region. He has more than 15 years of experience in sheep breeding. Selling the sheep for meat is the main source of income to support his wife and five children. Vali works as builder, but this work is not permanent and he works only if any local people build new houses or cafés, which happens very rarely. He is applying for $1000 US to purchase 15 sheep and fodder. This loan will help him to increase his income because summer is high season for weddings and the main meal at that event is mutton.Vali has a good chance to improve his life condition by selling sheep during this period.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep

loans.name: Fazlidin

texts.en: A. Fazlidin is 21 years old. He is single with no children. He has been farming since he was 18. He has 3 years of experience, and has been able to support himself and his family by learning how to take care and manage his crops in the short growing season. His business includes growing and selling of vegetables such as: tomato, onion, potato, cucumber, carrot, cabbage. Thus due to the beginning of the sowing season he is planning to sow onion, potato and cabbage. Fazlidin would like to use this loan to purchase more farming implements such as seeds, mineral fertilizers and other necessities in order to appropriately manage his crops and in the end to make a good profit as in the nearest future he is planning to arrange his wedding by himself . Fazlidin is counting on your help. With your help he can achieve his goals.

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 39 years,She is a married woman with 2 children ages 18 and 12. She has been a bites seller since in february 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Farida has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business.Farida now hopes for a loan to buy and to makes more bites products for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokun K., 40, and her husband, Mr. Sokleang Lim, 45, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. One of their children is in school and the other two are of preschool age.

Mrs. Sokun and her husband have been selling Chinese noodles and coffee for two years, operating the business in the front of their house. This enterprise is doing very well due to its large daily volume of customers, but the restaurant is small, lacking an adequate number of chairs and tables to serve customers. Therefore, Sokun is requesting a loan of $1000 to expand her restaurant and purchase additional tables and chairs.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant.

loans.name: Celine

texts.en: Celine is a 40-year-old widow with five children who sells smoked fish and other foodstuffs like plantain and corn. Celine is the leader of a lending group represented by LAPO microfinance. She is seeking a loan of 850 USD to buy more cartons of fish to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible!

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish to sell

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula tiene 50 años, vive con Manuel su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte en su triciclo, y sus dos hijas María del Rosario D. 10 años y María Ángela que son gemelas y son su adoración. Ella se dedica a la venta D. fruta D. forma ambulatoria en su triciclo, ayudada por sus pequeñas hijas, desD. hace ya 10 años atrás. Paula desD. las 8 D. la mañana hasta las 4 o 5 D. la tarD. que es cuando la gente demanda el consumo D. la fruta, su optimismo hizo que saliera adelante por su familia, ya que todos la menospreciaban porque no sabía leer ni escribir, pero Paula demostró que con muchas ganas y fuerza se pueden conseguir las metas trazadas. Esta madre desea que sus dos hijas estudien y puedan defenderse en al vida y no pasen lo que le tocó vivir a ella en su juventud. El dinero que Paula solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. más fruta, para agrandar su negocio y en el futuro establecerse en un local fijo.
texts.en:
Paula is 50 years old and lives with her husband Manuel, who has a business where he transports and sells goods by tricycle. They have two 10-year-old twin daughters, María del Rosario and María Ángela, whom Paula adores. For 10 years, Paula has been a traveling salesperson, aided by her young daughters and selling fruit on her tricycle. Paula works from 8 am to 4 or 5 pm, which is when there is the greatest demand for fruit. Her optimism has enabled her to be successful for her family, since she cannot read or write and many people had underestimated her capabilities. However, Paula showed that, with great enthusiasm and strength, one can achieve their goals. This mother wants her two daughters to study, to be able to defend themselves in life, and not to have to experience what she herself had to deal with her in her youth. The loan that Paula requests will be invested in buying more fruit so she can grow her business and establish it in a permanent location.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of fruit she sells.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 44 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene tres hijos quienes alegran su existencia. Desde hace 8 años exactamente se dedica a la venta de comida y jugos, pero hace 12 años atrás que tiene una bodega a la cual le dedica mayor tiempo y la cual le genera mayores ingresos económicos. Le es muy rentable la venta de comida también,  pero dice que corre el riesgo que a veces se queda con el menú y entonces pierde, por ello que ha visto por conveniente incrementar más su bodega y dedicarse de lleno a ella. La dificultad es que cuando necesita salir de compras, no  tiene a quien dejar y en ese tiempo pierde clientes. Este es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado surtirá su bodega y va comprar panteones para la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Marina is 44 years old, she is married common-law, and she has 3 children who bring joy to her life. For exactly the past 8 years she has been selling fruit and juices. But it was 12 years aog that she her convenience store, to which she invests most of her time and it generates the most income. It is very profitable to sell foods also, but she says that she runs the risk that sometimes she doesn't sell out all the food and loses money. But she has seen that it would be best to expand her convenience store and dedicate her time completely there. The most difficult part is when she needs to go out to make her purchases. She doesn't have any staff and during that time she loses clients. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma (Kiva Field Partner). With the funds she has requested she will restock her convenience store and she will purchase holiday items for the Christmas season.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her convenience store.

loans.name: Karima

texts.en:
Karima A. is fifty years old, married and the father of five children. Presently all the kids are schooling. Karima lives at Atebubu in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana with his family. Atebubu is a community you would like to stay in because of its serene atmosphere and the unity that exists among the people in the community.

Atebubu is a farming area and the common thing that can found there apart from the food crops they cultivate, is the use of bicycles. Interestingly, almost everyone owns a bicycle; they ride it to their farm, school, etc. Karima is a professional bicycle repairer, and not only that, but he also sells bicycle parts. Karima has been in this business for the past 10 years. Through it, he obtains his daily income to support his family.

He travels to Kumasi which is a nearby town to purchase his bicycle parts. He wants this loan to buy more bicycle parts to restock his inventory to avoid daily trips. And he needs to have more parts to serve his customers. With the loan he believes he can have more resources to provide quality education for his kids. He is a member of a community group ‘The living God’ whose members guarantee for one another to access the loan and as social collateral to repay the loan. Karima would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bicycle parts for servicing bicycles

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chorn S., 28, pictured with her husband and her son, is the mother of two young children and lives in Siem Reap with her husband. Since 2000, she has been selling souvenirs in front of Angkor Temple to earn a living and is able to make US$ 10 in revenue a day, while her husband works as a police official and makes US$ 30 a month.

Mrs. Chorn S. is asking for a loan of US$ 600 to add to her inventory of souvenirs.

loans.use: To add to her inventory of souvenirs

loans.name: Mrs. Somnang Yang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people living in Kor village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Somnang Y., the 30- year-old village bank president, is a Khmer noodle seller. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she she decided to ask for a loan to add her capital to make more Khmer noodles to sell. She hopes to increase income and improve her family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Each Savoun, is a construction worker. Mrs. Somnang Y. has two children who are too young to work or study. She does not come to take a loan but her husband is, so he is presented in the picture instead her. 

Four members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Expand business making Khmer noodles

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар женщина 36 лет , замужем имеет одного ребёнка.Она работает в городской физ лечебнице,медсестрой.Муж работает водителем троллейбуса.Гавхар вместе с мужем занимается откормом и продажей крупно рогатого скота.У неё сейчас оборотный капитал состоит из трёх коров.Взяв кредит она вместе с мужем хочет купить ещё пару коров.
texts.en:
Gavhar is a 36 year old woman, she is married with one child. She works in the city's medical center as a nurse. Her husband works a trolly bus driver. Gavhar and her husband also raise and sell cattle. She has a working capital which consists of three cows. By taking out a loan she and her husband want to buy two more cows.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and sales of cattle

loans.name: Ahmadiyya Agriculture Secondary School, Newton Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Ahmadiyya Agriculture Secondary School, Newton, Waterloo.  It was built by the Ahmadiyya Mission in 1977 to spread education and the Ahmadiyya faith to the children of the district. It has a total of nineteen staff and 689 pupils. It is a co-educational school. Until last academic year, the school had only Junior Secondary School I – III (JSS I – III). Now, it has been elevated to a Senior Secondary School with only class IV (Senior Secondary School I) for a start.

Ahmadiyya Agriculture Secondary School makes good grades every academic year at the Basic Education Certificate Examination (BECE). Before its elevation to a senior secondary school, the school has been able to send many pupils to senior secondary schools every academic year. 

However, regardless of their good performance at the BECE, Ahmadiyya Agriculture Secondary school faces some major challenges – it lacks a library, a laboratory and a meeting hall. 

Since teachers usually receive very meager salaries, many of them find alternate ways of making a living. Some engage in businesses or agriculture, and others have organized extra classes for the pupils (though this is a practice the government is trying to abolish). Teachers are seeking a loan in order to embark on meaningful projects and then, out of their salaries, they will gradually repay the loan.

Alusine H. S. (second row third from right) is the principal of this school. He is fifty-eight years old. He was born in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, and is married with eleven children who attend the Junior Secondary School. He has been a principal of this school for over fifteen years.  Alusine will use this loan to buy house building materials like cement, corrugated iron, zincs and steel windows. He told me that this will create a very big impact in his life.

loans.use: Invest the loan in a house building project

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es: Alejo tiene 35 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Desde hace más de 15 año se dedica a las actividades ganaderas y agrícolas, aprendió desde su niñez, ya que proviene de una familia que se dedica a la agricultura. En la actualidad todo lo que ha aprendido le sirve para trabajar con toda su familia, sus hijos le ayudan a pastear los animales y en algunas otras tareas. A pesar de los problemas económicos que existieron en años anteriores por las pérdidas que sufrió, Alejo se orienta hacia un éxito en sus cosechas y la venta de sus animales porque ha llegado a ser capacitado con algunas charlas para progresar en su negocio. Para más adelante está pensando en mejorar su establo y sembrar más extensiones de terreno para aumentar sus ganancias. Es la segunda vez que Alejo viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, él se siente muy contento de formar parte de su banco comunal porque tienen reuniones con mucha coordinación y tratan de ayudarse entre todos con sus negocios. El dinero que ahora requiere es para la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizantes para su próxima etapa de siembra.
texts.en:
Alejo is 35 years old, lives in a house he owns with his wife and four children. More than 15 years ago he started working in farming activities, which he learned during childhood because he comes from a farming family. Currently, everything he’s learned helps him work with his family, his children help him feed the cattle and in other activities. In spite of the economic problems that happened in prior years due to losses he suffered, Alejo is moving towards success in harvest and the sale of livestock because he has been taking some training in how to improve his business. He is thinking to later on improve his farm and use more crop land to increase his profit. This is the second time that Alejo requests a loan from MFP, he feels very happy by being part of the community bank because they have well coordinated meetings and they try to help each other in their respective businesses. The money requested is to buy fertilizer for the next crop season.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Ramón Sánchez vive en la colonia central de piedras negras, Coahuila.
El es soltero y pensionado por incapacidad de trabajar por un accidente que tuvo trabajando en los Estados Unidos.
Tiene ya un proyecto realizándose pero le esta haciendo falta la compra y colocación de lamina en una estructura de un techo en la parte de atrás de su casita, motivo por el cual Don Ramón esta solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Ramón Sánchez lives in the central district of Piedras Negras, in the state of Coahuila. He is single and he receives a work disability pension due to an accident that he had while working in the United States. He already has a construction project underway, but he requires the purchase and installation of roofing material in order to continue with it. He would install this metal as roofing atop the structure he has built in the back part of his home. Completing this construction is the purpose for which Don Ramón is applying for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de lamina para estructura de techo

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en: F. Khurshed is 28 years old and is married with three children. Khurshed sells confectionery and other foodstuffs in the market and has been in this business already for two years. This activity generate the main income for his family. Since Khurshed is very popular in the market selling the fresh and tasty products, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today Khurshed requests $2,600 for the term of 12 months to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. The loan will greatly improve his income and his family's living standards. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more confectionary to sell

loans.name: Lỗ Thị

texts.en:
M. Lỗ Thị is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Mê Linh.  She is married and has 4 adult children.  To make a living, M. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  M. has been engaged in this business for more than 8 years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2000, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  M. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  M. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Isaura Margarita

texts.es:
La sñeora Isaura Margarita T. se dedica a su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en la ciudad de León y es de mucha importancia destacar que es muy visitada por los clientes a los cuales los atiendo muy amablemente al punto que ellos se sienten muy satisfechos con el negocio.

Con muchos deseos de crecer y desarrollarse en el negocio, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las frutas y verduras y de esta manera mejorar su negocio logrando siempre la satisfacción de todos y cada uno de sus clientes en el negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Isaura Margarita T. is dedicated to her business of selling fruits and vegetable in the city of León, and it is important to point out that she is visited very often by the clients, who she served with great friendliness to the point that they feel very satisfied with her business.

With many desires for growth and development in her business, she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan for purchasing fruits and vegetables and in this way improve her business, in order to always achieve the satisfaction of each and every one of her clients in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en:
Here are Kadiatu C., Kadiatu K. and Aminata K.. These local entrepreneurs from small-town Waterloo named their group Hope to God. This will be the first loan they are accessing from SMT/Shine on Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, both in terms of size and of quality. This will enable them to make more sales, improve profit and consequently improve their standards of living.

Kadiatu C. (right) is the leader of this group. Kadiatu is 40 and married to a farmer. The two of them have seven children. Four of their children are now adults and three are still in school. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman in Waterloo for many years now. She sells fertilizers, beans, ginger, corns, greens and so on.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena D. S. is a 44-year-old woman who is determined to step out of poverty. She is married to Crisanto, who is 44 years old and her business partner. She is mother to four kids: one daughter and three sons. She lives in Jala-jala, Rizal province in the Philippines.

Aspiring to improve the well-being of her family, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2001. She has invested previous loans in fishing gear, which brought her good proceeds.

Now on her 5th loan, she seeks a loan of 30,000 pesos to pay for fish nets, to buy a boat and a second-hand engine for the boat.

With the access to capital provided by ASHI and KIVA, she is hopeful that she can step out of the spiral of poverty. She dreams of sending her children to college so they can find jobs for better living, and she also hopes to expand her business someday.

loans.use: To pay for fish nets, a boat, and a second-hand engine for the boat.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 32 years old and married with two children. She lives in the state of Lagos in Nigeria. For the past five years, she has sold books, stationeries and drinks. Esther is requesting the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more books and stationeries to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more books, stationeries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en: Berth is 35 years old she is married and mother with four children. Currently all are schooling in the community where they live. They are very humble family who wants to invest in their children future by providing them with quality education.  She is a petty trader and sells item like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked, cassava, plantain and dried fish’s, tin tomatoes, bags of rice etc. Selling of these products, she says they move very fast and you can easily recover your money to restock. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi. With her four years experienced in her business she wants to add other stuffs like maize, eggs and others which are frequently demanded by her customers. She says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like cooking oil, bags of rice spices and tin tomatoes etc.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Santa Rosa, ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
 
Al igual que la mayoría de hombres del lugar, se dedica eventualmente a la pesca de Anchoveta, pero la temporada de pesca de esta especie empieza en noviembre y sólo dura un mes, por este motivo hace tres años empezó un negocio de distribución de pescado fresco que le ayuda a sostener económicamente a su familia durante las temporadas de veda.
 
El va tres veces por semana hacia el terminal ECOPHINSA (terminal pesquero de la ciudad) para comprar pescado a las cámaras frigoríficas que vienen a desembarcar en el lugar y luego distribuirlo a las ciudades de Jaén y Bagua.
 
Las condiciones climáticas que se han venido dando en la zona durante los últimos meses han derivado en una escacez de pescado, lo que ha causado un incremento en el costo de las principales especies que se comercializan en la región, Juan Manuel, ante esta situación se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 900 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más pescado para mantener su negocio.
 
A largo plazo el desea comprar su propia cámara frigorífica para distribuir más pescado y transportarlo con mayor facilidad sin tener que pagar otro tipo de servicio, por ahora las ganancias que percibe de su negocio las está invirtiendo en la construcción de su casa, para ofrecerle un techo seguro a sus menores hijos.
 
Juan Manuel es una persona muy querida y estimada por sus vecinos, ellos lo consideran un padre de familia alegre, honrado y trabajador.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel, 37, heads a household which includes his wife and four children living in Santa Rosa, some 25 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. Like many in the region, he makes his living from fishing anchovies, but the open fishery season only lasts one month, starting in November. For this reason, three years ago he began a business to distribute fresh fish, an activity that helps sustain his family during the rest of the year. Juan Manuel goes three times per week to the fishing terminal of his city (ECOPHINSA) to buy fish brought in to market for refrigeration; he then distributes the fish to buyers in the cities of Jaén and Bagua. Due to climactic and other factors, the region's fishery is in decline, which has led to increased prices for the main commercial fish species. These difficutlies are why Juan Manuel is seeking a loan for 900 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, so as to be able to buy more product and sustain his business. In the long term, he hopes to buy his own refrigerated container to distribute fish and transport the product more easily without paying others for this service; in this way he could save more on costs and invest additional income in improvements to his house to better care for his children and family. Juan Manuel is a respected man in his community and considered both honorable and hard-working.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fresh fish for distribution and resale

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Maricel is 50 years old and she is managing a sari-sari store (community based store) in their village for almost seven years.  She plans to expand her business by borrowing a loan from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP10,000.  The loan will be used to buy different grocery items and fruits for her store.  She hopes that the loan will be granted for her to pursue her business plans.  

Her husband is a farmer and they were blessed with four children: Nancy- 21 years old, accounting graduate; Nolita- 19 years old, 3rd year college; Ofelia- 17 years old, a pastor, and their youngest is Arlene- 15 years old, 4th year high school student. They are residing in Sillawit, Cauayan City, a semi- urban and plain area.

loans.use: Additional Capital in her Retail Store

loans.name: Sarah Jepkorir

texts.en:
Sarah is 40 years old, married to John and blessed with five children. Her retail business is located at the Junction in Eldoret. She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by a friend. With the loan Sarah plans to add stock to her business, including sugar, plastic, jericans, rice and cooking fat. In the future she aspires to grow her business and provide financial support for her children.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase additional retail stock.

loans.name: Creselda

texts.en:
Creselda R. is from the village of Lucsoon Tudela Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Creselda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Creselda raises pigs for sale. Creselda has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Creselda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Creselda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Creselda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Creselda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sohirdjon

texts.en: G. Sohirdjon is 52 years of age. Since he was young his father taught him to work on the land where, together, they produced wheat, corn and different kinds of vegetables. This constitutes the economic base of the settlers of Kumsangir due to the characteristic botany of the zone. For five years Sohirdjon has been dedicated to the production of corn and onions as his main economic activity and this activity has permitted his family to move forward. At present Sohirdjon is requesting a loan of $3000 USD that he will use for buying agricultural supplies in order to have a better harvest and be able to sell his crops for a better price in the market. Sohirdjon is counting on your help. He deeply appreciates the support that you are giving him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy and on time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mawuto Kayi

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente des produits d’alimentation générale dans sa boutique, dans le quartier d’Ahligo à Lomé. Sa boutique est très visitée par le voisinage qui trouve dans sa boutique tout ce dont ils ont besoin. Elle vend certaines liqueurs, du lait liquide, des pâtes alimentaires, de la mayonnaise, des savons de toilettes et bien d’autres produits. Pour disposer d’un nouveau stock, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter un nouveau réfrigérateur pour bien conserver ses produits frais ; le prêt servira également à acheter 10 bidons d’huiles d’arachide et divers autres produits nécessaires à sa clientèle.
texts.en:
This woman sells general foodstuffs in her store in the Ahligo neighborhood in Lome as an income generating-activity.Her store is much frequented by the neighbors who find all the items they need in her store. She sells some liquor, some fluid milk, pasta, mayonaise, bathroom soaps and other products. In order to have new stock, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy a new referigerator to conserve well her fresh products. The loan will also be used to buy 10 gallons of peanut oil and other basic miscelleneous products for her cleintele.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general foodstuff.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn C. is 40 years old and lives in Pour village in Takeo province. Her husband, Mr. Uch Sam Ol, is a soldier. They have four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, one of whom is a construction worker, and the other two of whom are enrolled in the local school.
Mrs. Sorn C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces some problems because her soil is infertile, it has a lot of insects, and it is far from an irrigation system. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline to pump water to support the field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline to pump water

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Salome es soltera, tiene 63 años y 3 hijos, Salome vende gas propano en su casa además realiza las ventas a domicilio, para lo cual cuenta con personal que se encarga del reparto, el gas lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Salome necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de balones de gas.
Los sueños de Salome son mejorar su negocio, tener mas puntos de ventas y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Salome belongs to the Obreras (Working Women) Village Bank. She is 63, single, and has three children. She sells propane gas from her home and also makes deliveries to her customers, for which she has an assistant. She gets her products from Lima. She needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll invest in cylinders of gas. Salome's dreams include improving her business, having more places to sell her products, and buying a car to transport them.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cylinders of gas.

loans.name: Progressive Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
S. Joseph is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is a hardworking man and a businessman with multiple businesses including a boda boda (motorbike taxi) business. He also buys and sells agricultural produce, he is a builder and has a retail shop at his home which is mostly managed by his wife with the help of his children.

Joseph has four children and he hopes to see all of them attain the best education even through to university so that they can have a better life than the one they are living today. Joseph needs this first loan to be able to expand his business by restocking his retail shop with more goods as well as to buy more agricultural produce and greens for resale.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop and to buy more agricultural produce for resale

loans.name: Julia Justina

texts.es:
Julia M. O., Labora como Conserje en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez.

 El tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y estos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de dos verjas para las ventanas de su casa por lo que anteriormente solo era cerrada con persianas.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julia M. works as a custodian in the "Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez," and is a single mother with two school-aged children. She has had prior loans through CEPRODEL and has been able to improve her home, thanks to the loans she has obtained through CEPRODEL. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy two railings for the windows in her home, as before she only had blinds. This will provide better security and better living conditions for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Railings for her windows

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en: Mostafa is a 21-year-old single man. He has been working as an electrician for the past 5 years. With his business income, he helps his father support the household. Working on a freelance basis, he manages part of house-building projects in his town and its surroundings. With the help of the loan requested, US$ 1,000, he can manage to expand his business by buying tools to better satisfy the needs of the market and increase his business to earn a good income.

loans.use: buying tools

loans.name: Jodie Janet

texts.es: Jodie tiene  32 años, vive con su esposo y sus  2 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace mas de 15 años  vende  todo tipo de ropa  en las mas variadas  telas y colores, le gusta ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes. Almacena su mercadería en la casa de uno de sus familiares, después reparte de acuerdo a los pedidos que tiene durante el mes  y de esta manera cada día busca que progresar para obtener mayores ingresos. Paralelamente al comercio, se dedica a la enseñanza, porque es profesora, y siempre ofrece a sus colegas de trabajo lo ultimo que trae en mercadería, además tiene buenas ganancias económicas porque compra sus prendas al por mayor en una  fabrica de la ciudad. En los próximos meses tiene planeado instalar una tienda de  ropa cerca de su casa.Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con  MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible que acceda al préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando.Jodie tiene pensado utilizar el dinero solicitado en la compra de prendas de vestir como pantalones, polos, ropas interiores, colchas y cubrecamas que le han pedido en gran cantidad.
texts.en:
Jodi is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 children in her own home. For more than 15 years, she has sold every type of clothing in the widest variety of fabrics and colors. She likes offering the best to her customers. She stores her merchandise at the house of a relative and later she delivers it according to the orders she has had during the month. In this way, she seeks a way to get more income every day. While she has this business, she also teaches. She is a teacher and she always offers her work colleaugues the lastest merchandise. She has good profits because she buys her clothing wholesale from a city factory. In the coming months, she plans to set up a clothing store near her house. This is the third time that she has had a loan with MFP and she is very grateful to all of the people who made it possible for her to access the credit that will allow her to continue working. Jodie plans on using the money she has asked for to purchase clothing such as pants, polo shirts, underwear, and blankets and bedspreads that have been requested a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase a greater quantity of clothing merchandise

loans.name: Houssie

texts.fr: Née en 1963 à Adjohoun dans le département de l’Ouémé, A. Houssie vit depuis 25 ans au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Houssie est mariée à AHOLOUKPE Innocent et est mère de trois enfants, dont deux sont à sa charge. Houssie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari ; et vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les différentes charges familiales. Houssie n’a pas été à l’école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Houssie prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs, pâte de tubercule d'igname, accompagnés de divers sauce de tomate) à son domicile, depuis 14 ans environs. Houssie se ravitaille à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Houssie a reçu auparavant deux prêts de ALIDé et les a tous bien remboursés. Houssie sollicite un troisième prêt pour rehausser son activité et augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, et par ricochet, son revenu.
texts.en:
Born in 1963 in Adjohoun in the Ouémé Department, Houssie A. has been living for the past 25 years in the Agbodjèdo borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Houssie is married to Innocent AHOLOUKPE and is the mother of three children, of which two are under her care. She lives with her children and husband, whom she assists regarding the various family expenses. She has not attended school. To meet her needs over the past 14 years, Houssie has prepared and sold food preparations from her home (rice, cornmeal mush, yam tuber mush, accompanied by various tomato-based sauces). She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Houssie has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, both of which have been repaid in full. She is now requesting a third loan to increase her activity and consequently her income.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of rice, yam tubers and sauce condiments

loans.name: Laura Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Laura Cristina tiene ya mas de un año dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de manzanas decorados. 
 Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de producto, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario, es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así poder comprar el material y tener mas variedad y su negocio tendrá más ingreso.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su esposo el señor Fausto Francisco Gutiérrez, quien trabaja como guardia de seguridad de una compañía.
texts.en:
For more than a year, Laura Cristina has been making and selling candy apples. Her business needs a greater variety of products, but she does not have the necessary money. For this reason she requests a loan to buy raw materials so that she can have a greater variety of products, and so that her business will generate more income. She plans to pay off the loan with the profits from her business since her husband, Fausto Francisco Gutiérrez, is in charge of covering the household expenses. He works as a security guard for a factory.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw material to make candy apples

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana S. is from the village of Mabuhay, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Susana buys agricultural crops such as cassava and banana from their neighboring village and sells it in the city. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $80 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Susana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional crops and part was for working capital. 

Susana is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more cassava and banana to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and banana to sell

location.town: Mabuhay, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines) Pakistan, is the wife of A. G. and the mother of a five-year-old son in 2nd standard and a seven-year-old daughter in 4th standard . She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 10 years.

A very caring and active lady, Shahnaz operates a livestock business, raising and then selling the animals to her neighbors. Her business provides major support to her family. Her husband, meanwhile, sells fruit on his four-wheeled cart by going to various areas of the community, an enterprise he has been operating for over six years. Shahnaz is now requesting a loan from Asasah so her husband can purchase seasonal fruits in bulk and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma O. is from Barangay Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 57 years old and married, with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma runs a general store, selling food and daily use products in the local community. Wilma also sells fruit such as mangoes. Wilma has been engaged in her business for more than 25 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Wilma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her product offering

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia R., 37, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Eleneto R., 41, a jeepney driver, they have two children.  She has always been challenged to provide the daily needs for her family. She makes sure that she earns well so that her family can have a better life. She has been into direct selling of branded apparel, and popular brands of cosmetics and toiletries for some time now. Sonia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying additional items and advance orders of her patrons.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide an education for her children. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Bushra Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Bushra Bibi lives in a city called Vehari, in Pakistan. She is the mother of three sons and none of them could continue their education due to financial reasons. Her husband runs a scrap business and she does embroidery works to financially support the family. 

Bushra Bibi has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who wants to expand his business by adding more scrap supplies for his shop. 
She wants to educate her children and she hopes that she can do it by increasing their household income.

loans.use: Purchase scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Enrique, de 42 años de edad, vive en compañía de su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a brindar servicio de movilidad con su moto carro, para ello cuenta con una empresa formal. Desde entonces empieza a trabajar por las mañanas, ofreciendo este servicio a los niños que acompañados de sus madres van a la escuela raudamente, durante el día transporta a todos los transeúntes que requieran de sus servicios. Afirma que este año no ha tenido mayores riesgos; por lo que se siente muy tranquilo, además las ganancias son regulares que le ayudan a sustentar a su familia. Para el futuro tiene planeado retomar el trabajo en el campo ya que necesita de capital para comprarse otra moto. Para él, es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que sabe que le será muy útil para seguir trabajando con su moto carro. Piensa invertir el crédito que solicita en la compra de llantas para cambiar las que tiene su moto para que pueda trabajar sin problemas.
texts.en:
Enrique is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children. His business is providing transportation services in his moto-car. He has recently started working in the mornings, offering this service to mothers taking their children to school. During the day he transports anyone else who needs his services. He tells us that he has not had to take many risks this year and he is relaxed. His income is steady and it helps him to support his family. In the future he plans to restart working in the fields because he needs capital to buy another motorcycle. This will be his first loan through MFP and he is committed to making his payments on time, because he knows that the money will be very useful for him to continue working with his moto-car. He will use the money from this loan to replace the tires so that he can work without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tire replacement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To carry out home improvements.

loans.name: Then

texts.en: Then T. N. was born in 1981. She is married with two children (a son and a daughter). She has a shoe shop in the market. Her husband is a businessman. They have a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and has repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to expand her shoe shop.

loans.use: to expand her shoe shop

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio pertenece al Banco Comunal Pureza hace 8 meses.
Rocio es soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, vive en casa alquilada, Rocio tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, tiene 3 personas que le ayudan en la preparación y atención, actividad que realiza todos los días, negocio que inicio hace 2 años, además Rocio vende salchipapas en la noches.
Rocio necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles para la compra de ollas y platos.
Los sueños de Rocio son implementar una polleria y abrir una sucursal en la provincia de Huanta.
texts.en:
Roció, 26, has been a member of the Pureza (Purity) communal bank for 8 months. She is single and has a son. She lives in a rented house. Roció has a restaurant in a rented locale. She has three employees that help prepare the food and provide customer service. She is open for business every day. She started the business 2 years ago. In addition, she sells Salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausages) at night. Roció needs a 1500 sol loan to buy pots and dishes. Her dream is to open up a poultry shop and a branch in Huanta province.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots and dishes.

loans.name: Marialou

texts.en: Marialou A. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 27 years old. Marialou is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Marialou runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products and also dried fish in the local community. Marialou has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Marialou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marialou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Marialou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. Single with one child, for the past three years Justine has had a business selling food and vegetables. She also sells firewood and is employed in a salon.

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more food, vegetables and firewood. With the help of this loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Justine hopes to own a house and another business.

Justine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by granting a loan without collateral requirements.

loans.use: To buy more food, vegetables and fire wood.

loans.name: Astamaiya

texts.en:
Astamaiya D. is 50 and married with three children aged 27, 25 and 18. In 2000, she established her furniture-making business. Working seven days a week, 9 hours a day, she suports her family. She has already received, and successfully repaid, three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase wood and timber. In the future, Astamaiya plans to send her children to private school. She thanks you for your support.    

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way. Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans make raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture. With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets. With the help of a Kiva loan, a a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of lumber purchases or hire additional labor. This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Hulda Achieng

texts.en:
Hulda W. is 28 years old and is married to Solomon. They have four children: Belinda, 11; Lector, 9; Faith, 6; and Grace, 2.

Hulda runs a retail shop in the Kanyamboni area on the outskirts of Kisumu. She has been running it for the past two years. Hulda is applying for her first loan from Kadet Ltd after being introduced by a friend.  She plans to add more stock of soap, sugar, salt etc. to her shop. 

Her desire is to see her business expand and open up a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: Increase stock in her shop.

loans.name: Carlos Elias

texts.es:
Carlos Elias  M. M. tiene 24 años. Es casado  vive la esposa y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas  se dedican a la agricultura esta ventanilla se encuentra a 45 minutos de San Miguel en el Ríos a la Costa, todos los miembros viven en el mismo recinto, la mayoría de los socios trabajan en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas en esta ventanilla son aproximadamente 10 miembros.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, frejol, trigo y papas, realiza las compras en La Parroquia San Pablo y vente en el mercado San Pablo.  

Solicita el crédito para la comprar se suministros y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener un trabajo estable y comprar un  terreno para hacer la casa para la familia.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas patronales del recinto y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Elias M. M. is 24 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two children in the canton of San Miguel, located in the Bolívar province.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group work in agriculture and the group is located 45 minutes from San Miguel in Ríos a la Costa. The group consists of approximately 10 members, all of whom live in the same area and the majority work growing corn, wheat and potatoes.

Carlos works in agriculture growing corn, beans, wheat and potatoes. He makes his purchases in the San Pablo parish and makes his sales at the San Pablo market.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of supplies and fertilizers for his crops. The loan support will help him financially to meet his needs. His dream is to have a stable job and to purchase a piece of land to make a house for his family.

He likes to participate in the community celebrations and spend time with his family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Genel

texts.en:
Mrs. Genel P. is from the Barangay of Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old, married to Dexter P. and blessed with 1 child of infant age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in load retailing particularly on SMART & GLOBE. Her husband is also earns income from his driving activity. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for 1 year already. She earn's an average amount of not less than P1,000.00 a month from this kind of business. 

Just this year, Genel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genel as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reached out to rural communities, has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php5,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php7,000.00 as her 1st loan which will be used for the financing of her hog raising activity and additional capital for her load retailing business. The future income of this business will be used to meet their basic needs, child’s education and loan repayments. She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

 About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Financing for her hog raising and additional capital for her cell phone card load retailing business

location.town: Ozamis-Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Nhoeb

texts.en:
Nhoeb C. is 25 year old married woman and mother. She and her family have been living in Phnom Penh City of Cambodia.

She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crop on her land, such as cabbages and cucumbers, which she sells to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. Her husband has grown these crops with her. The couple is married and has two school-aged children.

In the past, Nhoeb C. has always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to alleviate the chore of plowing the farmland. Right now, she hopes to buy her own cow and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. She hopes to use the rest of fund for buying fertilizers, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To buy a new cow, fertilizers, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Pro Desarrollo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Pisac district of the province of Calca.

Her name is Eulalia, and she is 35 years old.  Eulalia is married and has three children.  She requested her loan of $100 to invest in her business in the sale of vegetables.  Each day, she will sell her vegetables from a stall in the Pisac market, and will purchase more inventory with her loan.

loans.use: To invest in  a vegetable business

loans.name: Erikanjeru

texts.en: Erikanjeru is 62 years old, married with six children, and living in his own house in Fort Portal Uganda.  Strongly motivated to secure a sustainable income for his family, Erikanjeru has been farming for 20 years, and with the income generated he was able to educate most of his children. Now seeking business diversification, he is requesting a loan to to buy a motorcycle in order to enter the transportion sector.

loans.use: Buying a mortorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Hugo Roberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Hugo Roberto; el tiene 44 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de hospedaje, el es propietario de un negocio de hospedaje que trabaja desde las 5:00 hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio tiene un hospedaje donde llegan extranjero nacionales e internacionales, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el hospedaje. El  socio solicita el préstamo para implementar el hospedaje.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "El Molinito II". The bank is located in the Cusco district, which is in the province and department of Cusco.
The member's name is Hugo. He is 44 years old and single. He alternates his household work with a business running a hostel. He is the proprietor, and he works from 5:00am until 7:00pm. He has a hostel that is visited by Peruvian and international guests. He wants to expand and improve the hostel so he is requesting a loan to do this. 
The member is happy to have the loan and promises to abide by the repayment schedule.

loans.use: El  socio solicita el préstamo para implementar el hospedaje.

loans.name: Reli Group

texts.en:
Fatuma S., in her mid twenties, is married and has twin daughters. She has been selling clothes door-to-door for three years now. She works from 2.00pm to 4.00pm, just two hours. This is because, she goes to deliver the clothes to customers when her children go to school and she collects her dues at the same time. She then hurries home before they come back from school.

This will be Fatuma's loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to save for school fees. Her dreams is to build a house of her own. Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group, Reli, which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Fatuma is 1st on the left in an orange dress.

loans.use: To save for school fees.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Sra M.  labora como Afanadora es soltero, tiene un hijo a su cargo,  es el No. 2 del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que  le ha dado esta institución con  este  desembolso para   comprar materiales como  alambre, grapa, caja,  para cambiar sistema eléctrico de su viivienda.
texts.en: Munguia is a laborer. She has one son in her care and it is the second loan she accesses through Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner). She is thankful for the support that this organization has given her. With this loan she will purchase materials such as wiring, staples, and boxes to change the electrical system of her house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Jose Francisco A. T. tiene 46 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Jose  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jose Francisco A. T. is 46 years old. He is married, he has 5 children, and he lives with his wife and their single children in Guaranda, a canton of the Bolívar province.

He is a member of the V.R.C. Grupo Enmanuel, a village bank located in San Juan, a precinct of the Guaranda canton. This bank has 17 members who work as farmers engaging in cultivating short cycle varieties of maize, wheat and potatoes in large quantities, as well as in breeding of animals such as pigs and hens.

Jose engages in agriculture, growing maize and breeding pigs and hens. He buys the products to feed his animals in the Comercial Silva every week-end, and he sells his animals every Thursday in the Guarada fair.

The loan he is requesting will be used to sow maize, wheat and potatoes, to purchase animals, and to buy feeding and cropping supplies. The loan will economically help him fulfilling his needs, facing challenges such as pests, plant illnesses and climate changes. He dreams of owing a house.

He likes practicing sports.

loans.use: To sow maize, wheat and potatoes, to purchase animals, and to buy feeding and cropping supplies.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SOL Y LUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Mario; él tiene 52 años de edad y es separado y tiene 3 hijos; el socio tiene un carrito el cual lo trabaja brindando el servicio de taxi el trabaja de lunes a domingo durante todo el día pero su horario puede variar de acuerdo a las actividades que pueda tener, el es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por sus hijos que ya son mayores pero igual el sigue apoyándolos en lo que necesitan.

El socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro y para la compra de algunos accesorios que le faltan.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Mario, 52, is a member of the SOL Y LUNA” (Sun & Moon) communal bank that’s located in Cusco District which is in Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

He is separated and has three children. He has a car that he uses to provide taxi services all day Monday through Sunday.  His schedule can vary according to the activities he might have.  He is quite a cheerful person with much drive to get ahead with his children who, though they are adults already, he still continues to support with whatever they need.

He is asking for the loan to service his car and to buy some accessories he needs.  He is happy with the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to service his car and buy some accessories he needs.

loans.name: Zemfira

texts.en: Zemfira H. lives in Arpy with her husband. She works at the village hall as a staff secretary. She has a croft and is engaged in farming. She is also engaged in beekeeping and has thirty beehives. Her husband doesn’t work, so she wants to increase the number of beehives to get more income. With the requested loan she plans to purchase more beehives in order to get more income from selling honey. This will let Zemfira develop her beekeeping business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more beehives

loans.name: 040706 Thanh Xuan - Hoang Truong Group

texts.en:
"Thanh N. Thị (70) is a 37 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Thanh is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 040706 Thanh Xuan - Hoang Truong (040706 Thanh Xuan - Hoang Truong).


Thanh is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Thanh operates a family member's business selling confectionery products in the local community.  Thanh has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thanh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Anh (75) is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


2.  N. Thị Bình (37) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


3.  N. Thị Tâm (59) is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


4.  Lê Thị Tháp (68) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
