Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thanh N. Thị (70) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Thanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 040706 Thanh Xuan - Hoang Truong (040706 Thanh Xuan - Hoang Truong).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thanh kiếm được khoảng 2,500,000 VND.  Vào 2003, Thanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Anh (75) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  N. Thị Bình (37) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  N. Thị Tâm (59) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  Lê Thị Tháp (68) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cornelius Moturi

texts.en:
Cornelius has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last four years. He is 35 years old, married to Christine Nyamboke and has five children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all his previous loans on time. He plans to use this loan amount to buy seed and fertilizer.

In the future, Cornelius hopes to become a leading farmer in the Naivasha area.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 32 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Sinesio de 35 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Ángela la venta de bebidas típicas de la región es un negocio muy rentable, ya que tiene una carretilla en la cual transporta sus bebidas y debido al gran movimiento comercial de la ciudad de Pucallpa siempre vende mucho, ella es una persona muy alegre y siempre realiza sus ventas con una sonrisa bien grande. Lleva 5 años en el negocio y menciona que le complace conversar con sus clientes, ya que mediante ellos se puede enterar de las bebidas que más les gusta, sin embargo implica tener que caminar todo el día le resulta muy trabajoso. En adelante desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender de todo y no solo limitarse a ofrecer bebidas típicas, por ello espera de su ayuda para que pueda concretar sus planes. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en su primera cuota y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre les da consejos a las demás socias. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más frutas para la preparación de bebidas, y ofrecer una mayor variedad de bebidas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ángela is 32 years old.  She is a gracious, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Sinesio, 35, and their three beloved children that she wants to provide with a better quality of life.  For Ángela, selling traditional, regional beverages has been a very profitable business.  She has a cart that she uses to transport her beverages and due to the large amount of commercial activity in the city of Pucallpa she always sells a lot.  She is a very cheerful person and she always carries out her sales with a really big smile.  She’s been in business for 5 years and she mentions that she enjoys chatting with her customers because she learns from them which beverages are the ones they like best.  However, this implies having to walk all day and that is quite laborious.  She’d like to have a store later on where she can sell a bit of everything and not limit herself just to typical beverages.  Because of this, she hopes to receive help from you so that she can make her plans a reality.

This is her second loan with MFP.  He was very punctual with her first repayment and expects to be so again now.  She is very cheerful in her communal bank and always ready to give advice to the other members.

She will use the requested 800 new soles to buy more fruit for her beverage preparation and offer a wider variety of beverages to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is 29 years old, married, and has two children.  They live in the Philippines. Geraldine has a shop that sells snacks especially polvoron, a common dessert similar to shortbread. She has had this business for five years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients like flour, milk powder, and candy cellophane. Geraldine is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Geraldine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like flour, milk powder, and candy cellophane.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 56 years old and married with six children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past eight years, Emelia has operated a shop where she sells bread, biscuits, and beverages. 

Emelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy bread, biscuits, and snacks. In the future, Emelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bread, biscuits, and snacks

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is currently in school. Mary has a business selling clothes, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Mary hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Mary hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty‘s group is comprised of four hardworking women. Betty is 22 years old and lives in the town of Bulengga in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Betty has a business of a poultry farm, which she has had for one year.  She also has a boutique that sells clothes as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase chicken and its feeds for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  In the future, Betty hopes to own a supermarket. Betty is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving in her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken and its feeds for resale.

loans.name: Señor De Muruhuay De Huayaringa Group

texts.es:
L.  Alcancía Comunal “SEÑOR D. MURUHUAY D. HUAYARINGA” es un nuevo grupo que están dispuesto a trabajar en equipo, y está conformado por 09 mujeres emprendedoras y comprometidas con el Programa- Prosperidad.
Obdulia    tiene 33 años D. edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos elL. junto a su familia  radican en un centro poblado D. Huayaringa. Obdulia lleva 08 años  dedicándose  a L. confección D. accesorios como colchas, chompas, chalinas, entre otros, que son tejidos en hilo y lana, gracias a su trabajo  ha podido ayudar a su esposo  aportando con los gastos del hogar y con los estudios D. sus menores hijos. El anhelo D. Obdulia es D. instalar en su vivienda una panadería donD. pueda exhibir diversos postres ya que tiene algunos conocimientos sobre repostería. Con el préstamo solicitado va a comprar hilo y lana para sus tejidos. L. Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Señor D. Muruhuay D. Huayaringa” están muy agradecidos por el préstamo.
texts.en:
The community bank, "Senor D. Muruhuay D. Huayaringa," is a new group that is willing to work together and is maD. up of 9 entrepreneurial and trustworthy women with the Prosperity Program.

Obdulia is 33 years old and is married and has two children. AlongsiD. her family, she resides in the town of Huayaringa. Obdulia has 8 years experience dedicating herself to making accessories like blankets, sweaters, scarves, among others, that are knit from thread and wool. Thanks to her job she has been able to help her husband with the household bills and the studies of her youngest children. Obdulia's dream is to install a bakery in her house  where she can display different pastires since she's already known for her baking. With the loan requested, she is going to buy thread and wool for her knitting. The new community bank, Senor D. Muruhuay D. Huayaringa, is very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: to buy thread and wool.

loans.name: Elueteria

texts.en:
Elueteria is 56 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Baliangao. She is married with three children. 

Elueteria has a timber sales business and earns approximately 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 50,000 PHP to purchase 50 bags of cement and other housing materials.
 
Elueteria has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bags of cement and other housing materials.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander, tiene la edad 24 de años, está en unión libre y vive con su esposa y su hijo. El pretende con el crédito comprar insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El lo que va comprar específicamente es el abono e insumos necesarios para su asistencia. El cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado por lo cual quiere darle asistencia para así obtener de este los  resultados esperados y altas cosechas. El pretende con el crédito realizar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para salir adelante con el proyecto y darle a su familia una buena calidad de vida en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Alexander, 24, is in a common law relationship and lives with his wife and son.  He intends to use the loan to buy farming supplies for his coffee crops.  Specifically, he’ll buy manure and other supplies needed to support the crops.  He has a field already planted so he needs to provide assistance in order to obtain the desired results and high crop yields.  He intends for the loan to produce higher profits to get ahead with the project and provide his family with a good quality of life in the future.  This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and FUDECOSUR offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 55 años, es una mujer alegre, responsable y sobre todo muy trabajadora, ella esta casada y tiene junto a su esposo una casa propia en donde viven junto a su nieto a quien crían, educan y desean darle una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Luz consiste en la siembra de granos de fréjol, maíz, camu camu, y otros productos más. Tiene sembríos de camu camu en su chacra cerca de su casa, además en otro distrito cerca de la ciudad, ella realiza su trabajo de forma directa junto a su esposo y su nieto. En época de siembra ella se encarga de contratar peones para que le ayuden a preparar la tierra, y en época de cosecha también, para que le ayuden en la recolección. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene mucho tiempo para poder hacer otras actividades, sin embargo cuando vende sus productos algunos mayoristas le quieren dar muy bajo precio por sus productos. Este será el crédito 16 con MFP, es socia fundadora y siempre se caracterizó por ser una buena pagadora y muy responsable, espera poder seguir trabajando juntos ya que esta muy agradecida de que le hayan dado la oportunidad de crecer junto a su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará granos como frejoles además de contratar peones para que le ayuden a arar la tierra antes de sembrar.
texts.en:
Luz is 55 years old. She is a woman who is cheerful, responsible, and most of all, hardworking. Luz is married and lives in her own home with her husband and a grandson that she is raising. She also wants to provide him with an education and a better quality of life. Her work involves planting beans, corn, “camu camu” (a berry native to the Amazon rainforest), and other products. The “camu camu” berries are grown on a farm near her home and on land located in another district near the city. Luz works alongside her husband and her grandson. During the planting season, she hires workers to help her with preparing the land. She hires them again during the harvest season to help with gathering produce. What she enjoys most about her work is that she has plenty of time to devote to other activities. However, when she sells her products, some of the wholesalers want to offer her a very low price.

This will be her 16th loan with MFP. Luz is a founding member and has always been known for having a good payment history and being very responsible. She hopes to continue working with her Communal Bank and is very grateful that she has been given the opportunity to grow in her work. The amount she requested will be used to buy seeds for planting beans. She will also hire workers to help plow the land before planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting beans and to hire workers to plow the land.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. Carlos has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and viands like halang-halang. He has had this business for 20 years. He requested a loan for 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and viands to sell.

Carlos has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Carlos hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and viands to sell

loans.name: Marbelly Dayana

texts.es:
Doña Marbelly sigue laborando como secretaria, y ha aumentado las venta de cosmeticos, logrando la captacion de mas clientes. Su hija sigue creciendo, aun no va a clase. 
Su esposo es supervisor de seguridad, y juntos equilibran los gastos del hogar, teniendo como proposito la mejora a su vivienda, que ha venido mejorando.
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento sera para invertir en productos de cosmetico de Avon y Zermat, teniendo muchos pedidos por catalogos, teniendo poco en existencia, comprara: vanidades, pintura de labios, shampoo, cremas de piel, de cara, de pelo, tratamiento de cabello, perfumes de dama, caballeros, niños, prendas de de plata de encargo, entre otros productos que son de mucha demanda en las ventas.
Con sus ventas se ayuda mucho, para los gastos de pasaje, sus gastos personales, y pago de luz y agua de su hogar.
texts.en:
Marbelly continues to work as a Secretary and has increased her cosmetics sales attracting more customers.  Her daughter continues to grow but still has not started school.

Her husband’s a security supervisor and together they balance household expenses with the goal of improving their home, something they’ve been doing.

With this new loan today, she’ll buy more Avon and Zermat brand cosmetics since she has many pending catalogue orders to fill and her stock is low.  She will buy make up kits, lipstick, shampoo, skin cream, face cream, hair cream, hair treatments, women’s, men’s and children’s perfume, silver items on order, among other products that are in high demand in her sales.  Her sales help her a lot to cover travel and personal costs and to pay her home electricity and water bills.

loans.use: to buy Avon and Zermat brand products.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, age 23, is a farmer. He has carried out his farming efforts for the past year in his home area in Muranga, producing horticultural products for the local market. He also works as a barber at the market.

James has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy a motorcycle and venture into the transport business. He says that he has resolved to undertake this effort since the market is currently experiencing a boom. The cost of motorcycles has come down drastically after the government’s intervention to help the transport sector. He adds that this will supplement his farming income and allow him to build a strong foundation for his future family.

He says the primary challenge for farmers remains access to financing, a challenge that Juhudi Kilimo is mitigating through its loans.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and venture into the transport business

loans.name: Hayfa

texts.en:
Hayfa is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of three children.  She and her husband work together to raise and educate them.

Hayfa started selling mobile phones from her house to friends, neighbors and relatives in the year 2000. Her business has grown well and now she has many foreigners who visit her to buy used or new mobile phones. Her good communication skills have helped her a lot to expand her business. 

Hayfa has been through 10 consecutive loan cycles with Kiva field partner Al Majmoua. Her previous loans helped her a lot to expand her business, improve her family's living standards, and to afford special maintenance for her house. She made her house an ideal healthy living house.

Hayfa is a borrower in good standing who works hard to improve her business.  She plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy new models of mobile phones to sell.  She hopes to open a mobile services shop in the future and start other businesses for her children to manage.

loans.use: to buy new models of mobile phones

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia makes a living running a general store in the rural village of San Ignacio. She aspires to have her business grow and be competitive with other stores in their village. She has four children with Monato, her husband, who works as an overseas Filipino worker in Saudi. Their four children are all studying. They need to help each other to give them a good education so that some day all of them will have a good future. Their eldest is now 15 years old, studying in high school with their second child. The two younger children are both in elementary school. 

Alicia is asking for a loan to be used as additional business capital to purchase commodities for her general store. She hopes to access a loan of PHP 25,000 that will surely be very useful in the improvement of her store. Alicia believes that time is gold; thus, they work very hard and help each other in the progress of their daily lives, doing their best not to waste time.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, coffee, sugar, soy sauce and spices for her store.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta integrante del Banco comunal “Oportunidad” perteneciente a la comuna de Padre de las Casas, ubicada en la ciudad de Temuco. Se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo ropa de niños y adolescentes, desde hace 5 años.
Comenta que compra su mercadería en el barrio Meiggs ciudad de Santiago, en locales y distribuidoras donde los precios sean más convenientes económicamente.
Compra al por mayor, entre ropa, carteras y zapatos de guagua, generalmente productos que se vendan rápidamente. 
Sus productos los ofrece puerta a puerta y en su propia casa.
Con el crédito comprará ropa, para abastecer su negocio durante la temporada de navidad. 
Las metas en su negocio son establecerse en un local, para esto postuló en una galería, en la cual arrendaría un local comercial. 
Marta vive junto a su hermana, quien sufre de una discapacidad, su hijo de 8 años y una sobrina de 11 años de edad. 
Uno de sus sueños es comprar un vehículo, el cual le permitiría trasladar su mercadería. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio y con las utilidades de éste acceder a una mejor calidad de vida. 
Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal es muy unido, responsable y agradable, por lo que se siente muy cómoda participando.
Respecto a las capacitaciones, estas le han servido para organizar la contabilidad de su negocio.  
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía.  Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
Marta is a member of the community bank "Oportunidad" in the community of Padre de las Casas which is located in the city of Temuco. She is a tradeswoman selling clothes for children and adolescents, and she has been doing this for 5 years. 
She comments that she buys her merchandise in the Meiggs neighborhood of the city of Santiago from stalls and distributors who have good prices.
She buys clothes, handbags, and toddler shoes wholesale, and these are generally products that sell quickly.
She sells her goods door to door and also from her home.
She will use this loan to buy clothes to stock her business for the Christmas season.
Her goals for her business are to open a store, and for this she wants to find a mall where she could rent a store. 
Marta lives with her sister, who has a disability, her 8 year old son and an 11 year old niece. 
One of her dreams is to buy a vehicle which would enable her to transport her merchandise.
She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that the micro finance institute has offered her to invest in her business and to gain a better quality of life. 
She comments that the community bank group is very united, responsible, and nice, so she feels very comfortable being a part of it. 
The training she has received has has helped her to do the accounting for her business.
Padre Las Casas is a community in the south of Chile, close to the city of Temuco in the Araucanía region. It was named in honor of the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas, who defended the indigenous people during the conquest of America. It is noted for its large Mapuche population. The local economy is based on agroindustry and commercial services.

loans.use: to buy clothes to stock her business for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years. He is 36 years old, married to Milka and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and farm inputs. Buying spraying chemicals and seedlings as well as getting more labour are also part of his plans.

In the future, Simon hopes to improve his farming methods and make more income to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm inputs.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 26-year-old business lady and she is a single mother of a two-year-old son. She has been selling polythene papers (plastic bags) to retailers for the past year, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Hannah will use the loan to buy more polythene papers for her business. With the anticipated profit she will expand her business. 

She hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more polythene papers for her business.

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Monsieur  ISSA  est un homme  qui est âgé de 48 ans et qui vit avec ses six enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle dans le village de Dongorona, sous  préfecture de Ouelessebougou,  Région de Koulikoro.
Afin de s’insérer dans la vie économique, ISSA, qui n’a pas eu la chance  de réussir à l’école, s’est vite initié aux activités de stockage commercialement des céréales et des produits de cueillettes tels le néré, les noix d’acajou et  le tamarin.  
Nanti  de deux années d’expériences dans le domaine, il est très sollicité.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, ISSA  décide d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel.
ISSA  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 tonne de maïs, 1 tonne  d’arachide et 5 sacs de grain de néré, auprès des paysans producteurs de DAFARA et de Ouelessebougou qu’il stockera pendant au moins 2 mois. Il effectue sa vente  au marché de Ouelesseboubou, au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
ISSA   espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50000FCFA qui   sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt,  subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Issa is a 48-year-old man living with his six children and his spouse in a traditional family in the village of Dongorona, Ouelessebougou subprefecture, Koulikoro region.

In order to fit into economic life, Issa, who did not have the chance to succeed in school, quickly learned the business of commercially storing cereals and products of picking such as néré [seeds from the African Néré tree], cashew nuts and tamarind.

Well-off with two years experience in this field, he is very much in demand.

In his search for complementary financial resources, Issa decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his second individual loan.

Issa plans to use his loan to buy 1 ton of corn, 1 ton of ground nuts and 5 bags of néré seeds from the farmers of Dafara and Ouelessebougou which he will store for at least 2 months.

He sells at the market of Ouelessebougou, for cash and rarely for credit to a clientèle which consists of women and men.

Issa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, meet the needs of the family's expenses and reinvest the rest in the businesses.

loans.use: to buy 1 ton of corn, 1 ton of ground nuts and 5 bags of néré seeds [from the African Néré tree].

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa produces palm oil for sale at Ankako near Abura. Adjoa has been selling palm oil for some time now.

She is divorced and has four children. She is responsible for taking care of the children. 

Her loan will be used to purchase palm fruit for the production of her oil for sale. With the new profit, Adjoa will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit for the production of her oil for sale.

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 61 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Gastronomía, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cau Cau, el cual es su plato favorito.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre, día a día Juana trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, Juana se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Juana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como arena, ladrillos, cerámica, pintura, fierros, entre otros; de esta manera podrá hacer la construcción del segundo piso de su vivienda; de esta manera Juana espera seguir trabajando y esforzándose para logar sus metas y su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Juana is a 61-year-old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Pisco. She is a very likable, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and the necessity to work since she was very young, she was not able to study for a professional degree in Gastronomy. In her free time she likes to play sports, and on some occasions she cooks a delicious "Cau Cau" [tripe stew], which is her favorite dish.

With great effort and dedication, and thanks to what she learned from her mother, Juana works day by day in her small business selling food. She starts work in the early morning hours, and she generally works for about 8 hours. Juana feels happy doing her work, and she believes that it is going well for her thanks to the friendly treatment she gives her customers. 

Juana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help provided to her she will be able to buy construction materials, such as sand, bricks, ceramic tiles, paint, and metal bars, among other items. In this way she will be able to carry out the construction of the second floor of her home. Juana hopes to keep working and exerting herself to achieve her goals and her great dream of expanding her business and getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Khanum

texts.en:
Khanum is a responsible woman ,mother of 6 children is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.khanum has been running a General Store in which she offers different variety of items such as  rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits etc.She manages her household expenses from her own store , her some relative and friends like to purchase from her General Store.Her general store is running well.But she had to buy inventory. Therefore, Khanum requested a loan for her store so that she can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc.Khanum thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.
Khanum hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in positive way; this amount will help her to cope up with the demands of her family. She is obliged towards  Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To invest in her general store.

loans.name: Efrén

texts.en:
Efren is responsable and hard-working and very dedicated to his family. He started his business when he lost one of his legs in an accident. He was discriminated against for this disability when trying to find work. His wife was not able to find a job either because she was pregnant. So, Efren began to sell snacks and sweets outside of a school, and that\\\'s how he began his business. Currently his business needs $200 USD in order to obtain a permanent work site because when classes end he will not have any where to sell his products. Additionally, it is difficult for him to move due to his handicap. Efren needs your support and generosity. Support him!

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Efrén es una persona muy entregada a su familia, responsable y trabajador; inició su negocio cuando perdió en un accidente una de sus piernas, por lo que fue discriminado de cualquier trabajo por su incapacidad. Su esposa tampoco encontraba trabajo ya que en ese tiempo estaba embarazada, por esta razón Efrén comenzó a vender snack y dulces afuera de una escuela y así fue como inició este negocio. Actualmente su negocio necesita de un apoyo económico de $200 USD para poder establecerse en un lugar, ya que cuando la temporada de clases termina, no tiene un lugar para vender sus productos, además le es difícil moverse de lugar debido a su discapacidad. Efrén necesita tu ayuda y generosidad. ¡Apóyalo!

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Sarahi

texts.en: My name is Sarahi, I’m a merchant and I sell new clothing for people of all ages. I have been doing this work for several years, and, with the income generated, I can help cover my family’s expenses and other commitments I have to suppliers. My idea is to be able to by a car so that I could travel to other cities to buy merchandise at a better price, and thus have greater earnings.

loans.use: Purchase of men’s and women’s pants, ladies’ blouses, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Petra

texts.en:
Blanca Petra began her own business selling groceries 10 years ago. When her son was born, she saw the need to work to in something that would allow her enough time to take care of him. That is why she opened her store, and fortunately things have gone well for her. This is the only source of income for herself and her son. It hasn't been easy for Blanca to sustain her household, but she hopes to improve her living conditions and works hard to get ahead with her business.

Blanca is very hardworking and responsible. She needs a loan of $925.00. It will be used to buy merchandise, in order to have a good inventory in her store, and to improve the service she offers to her clients. She is committed to paying back the loan amount in 4 to 8 months. Blanca needs your help and is sincerely thankful for any support you are able to give.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blanca Petra inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace 10 años, al nacer su hijo se vio en la necesidad empezar a trabaja en algo que le permitiera tener el tiempo suficiente para cuidar a su hijo, por lo que abrió su tienda y afortunadamente le ha ido bien, esta es la única fuente de ingresos para ella y su hijo. No ha fácil para Blanca ser el único sosote de su hogar, pero desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida se esfuerza mucho por sacar adelante su negocio.

Blanca es muy trabajadora y responsable, ahora necesita de un crédito por $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para tener bien surtido su negocio y mejorar la calidad de servicio que ofrece a sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Blanca necesita de tu ayuda y agradece sinceramente cualquier apoyo que puedas ofrecerle.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Business Description

Sandra has been in the commerce business for six years. Her husband helped her with the initiative of putting up a shop. She used a capital of $50 to purchase merchandise such as school supplies. She conditioned part of her home to start a shop. Now she also sells toys, imitation jewelry, gifts and cosmetics. She works every day of the week from 7 a.m to 8 p.m.

Loan Use

She will invest the credit into purchasing merchandise to supply her shop. Se is also thinking about buying a display case in order to help her exhibit her products.

Personal Information

Sandra is married. She is 34 years old and has three children, all of whom are studying. Her husband is a gas fitter. Her house is made out of cane and she hopes to be able to repair it with the investment. Her wish is to have a bigger shop in order to better serve her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Sandra tiene una experiencia de 6 años en la actividad del comercio. Su esposo le ayudo en la iniciativa de poner un local. Con un capital de $ 50 compro mercadería como lo son: útiles escolares. Acondiciono parte de su domicilio para el local. Ahora también vende artículos como: juguetes, regalos, bisutería, cosméticos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para surtir su local. Además piensa comprarse una vitrina donde pueda exhibir mejor sus productos.

Información Personal

Sandra es casada. Tiene 34 años y tres hijos. Los que estudian Su esposo se dedica a la profesión de gasfitero. Su casita es de caña y espera con la inversión poder adecuarla. Su deseo es tener un local más grande y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Maria Belén

texts.es:
Nine years ago, Maria Belén started her own business selling snacks and soft drinks. Little by little, her business began to support her and now she has a wide variety of products that are highly demanded by her clientele. Maria is married and has three small children, ages 1, 2, and 4 years. Her love for her family and the desire to give them a better life motivate her to improve and grow her business.

To continue this growth and urge it to new heights, Maria is requesting a loan of $275 that she will use to purchase stock to bring good service to her customers and earn their favor for her business. She promises to return this amount in four months. Become part of this dream - decide to support Maria and her family. They greatly appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace nueve años Maria Belén inició su propio negocio con la venta de botanas y refrescos, fue surtiendo poco a poco su negocio y ahora ya cuenta con una amplia variedad de los productos que son los de mayor demanda entre sus clientes. Maria está casada y tiene tres pequeños hijos, de 1, 2 y 4 años de edad, el amor hacia su familia y el deseo de darles un mayor bienestar la motivan a mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio y darle un nuevo impulso, Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para brindarle un buen servicio a sus clientes y continuar con su preferencia, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Forma parte de este sueño, decídete a apoyar a Maria y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of store stock

loans.name: Gollita

texts.en: Gollita is a hard-working, persistent and a very experienced businesswoman.  For more than fifteen years, she has been running a discotheque in Monte Plata.  Her discotheque is very well-located, so it is very often visited by locals.  Gollita operates the business only on week-ends and on holidays.  Every week she has to incur in the purchase beverages such as beer, rum and whiskey.  Running the discotheque has been very useful for her and her family.  In fact, with the income from the discotheque, she pays the university studies of her only 22-year-old daughter.  She also helps her husband (a technician that fixes radios and TVs) face other housing issues. Gollita is requesting a loan to buy more drinks for her business.  She will also buy new beverages to diversify her offerings to the customers and better satisfy their needs.

loans.use: To buy drinks as beer, whiskey, rum and new ones to supply the entrepreneur's discotheque.

loans.name: Hudoiberdieva

texts.ru:
M. Hudoiberdieva, age 45, has three children. She works in the local hospital as an optometrist nurse while her husband works as a taxi driver. Her oldest daughter has just turned 18 and is getting married but the family does not have enough money for the wedding. That is why she has applied for this loan.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Матлюба, возраст45 лет, имеет троих детей. Работает в районой поликлинике глазной медсестрой ,муж работает наемным водителем на маршрутном такси.Старшей дочери исполнилось 18 лет , ее выдают замуж.Но для проведения свадебного мероприятия у семьи не хватает финансов . поэтому она , Матлюба Худойбердиева решила кредитоваться в Микроинвесте.

loans.use: wedding cost

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vu Thi O., 43 years old, is living in Y Yen. She joined the Fund since 1998. Before joining the Fund, her family life is difficult because she did not own many rice fields and sending her children to school cost her lots of money. The local TYM Fund allowed Mrs.O. and other women to borrow money to run business. At first, Mrs. O. borrowed 40 USD to invest in breeding the pigs. As time passed by, she went from having 3,4 pigs to 20-30 pigs each farrow. Each year, she released 60-70 pigs from the pigsty. Her income from breeding the pigs allows her to send her children to school and build a nice house. This time, she wants to borrow 450 USD to buy more pig mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị O., 43 tuổi, sống tại Ý Yên tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Trước khi vào Quỹ gia đình kinh tế còn nhiều khó khăn do ruộng ít, chi phí cho các con đang ăn học lớn. Quỹ Tình thương về hoạt động tại địa bàn tạo điều kiện cho chị em phụ nữ nói chung và chị O. có điều kiện vay vốn làm ăn. Bước đầu chị vay mức vốn 40USD về đầu tư nuôi lợn. Qua các năm dần dần gia đình chị mở rộng thêm từ 3, 4 con ban đầu đến nay gia đình chị nuôi 20-30 con lợn mỗi lứa và mỗi năm xuất chuồng 60-70 con. Nguồn thu nhập từ chăn nuôi giúp chị O. nuôi các con ăn học trưởng thành và xây nhà cửa khang trang. Vòng vốn tới chị O. muốn được tiếp tục vay thêm 450USD về để mua thức ăn cho lợn.

loans.use: Buy more pig mash

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.ru:
Tursunoy A. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 45 years old, divorced and has 2 children. She has a high school degree, but not professional degree. Mrs. A. has been managing a general goods store for the last four years. Mrs. A. is planning to use the loan to improve her sales by expanding the assortment of goods her store offers for sale. She is hoping to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Абдухалимова Турсуной жительница города Т урсунзаде. Возраст 45 лет, разведена, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее, специальности не имеет. Занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин. Планируемый кредит хочет использовать на расширение бизнеса, увеличить товарооборот, путем ввоза нового ассортимента товара. Опыт в бизнесе 4 года. Рассчитывает погасить планируемый кредит в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen G. is married with two kids. She is 33 years old. She is a stylist who has been in business for the past eight years. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She needs a loan of $875 to buy dryers, relaxer, hair cream, and weavon.

loans.use: To buy dryers, relaxer, hair cream, and weavon

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis and Dionisia have been happily married for 15 years. They used to live in Luis’ parents house, but 7 years ago they moved out. Luis raises livestock. At the start, things were very difficult for Luis as he did not know a lot or have a lot of experience in this, but with hard work and dedication, and with support from his faithful wife, Dionisia, he has managed to do very well in his daily work, and he now has quite a few calves and lambs. He wants to improve the financial situation of his family and give his 3 kids a good education. This is why he perseveres every day. He would now like to buy some roughage so that his animals will eat well in all seasons. With this project in mind, Luis is asking for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Luis y Dionisia, tienen 15 años D. feliz matrimonio, anteriormente vivían en el domicilio D. sus padres, pero hace 7 años decidieron independizarse, Luis se dedica a L. producción D. ganado, en un principio las cosas para don Luis fueron muy difíciles, porque no tenía experiencia ni suficiente conocimiento en esta actividad, pero con constancia, dedicación y con el apoyo D. su fiel esposa Dionisia logró mejorar notablemente su labor diaria, actualmente ya es propietario D. una buena cantidad D. becerritas y corderitos. Desea mejorar su situación económica familiar y brindarles educación a sus 3 queridos hijos, con ese fin se esfuerza y persevera día a día.Ahora previniendo las inclemencias del tiempo tiene pensado adquirir forraje para tener asegurada L. alimentación D. sus animalitos en posibles tiempos difíciles.Con ese proyecto en mente recurre a vosotros para solicitar tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy roughage and balanced foods for their animals/Compra de forraje y alimentos balanceados para sus queridos animalitos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Including other kinds of items to sell

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en: Iskandar B.  became a client of MicroInvest earlier this year, and has quickly proved himself to be a capable and serious businessman. He made good use of a previous loan to increase his income and expand his business.  Mr. B. lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan, and is married with four children. He makes a living raising livestock, including cows, bulls and several rams. His wife helps him care for the animals and sell their produce. Mr. B. has applied to Kiva for a loan to further expand his business by buying one more pedigree bull.

loans.use: to buy a pedigree bull.

loans.name: Vichara

texts.en:
Vichara K. is a villager in Kveth Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband, Yan Keo (also pictured), is a farmer and construction worker. Despite all their efforts, their living conditions are not very good; thus Vichara decided to launch a business breeding pigs.

Vichara will use her loan to buy piglets for breeding and to build a new house so they can live independently from her parents.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding and build a house.

loans.name: Wahida's Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Wahida J. M. is 41 years old and divorced with two children aged 16 and 11. She also takes care of a 75-year-old person. She became a computer teacher in 1997. Every day, she works from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50.

In the past, Wahida has successfully repaid one loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan in order to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatma J..

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 33-year-old entrepreneur. She is married and lives with her 3 children in Likoni, Mombasa. Her husband works as an office assistant at one of the hospitals in Mombasa. Beatrice is a member of the Bridge of Hope group based in Likoni.

She hawks various items such as used clothes, sweets, and sodas along Likoni beach. She desires to find a permanent place where she can settle and sell her merchandise. She has requested US$400 to add more stock and also to pay rent for her place.

loans.use: To add stock of used clothes and pay rent for her new place

loans.name: Calista

texts.en:
Calista sells provisions, food products, drinks and rechargeable phone cards. She has been in the business of selling provisions and drinks for the past ten years, but after joining LAPO Microfinance, she added the sale of food products and rechargeable phone cards to her business.

Calista is 39 years old and married with two children. Calista needs the loan amount of $850 to purchase more food products and provisions to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more food products and provisions to sell

loans.name: Elvis Ivan

texts.es: El Sr. Elvis O., vive en la casa de sus padres con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, su esposa vende comida en el mercado, hace  3 años que cuenta con dicho negocio. Tiene como actividad principal es el transporte urbano de taxi, con su propio vehiculo. Es un cliente que se encuentra en su segunda secuencia crediticia y el primer crédito fue hecho a través de un Bancos de emprendimiento, sin embargo ahora decidió independizarse. El destino del crédito será para adquirir un puesto en el mercado, para la venta de comidas que es la actividad de su esposa, su objetivo  principal es llegar a comprarle un puesto propio. La otra parte del crédito la utilizará para comprar llantas y hacer un mantenimiento de su automóvil.
texts.en:
Elvis O. lives in his parent's house with his wife and young son. His wife sells food in the market, a business she's operated for 3 years. He has his own vehicle and operates a taxi business. He is a second-time borrower. The first loan came from a [community?] bank for new businesses, but he's now decided to set out on his own. The loan will be used to get a market stall for selling food, his wife's business, and ultimately to buy a place. The rest of the loan will be used to service his car and buy new tires.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a market stall for wife's food business and new tires for taxi business.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mrs. Phorn Y. is a 30-year-old who makes a living raising pigs, which provides the main income for sustaining her family. She cares for one young child and is married to Mr. Saren Phav, 33. Her husband is a local construction worker who always leaves home in the morning to work for a small firm in his area in Banteay Meanchey Province. Recently Saren has been facing difficulty with transportation; hence, Saren and his wife decided to ask for a $500 loan to purchase a motorcycle for transporting to work.

loans.use: To purchase her husband a motorcycle to use to commute to work

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Cette  dame de quarante neuf ans (49)  vit dans le quartier d’agoè avec sa famille, elle est une revendeuse de produits de beauté dans son quartier de résidence, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2000. Elle a besoin d’approvisionner son stock surtout en ces périodes de fêtes où les femmes achète beaucoup pour s’entretenir c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES.
Elle divorcée de son mari et a 06 personnes à sa charge qu’elle doit soutenir en travaillant dur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjo A., 49, lives in the Agoè neighborhod with her family. She sells beauty products right in the district where she lives, and has been involved in this business since 2000. She needs to add to her stocks, especially in this festive season, where women spend more money on such beauty products, and for this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES.

She is divorced from her husband and is supporting 6 people, which means that she must work very hard indeed.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Nai

texts.en:
Mr. Nai N. was born in 1968 and now lives in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. 

His wife, Mrs. Khen Kong, is a chicken breeder. She earns a lower income than desired to provide a better life for their children. In order to improve their lives, Mr. Nai N. decided to request a loan to buy ducks and duck food to start breeding ducks. 

He is the father of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another is a laborer and the others are attending the local school. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy ducks and duck food to start breeding ducks

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Ayaba T. est âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique de produits de beauté à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit alimenter sa boutique. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour changer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ayaba T. is 32 years old, married and the mother of two children. She owns a beauty products boutique in Lome, the capital of Togo. She is requesting this loan to build up her boutique. Ayaba hopes that this opportunity will change the living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and hair pieces for resale

loans.name: Oysanam

texts.ru: Ойсанам женщина 42 лет , мать шестерых детей.Муж работает шофёром маршрутного городского такси.Сама Ойсанам торгует на рынке сухофруктами.Кроме своего бизнеса она со своей семьёй занимается откормом и продажей скота.Ойсанам очень любит скот.В её отсутствии за скотом смотрит её старший сын. Для увеличения скота Ойсанам решила взять кредит.
texts.en:
Oysanam N. is a 42-year old mother of six. Her husband works as a mini-van cab driver. Oysanam sells dried fruit on the market. In addition to this business, she raises and sells cattle. Oysanam is very much fond of cattle. In her absence, her elder son tends to cattle. In order to purchase more cattle, Oysanam decided to apply for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to raise and sell cattle

loans.name: Yesenia Lisbel

texts.es:
La señora Yesenia Lisbel Sánchez tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió primaria completa, tiene 1 hijo que depende económicamente de ella. 
Yesenia se dedica a la venta de menú, anteriormente empezó con la venta de golosinas en su casa, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en la compra de golosinas (variedad)
Con el crédito de 100 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas y arreglo de los inmuebles del negocio.
Yessenia tiene como sueño inaugurar su restaurante en donde ofrezca variedad de platos típicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yesenia Lisbel S. is 39 years old and lives in the district of Moche in Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Peru. She completed elementary school and has one son who depends on her economically. Yesenia works selling prepared meals. Earlier, she began with the sale of sweets in her house, and developed her business from her home. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her community bank "Luis Alberto S. II", she invested in the purchase of a variety of sweets. With this credit of 100 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of sweets and the improvement of her place of business. It is Yessenia's dream to open her own restaurant where she will sell a variety of local foods.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sweets and improvements to the place of business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su único hijo en su propia casa. Ella vende repuestos para autos y motocarros en todas las variedades, lleva un periodo de 3 años y su negocio se encuentra dentro de su casa. Ana cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es mecánico y el encargado de colocar los repuestos a los vehículos de las personas que concurren al negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se relaciona con todas las personas que acuden a comprar sus repuestos y darles una buena atención es lo principal para ella, además le es rentable porque debido a la gran cantidad de motocarros en su ciudad, vende diariamente, lo que le genera bueno ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares. Para más adelante, Ana quiere mandar a construir un lavadero de autos y motocarros, para brindar un servicio adicional a sus clientes. Con MFP, ya tiene 13 préstamos, su banco comunal se llama “Campo Verde”, nombre de la zona donde vive ella y sus compañeros de grupo, le gusta así porque todos son muy cumplidos y responsables. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de más repuestos para su tienda.
texts.en:
Anna is 33 years old, and lives with her husband and only child in her own home. She sells all kinds of spare parts for cars and motorcars. She has been doing this for the last 3 years, and her business is home-based. Ana is helped by her husband, who is a mechanic and he is in charge of the installation of the parts in her customers' cars. What she likes about her work is that she is contact with all people that come to buy parts. Taking good care of them is the most important thing for her. Additionally, the business is profitable because there are many motorcars in her town. She sells a lot everyday, and this generates a good income to pay for the family expenses. In the future, Ana want to build a car and motorcar wash in order to provide additional services to her customers.

She has had 13 loans with MFP. Her communal bank is called "Campo Verde", which is the name of the neighborhood where she and the other group members live. She likes it this way because they all are very motivated and responsible.

She will invest the loan that she is requesting to buy more parts for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ramon Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Thilo

texts.fr: Madame Thilo B. est une femme mariée qui travaille au service nettoiement de l’hôpital régionale de Thiès.  Elle a 40 ans et elle habite au quartier Darou Salam de Thiès.  En plus de son travail, elle a ouvert une petite alimentation chez elle qu’elle a confiée à sa fille. Elle vend les petites marchandises. Elle est à son renouvellement de prêt et a bien remboursé le précédent.  Avec ce crédit, elle va acheter des cigarettes, Omo (du savon en poudre), eau de javel, cube Maggi (un condiment Senegalais), et divers.  En vendant cette marchandise elle espère d’avoir un bénéfice de 20 000CFA ($40) qui vont servir à rembourser les intérêts de son prêt et payer les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Ms. Thilo B. is a married woman who works in the cleaning service of a region hospital in Thiès. She is 40 years old and lives in the Darou Salam district of Thiès. In addition to her work, she opened a small grocery store in her home that she has entrusted to her daughter. She sells sundry items. She is on her loan renewal, having repaid the preceding one. With this loan, she’s going to buy cigarettes, some Omo (a powdered soap), bleach, Maggi bouillon cubes (a condiment in Senegal), and various goods. Through selling these goods, she hopes to have a profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to make loan interest payments and to cover day-to-day expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, soap, and various goods

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en: Jasmina A. was born in 1978 and comes from the suburbs of the town of Banovići. She is a married mother of two children. Her husband is employed in construction and works in agriculture in his free time. Jasmina is a housewife who takes care of her children and garden. She also raises poultry for her own use. Now, Jasmina is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner, Women for Women International (WWI), for the amount of 600 BAM to purchase poultry and food. She will fatten the poultry to resell and thereby raise her family income.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and poultry food

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.es: Peregrina tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, y desde hace más de 20 años, junto a su esposo y sus hijos, trabajan en la tarea de sembrar y cosechar papa y maíz. También cría animales que vende en las ferias ganaderas de su localidad. Ambas actividades son el sostén de su familia y las que han hecho posible la educación y superación de sus hijos. Para un futuro cercano, Peregrina tiene planes de arreglar algunas estructuras de su casa para poder ampliar los espacios que utiliza como almacén de sus productos. Ella es una de las socias más antiguas de su banco comunal, que ha demostrado en lo largo de estos 14 ciclos de préstamo, aproximadamente 7 años, mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora viene solicitando será para invertirlo en la ampliación de sus almacenes.
texts.en:
Peregrina is 49 and lives in her own home with her husband and 4 children. Since she was young, she has worked in agriculture. For more than 20 years, she has worked with her husband and kids. They work planting and harvesting potatoes and corn. She also raises animals that she sells at the livestock markets in her area. Both activities sustain her family, and they have made it possible to educate her children. In the near future, Peregrina has plans to fix up her home to expand the areas that she uses to store her products. She is one of the oldest members of her communal bank, and this is her fourteenth loan. She has been a member for approximately 7 years, and she is very responsible with her payments. The money she is requesting will be invested in expanding her storage areas.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the areas she uses to store her products

loans.name: Kit

texts.en:
Kit S., 39, is married and has five children. She produces and sells Cambodian noodles at her house and makes a daily income of $4 US. Her husband raises pigs for piglets to be sold and makes an income of $2 US per day. S. has three school-aged children. The other two children dropped out of school and are still unemployed, but they are helping with the family businesses.

S. is asking for a loan of $800 US to buy rice for reselling and feed for the pigs they are raising. She hopes that she will be able to increase her income because of the expected boost in production she will get from her investment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice and hog feed

loans.name: Oscar Rafael

texts.es: El señor Oscar S. tiene 27 años de edad, es Casado de oficios tejedor, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 telares, habita junto a sus esposa,  él y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un empleado para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Tzansiguan, Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar S. is 27 years old and married. He is a weaver by profession and makes “traditional women’s skirts”. Together with his wife, they operate a 2 loom workshop and have one employee. For six years they have been making skirts out of their home in the Tzansiguan neighborhood in the village of Vásquez, Totonicapán district, Guatemala. Now that customer demand has increased, they do not have sufficient finances to grow their business. For this reason, Sr. Oscar has requested a loan from Asociación ASDIR to buy raw materials needed to increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Baasanjav

texts.en: Baasanjav is 53 years old and runs a produce stand at the open market. They sell potatoes, carrots, cabbage, onions etc. at her stand. She has been doing this since 2002 and even though she is older she is very good at running her business. She has lots of experience.  She is separated from her husband and her son is going to school in China. She lives with her younger siblings in a small shack. With the profits from her produce stand she pays for her sons schooling in China.  With a loan, she hopes to be able to buy more vegetables in greater bulk. With the extra profits she hopes to improve the standard of living for her and her family and be able to keep her son in school. Above all, Baasanjav wants to be able to make sure her son gets a good education so he can have a real occupation some day. She lives for her family and is a very hard worker.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables in greater bulk

loans.name: Olaïtan

texts.fr: Olaïtan est née le 27/12/1978 à Sakété dans le Département du Plateau au Sud du Bénin. Olaïtan est mariée à Essoun, un chauffeur. Olaïtan est mère d’un enfant, celui-ci a été scolarisé mais il est mort déjà. Olaïtan et son mari vivent depuis onze (11) ans à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Olaïtan supporte les charges de la famille ensemble avec son mari. Olaïtan est Alphabétisée et vend des divers (boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, produits pour le thé, des beurres, des papiers hygiéniques, des mayonnaises, des insecticides, de laits et crèmes corporels, des produits pour les cheveux, pâtes dentifrices, etc.). Olaïtan est dans cette activité depuis cinq ans. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Olaïtan achète ses articles et les revend chez elle à domicile. Olaïtan est à son cinquième crédit avec ALIDé et est un bon client qui rembourse très bien. Les crédits d’ALIDé ont permis à Olaïtan d’améliorer le niveau de son activité ainsi que sa vie et celle de sa famille. Olaïtan sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Achat de boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, des papiers hygiéniques, de laits et crèmes corporels, des produits pour les cheveux et des pâtes dentifrices.

loans.name: Elfego Bismark

texts.es: El señor Elfego Bismarck Villalobos Reynosa , tiene la edad de 44 años , habita en el barrio Buenos Aires , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe  junto a su esposa la cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar  ellos tiene dos hijos , los cuales estudian y le apoyan con las actividades agrícolas en tiempos libres, don Elfego desde hace cuatros años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y poder obtener mejores resultados. Dando las gracias Afodenic por financiamiento de poder seguir mejorando su cultivo.
texts.en:
Mr Elfego Bismarck Villalobos Reynosa is 44 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of Buenos Aires, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife who works to help him with the costs of living. They have two children who study and help them with agricultural work in their spare time. For the last four years Elfego has dedicated himself to agriculture, which he began with the support of his parents. The greatest difficulty has been the lack of financing, so his future plan is to diversify his crops. With this loan he will buy fertilizers and supplies to obtain better results. He gives thanks to Afodenic for financing this loan which will allow him to continue improving his cultivation.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and improve cultivation

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a member of the Ngome borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 33 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 10,5,2 years old. She also cares for other 5 dependents.

Fatuma has owned a Tailoring business for 7 years, she works 8 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Fatuma`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount  of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more materials for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Ngome hopes to save more money and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more materials   for her business

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon M., 39, and her husband, Mr. Sengkry Teng, 45, married in 1993 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of them stay at home, one is in school and another one is still young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mon has been a silk weaver for almost 20 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a construction worker for over 10 years. He works in his village.

Mon is requesting a loan of US$ 600 in order to build pillars on her house and purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To build pillars of her house and buy silk materials for her silk weaving business

loans.name: Eladio

texts.en:
Eladio E. is from the village of P-1 Kinangay Sur in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 55 years old. Eladio is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Eladio plants, harvest, and sells rice. Eladio has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Eladio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eladio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC. Eladio is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be Eladio's second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Meng Chou

texts.en:
Mrs. Meng Chou T. lives in Ank Svay Chek village in Takeo province. She is 44 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a pig middleman who helps the father’s business while the others attend the local school.

Mrs. Meng Chou T. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Sok Saroeun, on the right in the photo, is a pig middleman. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it.

Thus, Mrs. Meng Chou T. decided to ask for a loan to buy sixteen more piglets to resell to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy sixteen more piglets to resell.

loans.name: Khushbakht

texts.en:
A. Khushbakht is 54 years old. She is married and has a large family. She lbegan her dried fruits business to her husband with the family expenses. Since she started her business, her professional growth and development have consistently been supported through IMON’s micro-finance program. Khushbakht has repaid each loan faithfully and fully. Khushbakht has a large and friendly family who are always trying to help each other. Now her business is running successfully and it brings considerable income for her family. Today she is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni to purchase more dried fruits due to meet the great demand of her customers. Khushbakht and her family sincerely thank you for your support.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.  But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy dried fruits for processing and selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expansion of Farm Land and Purchase of Fertilizer

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L. is from the village of Naasag, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
