Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene P. is from the village of D'ban Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Arlene is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene raises pigs for sale. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arlene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arlene from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 33 years old and is married with five children. She and her family live in Nyamagabe, in the Southern Province of Rwanda. In this area, Judith owns a shop selling a variety of goods including foodstuffs such as beans, sugar, bananas, etc. Her shop is open from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Judith is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase some additional items like cosmetics goods and some foodstuffs such as sugar, beans, biscuits, cooking oil, etc. With these additional items in her shop, Judith hopes to earn more profits and improve on her savings as well as better providing for her extended family.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her store

loans.name: Yahira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yahaira Dávila Rodríguez, Labora como Responsable de Cartera y Cobro en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua. 
 Ella tiene dos hijos a  su cargo, y se  encuentran en  edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante ocho años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido diez crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de cables eléctricos,  para el cambio del sistema eléctrico, caja y mano de obra para su casa de habitación, ya que anteriormente estos cables se encuentran en mal estado.
Yahaira dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel  a hora cuenta de seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yahaira Dávila Rodríguez is in charge of accounts payable in Managua's Mayoreo market. She has two, school-age children under her care. She is married and has collaborated with CEPRODEL for 8 years, having received 10 loans during this time which she used for home improvements. The funds requested will be used to buy electrical wiring, breaker box, and labor costs to replace the electrical system in her home because the wires are in bad condition. Yahaira stated that thanks to Ceprodel's funding she has security and better living conditions for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Islomdjon

texts.en:
Islomdjon is a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in Dushanbe, Tajikistan.

Islomdjon works in the central city market selling shoes and clothing for teenagers. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for three years. Once a month he travels to the neighboring city for purchasing new goods. Islomdjon likes to work for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family.

Today Islomdjon would like to ask for a loan of $2500 to purchase new clothing and shoes to sell. We believe his drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Islomdjon’s business.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.use: Purchase hair extensions

loans.name: Julynda

texts.en:
Julynda B. is from the village of Mansabay Lopez Jaena. She is 34 years old. Julynda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Julynda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fresh fish in the local community. Julynda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8420 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Julynda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julynda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Julynda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Julynda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 27 años, ella comparte su vida con José D. 28 y su pequeña hija Dayana D. 3 años D. edad. Todos ellos son muy unidos y viven juntos en su casa propia. Hace más D. 2 años se dedica la venta D. productos D. belleza D. reconocidas marcas, su modo D. trabajo consiste en solicitar pedidos a estas empresas cuando estos productos están D. oferta y luego vender a los clientes al precio original, logrando acumular un poco más D. ganancias. A Karina le gusta su trabajo porque le da el tiempo necesario para dedicárselo a su hija, quien necesita D. sus cuidados. Mas adelante desea instalar un bazar en el interior D. un mercado D. su zona, ya que sería conveniente por lo que hay mayor concurrencia D. personas. Sabe que tiene mucho camino por recorrer, por ello debe esforzarse mucho en su negocio para alcanzar el bienestar D. su familia. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos los pagos D. las cuotas. El crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. mayor cantidad D. productos para estas próximas fiestas, en donD. asegura que sus ventas serán muy buenas.
texts.en:
Karina is 27 years old, and she shares her life with José, who is 28,and her little daughter Dayana, who is 3 years old. The three of them are strongly united, and they live together in their own house. For more than two years Karina has worked selling name brand beauty products. She works by ordering products from businesses when they are on sale, then later re-selling those products to her customers at the original price, achieving a small profit that accumulates with each sale. Karina enjoys her work because it allows her the time she needs to spend with her daughter, who still requires her mother's care. In the future Karina hopes to set up a small shop insiD. a regional market in her area, where the greater traffic of customers would be better for her business. She knows that she has a long road to travel until she can reach this goal, and because of this she works very hard at her business, so that she may be able to achieve well-being for her family. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she promises to be very punctual in all of her payments. She will use the loan which she requests to purchase a greater quantity of beauty products before the upcoming festivities, during which her sales are certain to be very good.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar productos de belleza.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock for her catering business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sophal Pang Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Prey Totueng village in Kandal province this group of eight people make up a village bank loan. All the members have selected Mrs. Sophal P. as village bank president. They will each use a portion of the loan, for different purpose,s to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Sophal P. is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Sokorn Yem, is a construction laborer. This couple supports four children, three of whom are attending a local public school. One of the children is a laborer, and one is learning to drive a car. Now she has a problem because she does not have enough money to support her children’s learning. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Sophal P. is asking for a loan to pay for for her child’s driving school fee.

loans.use: To pay for her child’s driving school fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying seeds and manure and to expand her fields

loans.name: Milaluz

texts.en:
Milaluz L. is from the village of Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Milaluz is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Milaluz owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Milaluz has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Milaluz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milaluz is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Milaluz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Maryluz

texts.es:
En un sector muy comercial de la localidad de Engativá, en la ciudad de Bogotá  Mary Luz D.  diseña y confecciona vestidos para fiestas especiales y también se dedica al alquiler de esta misma línea de  ropa.
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lo invertirá  en la compra de materia prima, telas e insumos,  para elaborar  vestidos de novia y de quinceañeros que requieren sus clientes. Mary Luz Inició trabajando como jefe de producción en varias fábricas de confecciones, continuó su trabajo  en una boutique especializada en vestidos de novia y hace menos de 2 años, empezó a desarrollar su sueño de ser empresaria: se independizó y  ahora confecciona los más elegantes diseños de vestidos de novia, primera  comunión, quinceañeros vestidos coctel y también ofrece servicios de alquiler para aquellos que asì lo requieran.
Su meta es remodelar las instalaciones donde funciona su negocio,  para que sus productos estén mejor exhibidos  y sean más atractivos a sus clientela; así mismo  sueña con abrir otro almacén para tener más ingresos. Su desafío  constante es la falta de liquidez para comprar materias primas e insumos, que resultan costosos y poder  entregar oportunamente los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the Engativá section of the city of Bogotá, Mary Luz Durán designs and makes gowns for special occasions; she also rents her line of clothing. This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to use it to buy raw materials, fabric and supplies, to make wedding and fifteenth birthday party gowns that her customers require. Mary Luz began working as a production supervisor in several dressmaking factories. She continued working in a boutique that specialized in wedding dresses. A little less than two years ago she began to realize her dream of becoming a businesswoman. She became independent and now designs the most elegant gowns for weddings, first communions, fifteenth birthdays and cocktail dresses. She also rents the dresses to those who so wish. Her goal is to remodel her business location so that her products can be better displayed and be more attractive to her customers. In addition, she’d like to open a second store to generate additional income. Her challenge is the constant lack of liquidity to buy raw materials and supplies that are costly and to be able to complete her orders on time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials, fabric and supplies, to make wedding and fifteenth birthday dresses that her customers require.

loans.name: Ulysses

texts.en: Ulysses S. works for someone who operates a transportation service. His main source of income comes from providing motor transport (habal-habal) services. He is a 28-year-old single man from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Ulysses has been in his business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Ulysses joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Ulysses has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be his ninth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle for better service

loans.name: Nak's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members and have selected Mrs. Nak N. as their group leader.  She was born in 1955 and lives in Prey Lvea Lech village in Takeo province. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses. 

Mrs. Nak N. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to support her family.  Additionally, she is a weaver. Her problem is that her field is ready to harvest but she does not have money to support it. So to improve this situation, Mrs. Nak N. is applying for a loan to hire farming laborers to harvest her rice and with the rest of the loan she will rent a plowing machine. 

She is a widow with seven children, three of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is helping her to do the farming, and the others are studying in school.

loans.use: To hire farming laborers to harvest her rice

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 32 años, vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de su esposo José de 28 años y de su pequeña hija Abril de 3 años. Esta emprendedora mujer trabaja desde muy joven, cada día se despierta con muchos ánimos de salir adelante. Es así que desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de diversos productos para el hogar, como cubrecamas, platos, utensilios de cocina, jarrones, entre otros. Realiza su labor sola, dejando un día, durante las mañanas y tardes, pues no descuida la crianza de su hijo, pero lo que no le gusta es caminar, durante varias horas en busca de clientes, por el centro de la ciudad, que es el lugar por donde trabaja. Pero esta muy satisfecha porque obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los diversos gastos del hogar. Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado instalar un bazar donde pueda ofrecer sus productos con mayor tranquilidad. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere atrasarse y decepcionar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.  Betty tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para ofrecer variedad a su clientela a precios cómodos, de esta manera espera continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Betty is 32 years old and lives at her parents’ house with her husband José, age 28, and their three year old daughter Abril. She has been a hard worker ever since she was a young woman. Each day she wakes up with great optimism to get ahead. For the past five years she has been selling different household products as a street vendor. Betty offers bedspreads, dishes, cookware, vases, and other items. She works by herself in the mornings and evenings so that she does not neglect the care of her daughter. However, she does not like walking around for several hours looking for customers within the central part of the city where she works. Betty is very pleased because she generates a steady income that allows her to help her husband with the various household expenses. Since she is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead even further, Betty plans to open a bazaar where she can offer her merchandise in a more peaceful environment.

This is her second loan with MFP. Betty promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to fall behind and disappoint everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue working and making progress. She plans to invest this loan in a larger quantity of merchandise so that she can offer variety to her customers at affordable prices. In this manner, she hopes to continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of household products

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon G. is a widow who lives in Sitio Pateno, village Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. She has two children who are aged 30 and 32. One already has a family and the other works and helps her in her business. 

Corazon joined NWTF-Project Dungganon because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Corazon has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4200, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19500, which she intends to use to buy more stock to sell in her general store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and her own security. 

Corazon G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.
Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team..

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene B. is from the village of Purok 5, Barangay 24, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old. Arlene is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Jeanne D’ Arc

texts.en:
Jeanne d’Arc is 33 years old, married and has two children, who are 2 and 9 years old.  Jeanne d’ Arc has been in the business of selling timbers for a long time. Her business hours are from 7 am to 6 pm every day.

Jeanne d’Arc needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, she will expand her business by purchasing additional timbers to sell.  Hopefully, she will earn more profit which will allow her to keep reinvesting so she can buy a machine for cutting trees into timbers for sale.

loans.use: To buy additional timbers for sale

loans.name: Marco Alexander

texts.es:
Marco Alexander tiene 37 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Marco Alexander tiene un pequeño negocio de que consiste en alquilar equipos de sonidos para ceremonias. Hace varios años que empezó este negocio y con un poco de capital pero ahora, él tiene un pequeño almacén que está equipado con parlantes, micrófonos, disco de música, amplificadores de sonido, mezcladores de música  y muchas cosas más, él alquila sus artefactos a personas conocidas, amigos, etc. 

Marco Alexander desprende una imagen de un joven trabajador y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Marcos que espera recibir S/. 800 nuevos soles. Por el momento, desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar parlantes y otras cosas. 

Marco Alexander pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marco Alexander is 37 years old and lives in the town of Cusco, Peru. Cusco is a captivating town dating back to Incan times, built on top of the ancient Incan town.

Marco Alexander runs a small activity consisting in renting out sound systems for celebrations. He started this activity a few years ago with a small amount of capital, but he now owns a small storehouse furnished with loudspeakers, microphones, music discs, sound amplifiers, music mixers and many other items. He rents his equipment to people he knows, to friends and so on.

Marco Alexander is the very image of a hard-working and responsible young man. With his next loan of 800 PEN, Marco would like to increase his working capital and to buy other loudspeakers and other items.

Marco Alexander is a member of the Mosoc Killa Communal Bank, and he is thankful for the opportunity he is being given through this loan; at the same time he commits to complying with his repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: To increase his working capital and to buy loudspeakers and other items.

loans.name: Las Alpaquitas Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Las Alpaquitas” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, es un grupo nuevo que se ha reunido para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.    La banca comunal está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  Los negocios que desempeñan son:  venta de trajes en sastrería, tienda de artefactos electrónicos, tejido en tienda, servicio de café, papas fritas, costura de pantalones, venta de ají, venta de juguetes, venta de carne de cordero y chuño.

La presidenta de la banca comunal, la señora Elena Santa,  está casada, es madre de 2 hijos.  La señora Elena Santa tiene como negocio una tienda de barrio en su domicilio, la misma es atendida desde las seis y media de la mañana hasta las diez y media de la noche, debido al horario de atención recibe la colaboración de su esposo y de sus hijos.
El crédito que está solicitando le servirá para la compra de mercadería para la tienda, en particular para abarrotes.

Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta la atención en crédito por que es rápida.  Con respecto a la atención en  salud indica que ha sido muy bien orientada con respecto a su embarazo.
texts.en:
The 'Las Alpaquitas' community bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada regional office.  This is a new group which has come together to receive loan services, training and health services.  The bank has eight members.  The members' businesses are: selling clothes in a tailor's shop, electronic goods store, knitting store, café service, selling french fries, sewing pants, selling chili peppers, selling toys, selling lamb and selling potato flour.

The community bank's president is Elena Santa.  She is married and has 2 children.  Elena Santa has a neighborhood store in her home.  She serves in her store from 6.30 in the morning until 10.30 at night.  Owing to the hours she works in the store, she receives help from her husband and her children.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise for her store, in particular for groceries.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she comments that she likes the loan service because it is quick.  Regarding the health services, she says that she has been very well advised with respect to her pregnancy.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Mukuza Women's Group

texts.en:
K. Joachim is the leader of the Mukuza group in Kyenjojo. He is 43 years old and married with 6 children. He and his wife have a business growing tea and they have managed their business together for 8 years. Their major customer is Mabale Growers Tea Factory in Mirambi. Joachim also deals in the selling and buying of other produce, anything that sells on the market. He is able to make 100,000 UGX in monthly profits.

Joachim needs a loan to be able to purchase fertilizers for his tea farm with the hope that it will enable him to yield more output. He previously had a retail shop that yielded capital enabling him to start this business. He has been prospering even more after having bought shamba tea.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his plantation.

loans.name: Jennalyn

texts.en: Jennalyn L. is from the village of Alanib, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Jennalyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jennalyn makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies like rice cakes and hot cakes in the local community. Jennalyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Jennalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennalyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Jennalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 26 años, es una mujer soltera y trabajadora; que vive en compañía de su mamá Abelarda, de 52 y su papá Abraham, de 54 años de edad, a los que quiere y cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Desde que tenia 20 años de edad, se dedico a la agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de papa y alverjas; lo que más le gusta de su labor es poder cuidar de su becerra mientras limpia la maleza que crece entre sus sembríos, pero lo que no le gusta a Elizabeth, son las temporadas donde los agricultores cosechan gran cantidad de hortalizas, ya que saturan el mercado y no le permite tener buenas ganancias. Pero es en está temporada que ella, deja secar la alverja, la cual se convierte en semilla, vendiendo el saco de semilla de alverja a un mayor precio; en el mercado central de Tarma, lo que le permite estabilizar su economía. Por todos lo aciertos que tiene está pensando abrir un restaurante en su zona, ya que no existe una. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y como mujer joven, asegura que el papel que cumple su banco comunal en su vida, es preponderante, ya que le ayuda a crecer y forjarse nuevas metas. De obtener el crédito comprará 15 sacos de abono orgánico que oscila entre los 100 nuevos soles aproximadamente.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 26 years old and single.  She is a hard-working woman who lives with her mom, 52 year-old Abelarda, and her dad, 54 year-old Abraham.  She loves and looks after her parents in their own home which is located in the village of Cumutay.

Since she was 20 years old, Elizabeth has been working as a farmer.  Her main crops are potatoes and peas.  What she most likes about her work is being able to look after her calf while she clears away the weeds that grow between her crops.  What Elizabeth does not like are the seasons when farmers grow a large quantity of vegetables because they flood the market and she can't make good profits.  In this season she is leaving her pea crop to dry.  She will convert it into seed and will sell sacks of pea seed at a higher price in the central market in Tarma which will allow her to stabilize her finances.

With all the good decisions that she has made, Elizabeth is thinking of opening a restaurant in her area because there isn't one at present.

This is Elizabeth's eighth loan with MFP and, as a young woman, she assures us that her community bank plays a predominant role in her life since it helps her to grow and set herself new goals.  Elizabeth will use this loan to buy 15 sacks of organic fertilizer which cost around 100 Peruvian soles a sack.

loans.use: To buy 15 sacks of organic fertilizers

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia M. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 53 years old. Lucresia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucresia owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lucresia also helps her husband maintain their rice farm.

Lucresia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucresia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lucresia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Five people are forming a group loan; they are located in Anlong Ta Sek Leu village in Kandal province. The members of this group will use their portions to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Srey E. is 45 years old and she is the group leader, selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Seang Lay, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice for selling to support their family. They also earn by selling vegetables and mango in the markE.. 

This couple has three children who are students and also help on their parents' farm. 

In order to improve their children's education, Mrs. Srey E. decided to ask for a loan to pay for her children's school fee. With the rest of the loan, she will buy fertilizers to support her farming crops.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fee

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia D. is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old and married. To make a living, Letecia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Letecia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Lomita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama lomita esta ubicado en la localidad de las animas, perteneciente al municipio de tecoanapa guerrero, los integrantes del grupo decidieron  ponerle este nombre puesto que asi se llama la colonia donde viven y todas pertenecen a esta misma.
La historia es acerca de la señora Elena V. M., ya que es la representante del grupo, ella es casada su esposo se llama Felipe, cuenta con 27 años de edad, tiene dos hijos anelis y maricela, de los cuales los dos estudian, la mayor esta en primer año de primaria y la otra esta  en primer año de preescolar, ella se dedica a la repostería,(venta de pasteles, flanes, gelatinas y postres).

Elena se decidió por ese negocio ya que dice que tiene mucha demanda, puesto que únicamente vende en su casa y le deja muy buenas ganancias, además tiene muchos clientes, ella ya lleva mas de 5 años con su  negocio, e invirtió su crédito en la compra de mas ingredientes y materia prima como son: mantequilla, moldes, grenetina, polvo para hornear, harina, huevos, levadura y algunas frutas, para continuar con la elaboración de sus productos.

Con las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio, ella esta ahorrando para construir una barda a su casa y también esta apoyando a su esposo con el sustento de la casa aunque no son muchos los gastos ya que sus hijos todavía están pequeños.

Comenta que su negocio está beneficiando mucho a los vecinos de su colonia, ya que no hay muchas personas que vendan estos productos ahí cerca, puesto que todas las tiendas están hasta el municipio y ella aprovecha por que algunos de sus vecinos no les gusta salir hasta el centro y así que como esta mas cerca van a comprar ahí, también por la atención y servicio que les brinda. 

El sueño que tiene doña Elena y espera algún día poder cumplirlo es el de construir un local ahí mismo en su casa para poner una pastelería, ya que es su anhelo mas grande, para mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos y así continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios y asegurar su futuro.

Nos dice que los integrantes de su grupo, son personas muy responsables, trabajadoras y puntuales, ya que tienen tiempo de conocerse y se llevan muy bien, puesto que viven en la misma comunidad.

Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio esta mejorando mucho.

Los integrantes de lomita y las actividades a las que se dedican son las siguientes:
Irma G. D.-venta de pollos
Isabel M. ZaM.-venta de pollos
Cipriana M. B.-frutería
Ysmelda G. L.-venta de tamales
Yurivia G. L. -dulceria
Domitila G. G.-frutería
Elena V. M.-reposteria
Ortencia M. ZaM.-venta de perfumes
Metodia G. M.-dulcería
Jeammy G. Rayón-venta de cosméticos
texts.en:
This group is called 'Lomita' and is located in the Las Animas locale, Tecoanapa Guerrero municipality. The group members decided to give the group this name as the district where they live goes by the same name, and all the members are from there. 

This description is about Mrs Elena V. M., who is the group's representative. She is married to Felipe, who is 27, and they have 2 children - Anelis and Maricela, who both study. The oldest is in the first year of primary school and the other is in the first year of preschool. Elena has a cake shop (selling cakes, flans, jellies and desserts). 

Elena decided to start her business as she says that there is a lot of demand. She sells from her home and generates good profits, as she also has many clients. Elena has had her business for more than 5 years. She will invest this loan in purchase more ingredients and primary materials such as butter, moulds, gelatin, baking powder, flour, eggs, yeast and some fruits, to continue making her products. 

With the earnings fro her business she is saving to construct a cement wall in her house and is also helping her husband to maintain the household, although the costs aren't large as their children as still small. 

She tells us that her business is benefitting many of her district's neighbours, as there aren't many people who sells this type of products nearby,  as all the shops are in the town and Elena takes advantage of the fact that some of her neighbours don't like going into the centre. As she is closer, they come to her to buy, and also because of the attention and services that she gives them. 

Elena's dream is to one day build her own shop in her house and install a cake shop. This is her biggestdream, to improve and increase her earnings and continue to support her children with their studies and give them a secure future. 

She tells us that the group members are very responsible, punctual and hard-working people, as she has known them for a long time and they get along well, as they all live in the same community. 

Elena is very thankful to Fundación Realidad and Kiva for the support that this loan has given her, as thanks to this her business is improving a lot. 

The members of Lomita and their respective activities are:

Irma G. D. - chicken sales
Isabel M. ZaM. - chicken sales
Cipriana M. B. - fruit sales
Ysmelda G. L. - tamale sales
Yurivia G. L. - sweet shop
Domitila G. G. - fruit shop
Elena V. M. - cake shop
Ortencia M. ZaM. - perfume sales
Metodia G. M. - sweet shop
Jeammy G. Rayón - cosmetic sales

loans.use: Purchase more ingredients such as butter, moulds, gelatin, baking powder, flour, eggs, yeast and fruit invirtió su crédito en la compra de mas ingredientes y materia prima como

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en:
Calixta is a special loan client with Esperanza and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti, generally. She lives in the town of Hato Mayor, an agricultural town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband, where they raised three children.

Calixta is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her vegetables and fruit stall by purchasing potatoes, plantains, salad ingredients, and a lot of tropical fruit. She has had her business for around six years, after she received her first loan of $700 US. She enjoys working and taking care of her house. Her future plan is to become a successful businesswoman with an improved business. She will use the profit to save for her future. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit and other goods.

loans.name: Benemerito Group

texts.es: En Pueblo Nuevo de los Angeles se encuentra el grupo de Benemerito, cerca de la casa de doña Marybel esta una presa grandisima y la gente viene a pescar y tambien hay gente que todavia viene a lavar su ropa, es una comunidad indigena y por eso existen estas costumbres todavia, Doña Marybel se dedica a la engorda de reces, y solicitó su prestamo para comprar el alimento como zacate molido y engordar los toros, no cría reces solo las engorda para que en poco tiempo pueda venderlas, ya tiene un cliente que semana tras semana le compra una res, uno de los desafios que enfrento en mi negocio es que el zacate cada dia es mas caro y yo nesecito bastante para que mis reces engorden bien, pero yo ya no le puedo subir mas al precio de mi res para que me recupere porque si lo hago ya no me la compran, el prestamo va beneficiar mucho porque me voy apoyar para invertir en otra res y comprar el alimento lo que hago es darle vuelta al dinero para que salgan las ganancias, las metas que tengo es que con mi negocio pueda mejorar mi casa, arreglarla con las cosas que hacen falta y tambien para mis hijos, que tengo 4 estudiando, en total son 6 pero dos ya trabajan, tengo 21 años de casada, la casa es propia y mi esposo es comerciante, el incremento en las ganancias me ayuda porque quiero comprar una lap-top que nesecita mi hijo que va en la preparatoria y haga sus tareas. Los otros compañeros del grupo de Marybel son: Teresa(borregos), Crispina(tienda), Trinidad(tienda), Eva(pollos), Maria(pollos),Otilia(borregos), Yolanda(ganado), Violeta (tienda), Elena (borregos) y Maricela (plasticos).
texts.en:
The Benemerito group is located in Pueblo Nuevo de los Angeles.  Near Marybel's home there is a very large dam and people come there to fish.  Some still come there to wash their clothes.  This is an indigenous community and so these customs still survive.  Marybel's business is fattening cattle.  She requested her loan to buy ground feed to fatten her bulls.  She does not raise cattle but fattens them so that she can sell them a short while later.  She already has customers who buy a cow from her week after week.

"One of the challenges I have faced in my business is that feed is becoming more and more expensive and I need quite a lot so that my cattle put on a good amount of weight.  However, I can't increase the price of my cattle any further in order to make this money back because if I do they won't buy from me any more.  The loan will help me a lot because it will help me to invest in another cow and buy feed.  What I do is I use the money so that I can make profits from it.  My goals are to work in my business so that I can improve my home and fix it up with the things that it lacks.  I also want to provide for my four children who are studying (I have six children in total but two of them are already working).  I have been married for 21 years, I own my own home and my husband is a salesman.  The increase in profits will help me because I would like to buy a laptop that my son needs.  He is in high school and needs it for his work".

The other members of Marybel's group are: Teresa (who raises lambs), Crispina (who owns a store), Trinidad (who owns a store), Eva (who raises chickens), Maria (who raises chickens), Otilia (who raises lambs), Yolanda (who raises cattle), Violeta (who owns a store), Elena (who raises lambs) and Maricela (who sells plastic products).

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten her cattle

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry K. A. is 36 years old, married, and a father of three beautiful children. He lives in Tuiyo, in the outskirts of Eldoret. His wife Esther has a horticulture business in the same area and adds to the family's income. Henry buys and sells livestock and also sells milk from his dairy cows to his customers. 


He has been in this business for ten years now and gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.This will be Henry's second loan from KADET LTD, he plans to use the entire money to buy more cows for sale. 

The income he is going to get he will  buy dairy cows so that he can increase his milk production for sale. In future he wants to diversify his business and start a butchery business in Eldoret town, he also wants to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more cows for sale

loans.name: Adolfina
loans.use: to purchase a pair of piglets and fodder, as well as to make a pig cage

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old widowed woman from Lebanon. She lives with her three young children. After the death of her husband, she became the main person responsible for supporting her family. She started running her own clothing store in 2010. She sells different types of clothes and always presents new collections to attract more clients. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory. She says the loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to sell women's shoes and bags by adding a corner for this purpose in her store.

loans.use: to expand her store’s clothing inventory.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, sont toutes des femmes mariées Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massoukou, sous préfecture de Fana; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le maraîchage et le commerce de charbon.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des semences et du charbon.                                                                        
La cliente FANTA compte acheter des semences avec les revendeurs du marché de Marka-Coungo. Elle effectue la vente de ses récoltes au village de Massoukou et au niveau du marché de Marka-Coungo, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de maraîchage.
texts.en:
The women of the Tiessiri group are all married with an average age of 28 years old and three chidren; they all live in extended traditional families in the village of Massoukou, in the sub-prefecture of Fana, which lies in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other through relatives, neighbors and friends. They are active in market gardening and trading charcoal.

The women in this group are on their first solidarity loan which will be used to buy seeds and charcoal.

The customer, Fanta, is planning to buy seeds from retailers in the market at Marka-Coungo. She sells her crop in the village of Massoukou and in the Marka-Coungo market, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which will be used to make her loan repayments and contribute to social ceremonies; the balance will be reinvested in her market gardening business.

loans.use: to buy seeds for market gardening

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 56 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell (like milk, groceries, etc.) in her sari-sari store.

Lorna has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from electronic reloading and farming nipa (palm, used for various purposes, such as roofing thatch).

Lorna aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gennalyn

texts.en:
Gennalyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Gennalyn has a shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods, which she has run for four years. She has requested a loan for 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more products to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

Gennalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and canned goods.

loans.name: Dashkin

texts.en:
Dashkin is 40 years old, married and has three children. He works as teacher in the local school. He has a small cow-house where he breeds calves. Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. His salary is 100 USD and his monthly profit from business is 300 USD. Actually this is very low for his large family.

Dashkin buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. He provides the market with meat and his family with the necessary food. Dashkin wants to buy young cattle and needs money, so he decided to apply for a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 45-year-old farmer. He is a widower with four children who are 20, 17, 14 and 11 years old. He has been in the business for the past seven years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family needs.
 
He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children up to university level. His hope and dream is to export his farm produce, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  El lugar es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las nuevas siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos la señora Gloria, tiene 60 años D. edad y mantiene una relación D. unión libre D. la cual tiene tres hijos y nos cuenta:

“Nací en la ciudad D. Anta (Cusco, Perú), ahora vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donD. desarrollo mi actividad económica que es vender comida, Yo preparó diferentes tipos D. platos D. comida como por ejemplo arroz con pollo, estofado, chicharrón y otros más, y me va muy bien”. 

Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Este crédito es para comprar 5 sacos D. arroz, 3 sacos D. azúcar y un lata D. aceite.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Vamos Juntas" meets every month in the city of Cusco.  This location is famous for its tourism and commercial activity as well as for the traditional Inti Raymi festivity.  One of the new Seven Wonders of the World, "Machupicchu", is also located here.

Mrs. Gloria, 60, has a common-law husband and three children.  She tells us:

"I was born in the city of Anta (Cusco, Perú) but now live in the city of Cusco where I have my food business.  I prepare different dishes such as chicken with rice, stew, pork rinds and others, and business is going well".

She has been in business for 25 years and her hard work has maD. it a success.  The loan will be used to buy five sacks of rice, three sacks of sugar and a can of oil.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of rice, three sacks of sugar and a can of oil.

loans.name: Munywambogo Abalema Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Benard is a Ugandan man, age 55, who needs a loan to prepare land for cultivation and plant maize. He is from the Kyenjojo district. Benard is a father of four children who are between the ages of 10 and 18. He dreams of building a good house and planting more than 10 acres of maize. 
\t
He is a member of the Munywambogo Abalema Teimukye Tukole group, where the members guarantee each other's loans.

loans.use: to prepare land for cultivation and plant maize.

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Alma Rosa y el señor Miguel Ángel son padres de familia y tiene cuatro hijos bajo su responsabilidad.
Están solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar los uniformes y útiles escolares que son (libros, cuadernos, carpetas y mochilas). Ya que en este momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para que sus hijos pueda cursar este ciclo escolar sin problema. 
Doña Alma Rosa es empleada de una compañía que da los servicios de ahorro para el retiro de los trabajadores como asesora de ventas, con este ingreso pagar el crédito, ya que Don Miguel Ángel se encargara de los gastos familiares con el suelo que recibe de su trabajo en una fabrica. 
Desean proporcionarles a sus hijos una mejor educación para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Alma Rosa and Miguel Ángel are parents and responsible for four children. They are requesting a loan in order to buy uniforms and school supplies (books, notebooks, folders, and backpacks) since at the moment they do not have the money necessary for their children to study this school term without any problems. 

Alma Rosa is an employee of a company that provides saving services for workers' retirement as a sales adviser. With this income, the loan will be paid since Miguel Ángel will be in charge of family expenses with the wage he receives from his work in a factory. 

They would like to provide their children with a better education so that they have a better future.

loans.use: to buy uniforms and school supplies.

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Richelle is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Richelle is 31 years old and her three children are in school.

Richelle has a (palm leaves) nipa mat business in the Philippines. Richelle requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more palm leaves for her "nipa" making.

Richelle has been in this business for five years. Richelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more palm leaves for her "nipa" (palm frond mat) making.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Erlinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages . She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
Charito de 34 años, vive en su casa propia con su familia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona   se caracterizan por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Charito se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cerdos y aves de corral), desde hace 3 años, cuenta con sus corrales apropiados para sus animales, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para engordarlos y pueda venderlos a sus clientes a un buen precio, obteniendo ingresos para solventar sus necesidades familiares.

Al observar Charito que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de animales de corral y su respectivo alimento para los mismos, al tenerlos bien alimentados tendrá mas ventas de sus animales y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito otorgado, mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Charito, 34, lives in her own house that only has electricity with her family; it’s located in Tambogrande District that belongs to Piura Department.  This zone is noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts making.

Charito has been raising small farm animals (pigs and barnyard fowl) to sell for the last three years.  She has corrals that are appropriate for her animals.  She feeds them balanced feed and natural grasses to fatten them up so that she can sell them to her customers for good prices obtaining income to meet family needs.

Seeing that her business is more prosperous every day, Charito has felt it necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy larger numbers of animals and their respective feed to keep them well fed and have more sales.  Income obtained will allow her to repay the loan while improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of small farm animals and their feed.

loans.name: Weyeta Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Weyeta Group in Western Kenya! Joan is the facilitator of the Weyeta SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joan takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, she had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Joan was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Wilberforce and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February, 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. In 2012, the members of Weyeta SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With income from maize sales, Joan will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In the photo, Joan is pictured with his group and on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking lady. She is married to David and they have seven children.

Susan does a cereal selling business at the Megwara Shopping Center, where she sells maize cereal. She has been doing this for the last three years and makes a monthly income of 11,000 Kenyan shillings. She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD., which she will use to buy more maize cereal for sale.

She plans to diversify to maize farming to increase her income so that she is able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy stock of maize cereal for sale.

loans.name: Geno

texts.en:
Geno is 26 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. He is single and has a pig business to earn a living. He requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase feeds and vitamins.

Geno has been a member of PMPC for less than one year. In the future, he hopes to have more income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Bendetah

texts.en:
Bendetah is the mother of four children, aged between seven and fourteen, who are all in school. She has been in farming for 10 years and currently employs one farmhand. She supplies maize and milk to the local market. She also trades in timber for additional income.

Bendetah has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says she will use the income to educate her children and venture into the transport business. She would want to transport milk from farmers to the market.

She laments the poor roads that result in significant produce losses, especially milk.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is a focused businesswoman who is 37 years old. She is single and blessed with two children who are in school. For the last seven years, she has been selling clothes to support her family. She also does farming to supplement her income. She describes her business as busy since her potential customers are the passersby and local residents. In the next five years, she plans to manage a wholesale business. Peninah has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy a stock of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ferial

texts.en:
Ferial is a 44-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband, three children and one relative. Her husband and two of her children are employed, and Ferial has been farming on her own land since 1980.

A good farmer who knows very well how to deal with agricultural problems that arise, she is requesting a loan of $3000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her land. Ferial notes that this will boost her productivity and thus her revenues, and in the future, she plans to open her own vegetable-vending shop.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her land.

loans.name: Elivil

texts.en:
Elivil is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food manufacturing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more ingredients to her food manufacturing business.

Elivil has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from a restaurant.

Elivil has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save enough to expand her business and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her chorizo business.

loans.name: Arpine

texts.en: Arpine is a 34-year-old entrepreneur from Yerevan. She has been running a kindergarten for four years. Arpine has applied for a loan to improve conditions in the kindergarten. She plans to pay for renovating the heating system. This will help Arpine to attract new clients and expand the kindergarten in the future.

loans.use: to pay for heating system renovation

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
Memuna sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together) and she serves it with meat and fish stew in Ankako. She is married and has seven dependents. Her husband works at a gas filling station. 

Memuna has been selling waakye for 30 years. She uses her income to assist her husband with pay their housing bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice, beans, fish, meat and other ingredients for the preparation of the waakye to be sold. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to set up a good and convenient place to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, beans, fish, meat and other ingredients for the preparation of waakye to be sold.

loans.name: Denis Beatriz

texts.es:
Denis de 20 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, debido a la mala situación económica de su familia, solo pudo estudiar hasta 6°grado de educación básica, actualmente vive con sus padres y nadie depende de ella.

Denis tiene 4 años de tener una  granja de pollos, tomo la decisión de trabajar de esta manera debido a la necesidad de cubrir los gastos del hogar y ayudar a sus padres, empezó con 15 pollos comenta. En la granja le ayudan su padres y l estar el producto ella lo vende en las tiendas de su comunidad y de manera ambulante. Su día de trabajo inicia a las 5:00 am y termina a las 5:00 pm

El crédito será invertido en la compra de 400 pollos de engorde  y 30 quintales de concentrado para desarrollarlos hasta el punto de venta, ella sueña con algún día engordar 800 pollos, construir otra galera y tener su propia casa.

loans.use: Para comprar 400 pollos de engorde  y 30 quintales de concentrado

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is new to this institution. He applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX. He runs a carpentry workshop and he therefore runs the unfortunate business of making coffins in the town of Rukungiri. He has been in this business for 13 years. He started the business because it had less competition and was also profitable since death is unavoidable.  The purpose of this loan is to purchase more timber for making more coffins so that he can expand his business and make be able to meet his family's financial needs. 

He is an honest and hardworking young man who is always limited by lack of capital to expand his business. This he hopes though to solve with this financial support. Moses therefore, hopes that this loan will enable his business to expand.

loans.use: to purchase timber

loans.name: Huệ

texts.en:
Mrs Huệ is 38 years old and she is married.
 
She has had a service business laying bricks for more than 10 years.
Huệ lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. In 2014, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Huệ has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Her family has no latrine. The most difficult that she face is lack of capital to build a new latrine, Huệ is request a loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to purchase cement, brick, sand,... to build a hygienic toilet.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase cement, brick, sand,... to build a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick lives in Lumo in Dar es Salaam. He is married with one child. He is self employed and owns a small shop near his residence. The shop sells different consumable items. Mainly food items, which have high demand.  The shop provides him with an opportunity to raise his family. He would like to expand his business so that he can meet costs of raising the family. The shop employs himself and his wife. To expand his business he needs  USD 400.

loans.use: Adding stock of food items

loans.name: Ngone

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the five members of the Daradji association, led by Ngone S.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“ Context : This business is located in the village of Yoff, and it is initiated by a group of senior citizens in order to occupy themselves and contribute to the well-being of the local villagers by addressing the current scarcity of cooking gas in Senegal.

Objectives: To establish a cooking gas supply store in order to help solve the problem of the lack of cooking gas in the village of Yoff.

Business activities: These consist of purchasing cooking gas from wholesale suppliers and reselling it to the villagers of Yoff.”

Original French business description:

« Contexte du Projet: Ce projet se situe dans l’éco village de Yoff il est initié par des personnes du troisième âge qui pour s’occuper,et vouloir contribuer à la satisfaction des populations vu les punéries momentané de gaz au Sénégal .

Objectifs du Prêt : Installer un magasin d’approvisionnement da gaz afin d’aider à régler les problèmes de manque de gaz dans le village de Yoff.

Activités : Elle consiste à acheter du gaz chez les commerçants grossistes et le revendre aux populations de Yoff . »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of cooking gas; transportation to village for retail sale

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Mrs Hoang is 45 years old. She is supporting two children between the ages of 4 and 23. An, her first son is going to the university. Mrs Hoang must support her mother and her sister who are often sick. Her mother is 77 of age, and her sister suffers from arthritis, so Mrs Hoang must spend about $13 per month for their medical treatment. The family has only 3000 square meters to plant rice and their rice production is only enough for them to eat. Mrs Hoang sells fish at a small market but she doesn’t have capital so she can’t buy large fish quantities. Mrs Hoang hopes she can borrow a loan of $50 with no interest so that she can improve for her fish business. Average income is low at about $7/person/month.

loans.use: Purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is single, mother of two children whom one is in school and the other one is about to join college. She is an active member of Mother Joy women group. She has a grocery business which is the only source of income. She also practices small scale farming but for home use. She normally buys vegetables and cereals from the village and sells them to the upmarket. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. Elizabeth would like to buy varieties of cereals for her grocery due to high demand from her customers. She is applying a loan to be able to buy them at once then she will be repaying her loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Sarah would like to buy cereals for her grocery shop

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria Dolores is a single mother who at 15 years of age had twin girls. Since she suddenly had to support her daughters and the only thing she knew how to do well was cook, she began a food service business with the support of her mother. Two years ago, knowing of the demand for hot meals in her community, she began offering and selling dishes to her neighbors, including lunches and dinners, and thanks to these efforts has been able to support her family.

Maria Dolores is asking for a loan in the amount of $425 USD to be able to expand her business, increase her earnings, and improve her quality of life, planning to repay the loan in six months. Maria and her daughters thank you for your support that allows them to keep going.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

María Dolores es una madre soltera que a los 15 años de edad quedó embaraza y tuvo gemelas por ello como tenía que mantener a sus niñas y solo conocía bien el arte de la cocina, para poder salir adelante tuvo el apoyo de su mamá hace dos años atrás y sabiendo que había mucha demanda de alimentos preparados en su comunidad fue como empezó ofreciendo sus comidas entre sus vecinas haciendo almuerzos y comidas, y gracias a su esfuerzo a podido salir adelante con su familia.

María Dolores esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 425 para poder ampliar su negocio y obtener mayores ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y sus hijas te agradecen el apoyo que le das para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.en:
Rosalia has a store which she has owned for about eight years. She started her business with money she had saved up and the help of a loan from a family member. Initially, she sold a variety of items ranging from rice to snacks. She saw opportunities to expand her business into a general store by increasing her line of offerings.

Consequently, Rosalia took out a loan with Mifex and Kiva to purchase school supplies, fashion accessories and novelty gifts. This resulted in greater sales and profits for her especially with school supplies since the school year was beginning at that time.

This business is a very important part of Rosalia’s household. Although her husband works hard as a door-to-door salesman of goods, Rosalia must rely on her store in order to cover the basic expenses. She works daily from 6AM to 10PM. She has three children who are in school. With Christmas on the way, Rosalia would like to invest in holiday decorations and gifts but she lacks the working capital to do so.

Rosalia is requesting a second loan so she may purchase those products now while prices are still low. In this manner, she can offer a decent price to her clients while still making a profit herself. Rosalia’s dream is to make more improvement to her home and provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: To invest in Christmas decorations and items

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: I am a widow with four children: three sons and one daughter. All of my children are above 18 and had to quit their school after primary grades due to lack of money to pay for their school fees. One of my sons makes embroidered clothes, the other one is a tailor and the youngest of all works in a local factory. I need a loan of $500 for my son who is a tailor. He operates his business in a rented shop and does well. He also sells unstitched cloth at his shop to his customers so that they do not have to go to far away markets for it. He has three workers to help him in the business. Now he wishes to expand his business further and buy cloth in bulk for which he requires a loan. He plans to save the extra profits for his sister’s marriage.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Elida Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elida Elizabeth, a member of the community bank "Los Jasmines", works selling groceries, bread products, household goods and cosmetics in a store located in her own house, which is located on the street Jr. Cajamarca, number 220, in the district and province of Moyabambo and the region of San Martín. She has enjoyed business since she was a young girl. When she separated from her husband she decided to start a business of her own as a way to help her 2 children move ahead.

With this loan of 3000 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a variety of groceries including boxes of soap of different brands (marsella, bolivar and jumbo, for example), 50 kilogram sacks of rice, sugar and various legumes, packages of toilet paper, boxes of canned fish and fruit and liters of oil. Additionally, she will buy bread molds, sacks of flour, raisins and fruit preserves by the kilogram, culinary essences, bins of eggs, yeast, and boxes of milk.

Elida is 39 years old. She has always distinguished herself by being hardworking, perseverant and tenacious about getting ahead. She dreams of one day having her own vehicle with which to sell her breads in the country houses of the villages near her city.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.
