La señora Elida Elizabeth, socia del Banco Comunal Los Jazmines, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, panadería, pasamanería y cosméticos en una tienda ubicada en su propia casa, la cual se encuentra en el Jr. Cajamarca Nº 220, distrito y provincia de Moyabamba , departamento de San Martín. Desde muy pequeña le gustó el negocio y al separarse de su esposo decidió poner algo propio y así sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como cajas de jabón de diferentes marcas (marsella, bolivar, jumbo), sacos de 50 kilos de arroz, azúcar y menestras de diversos variedades, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado y de frutas en cajas, aceite por litros; además comprará moldes para panteón, harina en sacos, pasas y frutas confitadas en kilos, esencias, huevos en jabas y levadura y leche en cajas.

Elida tiene 39 años, siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer luchadora, muy trabajadora responsable y perseverante. Sueña con tener una movilidad propia para poder vender sus panes por los caseríos aledaños.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, legumes, etc.)

loans.name: Tweyambe A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fida K.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to expand business. Fida is 35 years old and is married with a husband who brews local beer. She has 5 children ranging from age 3 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Fida makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children . Fida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to purchase a weighing scale and the loan was paid back on time.

Fida is joined in her small group by Hadija K., Alisha N., Rebecca L., and Cate W.. Hadija K. has a business selling used clothes and wants to increase her stock of clothes. Alisha N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to start a new business. Rebecca L. operates a business of tailoring and wants to add to the business. Cate W. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to boost the clothing business.

loans.use: To boost retail shop business

loans.name: Joko

texts.en: Joko A. is married with two children. She is 32 years old and owns a computer business. She studied computers for a year before starting her business. She resides in Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 1998. She needs a loan of $600 to buy a computer and rent a bigger shop. She thanks you.

loans.use: To rent a bigger shop and buy an additional computer

loans.name: Asha's Tropicana Group

texts.en:
Asha is 30 years old and is divorced with 2 children, ages 10 and 3. Asha is a cloth seller; she started her business in 2007. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Habiba and Mwajuma, who have businesses dealing in a medical store and cloth sales.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Omar De Jesus

texts.es:
Omar is 48 years old and married. He has four children, one of whom is financially independent. His wife is a homemaker and spends time looking after the home and the other three children.

Omar grows pineapples on land that he owns. He has made a living cultivating pineapples for several years now, and has used previous loans to successfully improve the quality of his product.

The pineapple harvest is now approaching, and Omar is requesting the present loan so that he can purchase the last supplies he needs for the harvest and ensure that his product will be of the best quality.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Don Omar es casada y tiene 48 años de edad. Su familia está compuesta por 4 hijos, de los cuales sólo uno ya es independiente a él. Su esposa es ama de casa y se dedica al cuido del hogar y de sus otros tres hijos.

Don Omar se dedica al cultivo de piñas unas tierras de su misma propiedad. Ya tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad y por medio de préstamos ha ido mejorando la calidad de su productos.

La cosecha de piña está próxima, y solicita el préstamo para comprar los últimos insumos necesarios para aplicárselo al producto y que este salga 100% de buena calidad.

loans.use: Purchasing agricultural supplies for the harvest

loans.name: Lon

texts.en: Mrs. Lon K. is a subsistence farmer in Trapang Mates Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  Her rice revenue is very small because Mrs. Lon K. the plot of cultivatable land she owns is very small. She now wants to expand her plantation. Mrs. Lon K. is requesting a loan to buy a part of rice field to grow rice and vegetables. Besides farming, Mrs. Lon K. sews a palm leaves together to re-sell for a profit. Mrs. Lon K. is 47 and a widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the two others are attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy a part of rice field for growing rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr:
Single and 26 years old with one child, Mr. Yawo A. was born in Missawomé, a village in Togo. Not having had much education, he left his village very early for the city of Lomé where he hoped to earn a living. He then got involved in small businesses. These experiences served him well because he was able to choose and succeed in one of these businesses since 2005, namely the buying and selling of assorted general food products. He is a retailer and often adapts to his customers’ needs which has given him a monopoly over most of his customers compared to his competitors. In order to better serve his customers, Mr. A. would like to take out his first loan so he can increase his stock by buying 10 boxes of beverages and 8 sacks of rice.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Célibataire, âgé de 26 ans, avec un enfant à la charge, monsieur A. Yawo est né à Missawomé un village du TOGO. N’ayant pas trop fréquenté, il quitta très tôt son village pour la ville de Lomé où il compte gagner sa vie. C’est ainsi qu’il s’est lancé dans de petits commerces. Ces expériences lui ont servit car il a su choisir et exceller dans l’un des commerces depuis 2005, l’achat et vente de divers produits d’alimentation générale. Il est alors détaillant et s’adapte souvent au besoin de ses clients ce qui fait qu’il monopolise la plupart des clients face à ses concurrents. Dans le souci de mieux servir ses clients, monsieur A., voudrait prendre ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock par l’achat de 10 cartons de boisson et de 8 sacs de riz.

loans.use: Purchase of staple products

loans.name: Roukiyatou Alakè Row

texts.fr:
Born on May 18, 1983 in Cotonou (Littoral Department, Southern Benin), Mrs. Roukiyatou Alakè Rowoshola M. is married and the mother of one child. She's a reseller of electrical sundries and woodworking tools. She gets her supplies from department stores in Cotonou. Currently, she's experiencing difficulties in getting her supplies due to lack of financial means. For this reason, she's seeking her first loan of $350.00 (150000.00 XOF) to buy stock and meet customer demand. She also intends to expand her area of business to other types of products such as home appliances.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 18 Mai 1983 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au Sud du Bénin, dame M. Roukiyatou Alakè Rowoshola est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est une revendeuse des matériaux d'électricité et de menuiserie. Elle s'approvisionne dans les grands magasins de Cotonou. Actuellement, elle éprouve quelques difficultés d'approvisionnement faute de moyens financiers. Pour cette raison elle sollicite pour son premier crédit une somme de 150 000 francs afin de s'approvisionner, de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et aussi d'élargir le champ de son activité à d'autres types de produits tels que des appareils électroménagers.

loans.use:
To buy 
Achat d'équipements de menuiserie et d'électricité.

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.en:
U. Sarvinoz is a 21-year-old lady. She is very entrepreneurial and hardworking, with innumerable plans for her future. She doesn’t study but in spite of it she is helping her parents to get ahead. For three years already Sarvinoz has been processing and selling dried fruits in the local market. As a rule, she purchases dried fruits in the market and processes them together with her sister who helps her with the business. Because she buys dried apricots wholesale, her prices are lower than regular market prices. She offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Sarvinoz to make her business quite successful and it brings a stable income to her family.

Today Sarvinoz requests 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for the term of 9 months. She is going to use the loan for purchasing dried fruits to further process and sell. Sarvinoz expresses her gratitude to everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Increasing of the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Née en 1966, dame KEGBEGNON Abla est une veuve  avec trois enfants en charge. Les trois enfants sont tous scolarisés et constituent pour elle une grosse charge. Depuis le décès de son mari elle rencontre beaucoup de difficultés pour joindre les deux bouts. Elle est une revendeuse de charbon de bois d’ignames et de maïs mais compte tenu de ses charges les stocks de maïs et d’igname sont épuisés et elle n’arrive pas seule à faire l’approvisionnement.
Raison pour laquelle elle sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter 60 ignames, 2 sacs de maïs et 12 sacs  de charbon de bois.
texts.en:
Born in 1966, Mrs. Abla Kegbegnon is a widow raising three children. The three children are all enrolled in school and so are a big expense for her. Since the death of her husband she has had lots of difficulty making ends meet. She sells charcoal, yams, and corn, but due to her household expenses, her stocks of corn and yams are depleted and she is not able to restock her business.

This is the reason why she is requesting this, her second loan to purchase 60 coco yams, 2 sacks of corn, and 12 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 60 coco yams, 2 sacks of corn, and 12 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel Y. M. is a member of the community bank, Renacer, which means “rebirth” in Spanish. Isabel is married with two children and works from her house selling firewood.

She will use her loan of 1500 soles ($500.00) to purchase more firewood. With her savings she hopes to purchase a house and finance her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase more firewood

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
“God has been good to me considering that I am already a widow but still able to raise all my 5 children alone without a partner”, says Elena C., from the  Calinan District, Davao City. She has joined other entrepreneurial poor in the CEV program.

She invests in hog raising. With the help and support of her eldest son she able to run the business. From the profits she earns from her business, Elena is able to provide for the needs of her children. 

Elena is requesting another loan of $450 from CEV to purchase additional piglets and feed. “ With my first loan, I have already received good returns from my business which I really hope will help us uplift our lives” she says. "Now that I’m an active member of CEV, I enjoy receiving  the credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage they offer” she added.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 25-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their one child. He has been working as an auto mechanic for twelve years. Youssef is asking for a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase equipments for his garage. Youssef has been a microcredit client for four years now and has always paid on time.

loans.use: Youssef will use the loan to purchase equipments for his garage.

loans.name: Cheab

texts.en: Cheab S., age 26, is a professional tailor and makes about US $4 a day. She has been in this business for 8 years and her husband makes US$5 a day as a mechanic. This couple live in Battambang province and have one little child. Mrs. Cheab S. is asking for a loan from Kiva via Credit to invest in a new business. She will use the loan to operate a grocery store.

loans.use: To operate a grocery store.

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.en:
Married and the father of two children, E. Abduvali was born on August 03, 1973 in Spitamen district of Sugd region. Coming from an area where cattle-raising is popular, Abduvali has been selling cattle since 1998. He buys them in his village from the farmers who raise them and then sells them at the markets. As his business capital is limited, he buys just a few and then after he sells those, he returns to buy more. Today he would like to expand his business by increasing his capital, so that he can then maximize his profits. For this reason, he is requesting this first loan to purchase young cattle. This will be his first loan with IMON International, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero sells provisions and foodstuffs. She started this business in 2005. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N60,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell.

She is 54 years old and married with three children. She hopes to expand her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Irma es casada, tiene 37 años y 5 hijos, Irma tiene un puesto en el mercado de Carmen Alto en donde vende ropa variada con la ayuda de su hija. Además Irma viaja a las diferentes ferias en donde compra quesos, cereales. Irma tiene proyectado vender calzados.
Irma necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos.
Los sueños de Irma son mejorar sus negocios y educar a sus 5 hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the “Florecer” (“To Flower”) cooperative bank. Irma is married, 37 years old, and has 5 children. Irma has a stall at the Carmen Alto market where she sells a variety of clothing with her daughters’ help. In addition, Irma travels to the different fairs where she buys cheeses, cereals. Irma plans to sell shoes in the future. Irma needs a loan of 2,000 soles, funds that she will invest into the purchase of shoes. Irma’s dreams are to improve her businesses and to educate her 5 children so they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of shoes.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: "Simple woman" describes Mrs. Esterlita T., who is 59 years old, married and lives at Conat, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has 8 children. Her husband is a driver. In order to help her husband for a living, she decided to sell flowers. She got this idea of selling flowers from a friend who taught her about this business. Mrs. T. was only able to start this business when she joined Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative last August 2005 and has received loans several times already. Today, she applies for PHP 4,000 to purchase additional orchids or other ornamental flowers for sale. In the future, she really wants to have a parcel of land for ornamental flower plantation.

loans.use: to purchase flowers to resell

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El Sr.Pablo B. tiene 59 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Carapeguà, compañia Tajy Loma.  El es macatero (vendedor ambulante) con una antigüedad importante  el el ramo (20años).  El es separado, pero tiene una hija ya mayor de edad que es de profesiòn  docente y  viven en casa  propia. 

Sus lugares de ventas son las ciudades de San Bernardino, Itaugua e Ypacaraì, donde menciona que tiene bastante clientes, y que sus productos brindan mucha satisfaciòn.

Solicita un prèstamo con nuestra entidad para la compra de sobrecamas.
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo B. is 59 years old and lives in the Tajy Loma neighborhood of Carapegua city. He has been a street vendor for 20 years. He is separated, but he has a grown daughter who is a teacher and they live in their own house. He sells in San Bernardino, Itaugua and Ypacarai cities, where he says he has many clients and his products provide much satisfaction. He is seeking a loan with our organization to buy bedspreads.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bedspreads

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice O. is 30 years of age. She is married and lives with her two children, all of whom are still in school. Her husband is into farming. They have their own little piece of land that her husband cultivates.

Alice’s passion is dressmaking. She loves it and has been doing it since she was single. Eventually, when she got married, she still loved dressmaking and made it into a business.

At present, Alice has her dress shop where she offers dressmaking and rents gowns for all occasions. She wishes to expand her dress shop and produce new gowns for rent. She is now working on her loan proposal to HSPFI, a Kiva partner, where she is thinking positively that this amount may be granted to her. From this loan, she is looking forward to more improvement in her business which will eventually reflect in her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To procure additional materials used in her dressmaking business

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
Flor María R. G. es una señora de 31 años de edad la cual vive  con su esposo y sus 4 hijas: Helen, Yerlin, Angie y  Grettel. Ellos viven en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Abanico,  ubicada en San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Provincia de Alajuela; reconocida como una comunidad amiga de la tranquilidad  y dedicada a actividades productivas tales como la agricultura, ganadería  y turismo. 

Doña Flor esta afiliada al grupo ecológico Mujeres el Abanico, ella se dedica a la siembra de Tilo, una planta medicinal, dice que la producción de ella  y la  de sus compañeras de grupo  la compra una empresa llamada “Manzaté”, la cual es una empresa nacional que se especializa en la elaboración de té de diferentes hierbas. 

Desde hace más de 10 años doña Flor se dedica a la producción de tilo, la cual le ha traído grandes beneficios  tanto a ella como a su familia, dice que se ha esforzado mucho y a puesto mucho empeño para que el proyecto salga adelante. 

Doña Flor dice que la demanda en el mercado por este producto es muy alta por lo que desea ampliar su plantación de tilo y hacer el secador más grande. Por lo tanto ella requiere un préstamo de ¢600.000 (seiscientos mil colones)  para ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del tilo y además espera comprar: madera, plástico, clavos, maya etc; todos estos materiales necesarios para ampliar el secador.

Doña Flor forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Abanico una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socia ha recibido un microcrédito, el cual le  ha permitido desarrollarse como microempresaria y sentirse mejor con ella misma.
texts.en:
Flor María R. G. is a 31-year-old woman who lives with her husband and their 4 daughters: Helen, Yerlin, Angie and Grettel. They live in a rural community in Costa Rica called Abanico. It is located in San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Alajuela Province. It is known as a quiet community dedicated to productive activities such as agriculture, livestock and tourism.

Mrs. Flor is a member of the ecological group Mujeres el Abanico. She works sowing Lime Flower, a medicinal plant. She says a company called Manzaté buys her crops as well as those of the other group members. It’s a national company specialized in producing different herbal teas.

Mrs. Flor has worked in lime flower production for more than 10 years. It has been very profitable for her and her family. She says she has worked very hard and put a lot of effort into making the project successful.

Mrs. Flor says the market demand for this product is very high which is why she would like to increase her lime flower tree plantation and make the drying area larger. Therefore she needs a loan of ¢600.000 (six hundred thousand CRC) to help with preparing the soil and purchasing seeds and fertilizers, among other supplies which are necessary to guarantee the optimal sowing of the lime flower. She also hopes to purchase: wood, plastic, nails, netting, etc. All these materials are necessary to increase the drying area.

Mrs. Flor is part of the Abanico Community Credit Company. It is one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. She has received a micro loan since she is a member. This has allowed her to develop as a micro businesswoman and feel better about herself.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to produce and dry lime flower

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia T. is tilling a 2.5 hectare farm. She is 49 years old this year and has three children. She and her husband continue working the field to support their family. The income from the farm is used to provide for their basic needs. Like other parents and farmers, they want to see their children be able to pursue degrees.They also want to make their farm productive and to have a sustainable livelihood for their family.

Through CEVI's microfinancing efforts, Virginia has been encouraged to apply for a loan. She would like to borrow 15,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase two sacks of urea, 30 liters of crude oil and other farm supplies. She thinks that by doing so she will be able to improve their harvest.

CEVI offers a wide range of services to people. They provide training and insurance coverage as well as loans.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of urea, 30 liters of crude oil and other farm supplies

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Rosas“ están representados por la señora Mary Luz y conformado por 13 personas que en su mayoría se dedican al ámbito comercial como cosméticos por catálogos, comida, cerveza, ropa y al servicI. D. soldadura y fisioterapia. El grupo va cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, puntualidad y ganas D. salir adelante a pesar D. la competencia ya que sus ingresos son el pilar fundamental para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del nuevo financiamiento es para la ampliación D. sus negocios así como para adquisición D. mercadería, material se insumos que mejoren la calidad D. sus productos para ser mas competitivos en el mercado generando una mayor ganancia que les permitirá brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The group “Las Rosas” [“The Roses”] is lead by Mary Luz and consists of 13 people who by their majority have commercial businesses, such as, the sale of cosmetics through catalogs, food, beer, clothing, soldering services, and physical therapy. The group is in its third loan cycle and has demonstrated responsibility, punctuality, and a drive to get ahead despite competition; their income is the fundamental pillar that sustains their families. The new loan will be used to expand their business by acquiring merchandise, materials, and supplies that will improve the quality of their products so that they can become more competitive in the market and generate higher incomes that will allow them to give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital (to acquire merchandise, materials, and supplies).

loans.name: Darisuren

texts.en:
Darisuren is 22 years old and lives with her father in their own little building (shack). Her elderly father works as a security guard in town and earns less than 100 dollars a month.

Before she rented space for a grocery stand, Darisuren made money by sewing. She eventually was able to save up enough to lease the space and begin selling groceries. As of now the stand brings in around $60-$85 a day.

Darisuren wants to be able to buy a greater variety of food and in bulk to increase her income. With the extra income she wants to add another booth to the one she has and eventually own her own store. She is a very modest and down-to-earth girl. She wants two things: to be able to take care of her father and to own her own store.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of food and in bulk to increase her income

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.en:
In the city of Quiindy in the neighborhood of San Lorenzo, 23 km away from the Carapeguá office, live women with limited resources who joined the program Mujeres Emprendedoras committee and decided to get together to receive information about the mentioned program.

These are active women, the some of whom tailor-make clothes and are in sales, among other activities. They are looking for a little more support to strengthen their families’ incomes and to better the quality of their lives through credit. They need this loan to invest in their respective jobs, which will allow them to achieve sustainable growth as a group and as individuals.

Some of their activities are: sale of cheese, clothes, milk, silver jewelry, and food. Some of them have their beauty salon; others are dressmakers.

loans.use: to invest in their respective jobs

loans.name: Bemilda Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Bemilda de 60 años de edad, reside en el barrio Waspan Norte en la capital de Managua, su esposo jubilado, con cuatro hijos mayores de edad, su negocio ha sido un kiosco que administra desde hace deisciseis años en el mercado Roberto Huembes, un mercado central que es visitado por muchos Nicaragüense como extranjero por su ricas ventas en cuero, cuadros, ropa fina, variada como: nacional de marimba entre otros, este tramo lo compro gracias  a los ahorro de su esposo y con este préstamo lograra invertir en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, entre otros producto para poder atender a sus clientes como se merecen. Lo difícil es cuando las ventas son bajas por que no recoge mucho y toca que pagar los mismos gastos es por eso que muchos negocios quiebran. Pero gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic ha logrado mantener su negocio balanceado y estable.
texts.en:
Doña Bemilda is 60 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Waspan Norte in the capital of Managua. Her husband is retired and they have four adult children. For 16 years, she has managed her business from a kiosk in the Roberto Huembes Market, a central market frequented by many Nicaraguans as well as foreign visitors. Goods such as leather, paintings, and fine clothing are sold there, as well as unique items such as the national marimba. Doña Bemilda was able to secure her vending space in the market thanks to her husband’s savings.

She will use her loan to buy basic grains, candy, sodas, and other products requested by her customers. It is difficult when sales are low because her operating costs remain the same and many other businesses have gone bankrupt. Thanks to the loans from AFODENIC, she has been able to keep her business balanced and stable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, candy, sodas, and other products

loans.name: Buwa

texts.en:
Buwa R. is currently in the business of selling bread and green vegetables and is requesting a loan to purchase fruits like oranges, gavva and mangoes to sell.  

Buwa is 35 years old and is Married with a husband that is a teacher. She has 7 children and her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children and provide them with scholarstic materials like bags, shoes, school uniforms etc

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase fruits like oranges, gavva and mangoes to sell

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Although Pilar V. is ahead of 1 year at the age of 54 to her husband Florante V. who is now 53 years old this never been a hindrance for them who are the head in their family, because in the first place in their family they are both finding ways to fight their poverty. Her husband is work as a carpenter at the same time farmers in their place, while Pilar runs a sewing business for 3 years now. Because according to Pilar her husband’s revenue is only enough for their daily expenses nothing left for the education of her two daughter Diane 15 years old third year high school and Flor Marie 12 years old first year high school. So Pilar find an alternative ways to augment the not enough income of her husband, so it come out her sewing business because also she has a talent in sewing different kinds of clothes. Also her variety store business also contributes to their income that is why she also pursues to continue this.

The loan that she received from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) will be use as additional capital for her sewing business. She will buy sewing machine, needle, different colors of thread and oil for the machine. It will help her to make her business more productive.

Pilar picture shows that they really needed enough capital so that her variety store and place for her sewing machine have their own part or place for more comfortable to move. This is one of her dream aside from to finish her children education until college.

loans.use: Will be additional capital for her sewing business

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en:
Marianne D. R. is a young mother who lives in a village located at Barangay Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya.

Marianne was in her 2nd year college when she married Mark Gil D. R. and they are now gifted with a child named Mark Anthony D. R. who is already two years old. It was difficult for them to adjust at first because neither of them had a stable job although they were thankful because their parents helped them to provide for their needs.

With the help of their parents, Marianne and her husband bought a tricycle which her husband uses to earn an income while Marianne is engaged in selling Avon products in their village. Marianne borrowed additional capital from ASKI to acquire those products which she sells to her neighbors and friends. According to her, she is able to earn a net income of Php 4,000 a month which she adds to her husband's income to acquire their daily needs and pay her weekly amortization.

Since her business is profitable, Marianne wants to continue it and to acquire additional items. When she paid back her first loan, she applied again, requesting an amount of Php 10,000 to be used in acquiring the said additional items. She is so thankful with this financial assistance because she has the opportunity to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To acquire additional items for her direct-selling business

loans.name: Koy

texts.en: Mr. Koy C. lives in Pun Ley village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who cultivates rice on a piece of land that he owns. Aside from this plantation, he is also a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it. He decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks and food for his breeding business. His wife, Mrs. Muoy Nao, helps him in the business. Mrs. Koy C.’s two children (two-months and 1 year old) are too young to work or study. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks and food for his breeding business.

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
Aminata F. sells firewood and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) and has been in this type of business for ten years now. She is 43 years of age and married with three children. Aminata’s husband is a monthly wage earner and her children are attending school – one is in college and the others are in primary school II and V respectively. Aminata was born in Magburaka town. She will use this loan to buy firewood and gallons of palm oil.

Aminata (in the middle) is the leader of the "God is Great" Group. They are business people from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva for the first time seeking a loan of 1,500,000 leones (SLL) (500,000 SLL each) to invest in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy firewood and gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old single man who lives with his parents. He makes a living selling computer accessories and is the source of economic support of his family.

When Ahmad first started his business, he faced a lot of competition. Many other shops offered similar services, but he distinguished himself by his determination and good service. He also owes his success to the support of his family.

With this loan of $2000, Ahmad will buy more accessories to sell such as cables, USB cords and printers. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more computers accessories to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 59, is a farmer. She plants rice on her land. Now a widow, she makes sure to enjoy farming duties as she spends most of her time there. She wants to double up her harvest so she works hard to achieve that. Her farm is the only source of income she currently has.

Maria joined CEVI early this year, and this is her third time to ask for a loan. She said that her previous loans were really helpful to her business. She is now requesting for a loan of 9,000 PHP. She will use this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies needed at her farm. This loan could help Maria reach her goals.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Chreach

texts.en: Mrs. Chreach K. is 41 years old. She lives in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field on which she grows rice.  She has a machine for watering her field, but now she does not have enough money to cultivate her field. Thus, Mrs. Chreach K. requests a loan from AMK to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and fuel.  Her husband, Mr. Rorn Vann, is a duck breeder, so the rest of the loan will be used to buy food for the ducks and more ducklings.  Mrs. Chreach K. is the mother of six children, five of whom are students and the other is a worker.  Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and fuel.

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
Solita E. is a good mother to her six children. She is married to her loving spouse, Dionisio, a farmer. They currently live in a nice place, Morong, Rizal. She and her husband work in a farming business. Despite the many challenges in her life, she never gave up fighting against poverty.

She plans to use this loan of PHP 30,000 to expand her farming business and get involved in other businesses for supplementary profits. This loan will be used to buy additional capital for her farming business. During her 6 years as a member of ASHI, she has shown very good performance and has been trusted by ASHI for the length of time she has been involved. Aside from maintaining an excellent performance in repayment, business and attendance at ASHI, she has also attended to her children's needs at home and in school. 

Having this loan will enable her to finally reach her dreams in life: to have a growing business, a good life, and a happy family as well. 

She hopes her children will be able to finish their studies with the help of loans from ASHI, KIVA's field partner. She believes that her business will help her family to rise up and fight against poverty, as well as provide for the educational needs of her children and enable them to have a comfortable house to live in. She is very thankful to ASHI for the continued support of her dreams.

loans.use: To buy additional capital for her farming business.

loans.name: Bona

texts.en:
Mrs. Bona C. is 38 years old and lives in Sla village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field where she cultivates rice. She also breeds pigs to earn money. She faces problems with her farm because the soil is infertile and there is not enough water to grow crops. She decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and a water machine. The rest of the loan will be used to buy piglets and pig food for breeding. 

Her husband, Mr. Vorn Khev, is a policeman who earns a small salary. Mrs. Bona C. is the mother of four children. One is employed in the garment factory. The other three attend the local school and also help their mother with the farm. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, a water machine, piglets and pig food

loans.name: Sadiatu

texts.en:
Sadiatu started business twenty years ago as a fish monger.  After ten years hawking fish around the town, she was allotted space in the main market by the town council.

She gets her supply of ice fish from a local cold room in the town.  Her main problem has been preserving the fish. She normally buys ice in the evening to preserve unsold stock but this is costly and eats deep into her profit.

She wants a loan so that she can fix up a small cold room and source her stock directly from the fishing company. That will help increase her profit margin.

Sadiatu is 49 years old, married, and has three children.

loans.use: To fix up a cold room to store fish.

loans.name: Herminia Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Herminia O. venda ropa en general  en la plaza metropolitana dando inicio a sus ventas  a las 8:00 Am donde recibe a su clientela para ofertar su mercadería.
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de ropa de verano y formal como: chores, camisetas, bóxer, pantalones, blusas, faldas, y otros.
texts.en:
Herminia sells general clothing items in the metropolitan plaza. Here she begins serving her customers at 8:00 am. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in summer clothing and formal items, such as briefs, t-shirts, boxers, pants, blouses, skirts, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Summer is around the corner so Jalal thought of taking a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger variety of goods for his small store.

Jalal is a holder of a BA degree in Business Administration. Since all attempts to find a job in his field failed, he opened a small store in Birzeit University where he sells accessories, jewelery, bags and many other things shown in the picture where he stands in his shop.

Jalal's store is the only one of its kind inside the university campus, where the number of students is large enough to guarantee sustainability and a continuously increasing demand.

loans.use: Purchase a larger variety of goods

loans.name: Phai's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phai Y. is a group leader for a loan to four people who live in Tuol Krasang village in Kandal province.  Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Phai Y. earns money for her family by breeding pigs.  Her husband, Mr. Van Vet, is a construction worker.  She has three children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the other is a laborer.   Mrs. Phai Y.'s business is going well and she wants to expand it.  She is seeking a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 53 años, ella vive sola en su casa que es propia, tiene una hija, quien es mayor de edad, casada e independiente. Hace más de 16 años, se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza de diversas marcas competitivas en el mercado, por lo que es líder y promotora de belleza en una de estas líneas, en ella organiza a un grupo de personas, preparándolas y asesorándolas para que realicen buenas ventas. De esta forma recibe varios incentivos por el esfuerzo y trabajo que ejerce, como regalos en productos y como buena comerciante, estos productos lo vende. Ella se siente muy feliz con la actividad que hace, es por ello que le dedica todo el día salvo los momentos que debe atender su casa. Su mayor anhelo es seguir mejorando en su negocio, por lo que espera tener un establecimiento propio, para ofertar su mercadería, por lo pronto se encuentra cómoda en el modo en que trabaja. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos para tenerlos en stock y así obtener buenas ventas en esta campaña por el día de la madre.
texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years old, and she lives alone in her own house. She has a grown daughter who is married and independent. For over 16 years she has been selling beauty products from various brands that are competitive in the market. She is a leader and a beauty promoter in one of these lines. She organizes a group of people for that line. She prepares them and advises them so that they get good sales. This way she receives various incentives for her effort and the work she does. She gets products as gifts. Like a good merchant, she sells them. She is very happy with the work she does. That is why she devotes herself to it all day, except for the time she needs to take care of her house. Her biggest wish is to keep working in her business. She hopes to have her own establishment in which to sell her merchandise and to feel comfortable in her work. This is her first loan with MFP. She promises to make all of her payments on time. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy products to have in stock. That way she will have good sales during this Mother’s Day season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more beauty products

loans.name: Toirsho

texts.ru: Урозов Тоиршо проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование высшее, "Педагог". По профессии проработал 4 года. Сейчас занимается торговлей. Открыл торговую точку возле дома. Продает продукты питания и необходимые вещи хозяйству. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Toirsho U. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 36 years old, married and has 3 children. He has a higher education as a teacher. He spent 4 years working in that profession and is now involved in retail sales. Toirsho opened a retail outlet near his home. He sells food products and essential household goods. He has been in this business for 6 years. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Enhsaihan

texts.en:
Enhsaihan Y. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her two oldest daughters both attend a local secondary school and her youngest hasn't yet reached school age.

Enhsaihan currently operates a woolen souvenirs and accessories manufacturing business in her town with the help of her husband. They produce a variety of woolen souvenirs and accessories. Their products are very popular among their many customers due to their good quality and unique style. Enhsaihan gained experience in her trade by participating in a training for manufacturing woolen souvenirs and accessories in 2001. Since that time she has been operating her business and has built a loyal customer base.

Her business has been quite profitable, especially during the summer when a large number of tourists come through her area. Enhsaihan has used her earnings to purchase a plot of land with a house and yard for her family. She is an honest person and focused on the future. She hopes to one day have her own souvenir factory. Enhsaihan is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase unprocessed wool

loans.name: Kargbo United Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Memuna C.. Memuna was born in Magburaka 30 years ago. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Memuna has been selling market food for two years now. She sells groundnuts (peanuts), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), and pepper. She will use her share of the loan to buy these items wholesale. 

Pictured here are members of the “Kargbo United” group from Magburaka, a town in Sierra Leone. They are petty businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, seeking a loan of 800,000 leones each. With this loan they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy groundnut, onions, margi and pepper

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Thoa T. L. was born in 1966. She not only grows rice but  she also raises pigs and poultry. Now, she is raising 400 chickens and 10 pigs. She lives with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). But her eldest son has a disability. 

Her husband is a farmer; they work together. They have a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). This is the first time she is participating in SEDA. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy feed for her pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is a member of Githurai Vison group in Faulu, Kenya.  She joined the group as a young entrepreneur to be able to access loans. She also saves money on weekly basis with the group. She has been operating a butcher shop for six months. Peris used to sell fruits earlier to earn a living.  She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy meat for resale.  In ten years, she wants to own several butcher shops by which she can earn more income.

loans.use: To buy meat for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve his house such as: cement, sand, gravel, stone, etc.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem R. is a 59-year-old rice grower and local farmer from Kompong Tom Province. She runs her business on her own farmland, where she raises rice crops and pigs. She will sell them to a buyer when they have matured. Her husband helps her with the farm work. 

Sem R. has ten children, two of whom are already married; the others are single. To help support the family, six of her children are employed at various jobs. Sem R. also has an unemployed son who needs to get a suitable job, but he doesn’t have capital to invest in one. Thus, Sem R. is applying for a loan to be used to buy a new motorcycle for her son to use to provide a mototaxi service.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle for her son use to provide a taxi service

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina G. is from the village of West Poblacion, in Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Christina owns & operates a mini-restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Her husband is her business partner. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Christina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to invest in expanding the business. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This will be Christina’s 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Pech's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people located in Thmei village in Kandal province. Mrs. Pech T., 38 and married, is the group leader having been selected by the members of this group. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes.
 
Pech T. and her husband, Mr. Sorn Theoun, are fishermen who are able to earn a small income to support their family. They lack some money to support their fishing business, so Pech T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fishnet and fishing supplies. This couple has two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fishnet and fishing supplies

loans.name: Dorie

texts.en:
Dorie G. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Dorie is separated from her spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Dorie owns and operates a hairdressing and beauty services business. Dorie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Dorie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dorie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide services. Dorie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials to expand the services she can provide. This will be Dorie's sixth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Mohamed L

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has one child who is three months old. 

In 2003, Mohamed established his food vending business to generate income and take care of his family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 250,000 every month from this business.  

Mohamed would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to add another type of food item to his business, which will be sold at night. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 600,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to hire workers as demand is very high. He also plans to buy a motorbike to increase his number of customers and more easily travel around. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy eggs,vegetable oil, milk and sugar

loans.name: Esther Efua Ewusiwa

texts.en: Esther Efua Ewusiwa E. sells ladies shoes and sandals in Abura. Esther is married to a farmer and has three children. She has been in this business for two years. She assists her husband with the general upkeep of the home. This loan will be used to buy more shoes and items which are very often requested by her customers. She hopes to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Elsa Tulmira

texts.es:
Elsa de 51 años, vende pescado en un puesto en la calle, vive con sus tres hijos en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. 

Hace año atrás ella quería independizarse para general ingresos en su casa por eso decidió comprar pescados y venderlos en un puesto de madera en la calle. Poco a poco la gente del sector la fue conociendo ya que ella trabaja desde las 07h30 hasta las 12h00 de lunes a domingo. En la actualidad vende la libra de pescados a $ 2.00. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene al vender pescado es el polvo que genera la calle al pasar las tricimoto. 

Para seguir con su negocio y diversificarlo más ella quiere comprar con el préstamo pescado. En el futuro quiere terminar de arreglar su casa y tener un local donde pueda vender mariscos.
texts.en: Elsa is 51 years old and sells fish at a stand on the side of the road.  She lives with her three children in an urban area called Guasmo, characterized by the fact that the majority of its inhabitants are merchants.  A year ago, she wanted to independently earn an income so she decided to purchase fish and sell them at a wooden stall on the street.  Little by little, people began to recognize her since she worked from 7:30 to 12, Monday through Friday.  Currently, she sells fish at $2.00/pound.  One of the inconveniences of selling fish is the dust that comes from the roads, produced from all the traffic.  In order to continue her business and broaden it more, she wants to use this loan to purchase more fish.  In the future, she would like to finish fixing her home and have her own shop where she can sell seafood.

loans.use: Fish.

loans.name: George

texts.en: Georges is a 25 years old single man working as a barber since 2008. Georges is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to improve his shop, buy necessary materials, and prepare himself for the Holy season. Most of his clients turn into best friends, and that’s what special in his personality.  All of his clients speak about his honesty and friendliness. Georges hopes to expand his business through adding  a beauty institute to his business.

loans.use: To improve barber shop

loans.name: Joyce Njoki

texts.en:
Joyce Njoki K. is 32 years old and married to Haman Kabuga, who also contributes to the family income. They have two children. She has been running her retail shop for three years, with an income of about Kshs 13,000 per month. 

This is her first loan with KADET LTD and she wants to use it to buy additional stock of clothes for sale. She hopes to open more boutiques in the area and operate a wholesale shop in the near future.  She also hopes to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for her retail shop.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion 7 Group

texts.en: Juana is the coordinator of her group Mujeres en accion 7 (Women in action). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their only child. She says that her biggest challenge is to help her daughter to become a professional. Juana is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 16 years, starting to work from her house after a cousin motivated her to buy a hair dryer. She started her beauty salon in her living room; she decided to do it and little by little, she bought everything. She plans to use this loan to invest in her beauty salon by buying hair and cosmetic products. She also wants to buy a professional blower. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to save for her daughter's studies. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water, none of which is potable.

loans.use: To buy hair products and a blower

loans.name: Oktay

texts.ru:
Oktay N. rodilsya v 1954 qodu. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Oktay yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona i seychas projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste  lubimoy jenoy i detmi.
Oktay uje qod kak  rabotayet taxistom, ranshe on chinil mashini no spustya vremya on reshil stat taxistom, Oktay ochen polubil svoyu novuyu rabotu. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Oktaya on ochen blagodaren lenderam i Kive za pervuyu ssudu. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya mashini.
texts.en: Oktay N. was born in 1954. He is married and has three children. He is an Internally Displaced Person, a refugee from the Fuzuli Region now living in the city of Baku together with his beloved wife and children. It has been a year since  Oktay started working as a taxi driver. He used to be an auto mechanic, but later he decided to become a taxi driver. He grew to really like his new line of work. This is Oktay’s second loan; he is very grateful to Kiva lenders for his first loan. At present he needs 2000 AZN to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.use: Purchasing spare auto parts

loans.name: María Delia

texts.es: María Delia M. D. M. D. 52 años D. eda, resiD. en la cabecera departamental D. Santa Ana en donD. vive únicamente junto a su compañero D. vida. María es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual desea brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para poder salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. tortillas, las cuales realiza en su casa D. habitación D. lunes a domingo. A pesar que este es un trabaja bastante pesado, María lo realiza con una acititud positiva. María solicita un préstamo, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra D. maíz y D. cal para la elaboración D. tortillas, y así mismo para comprar leña la cual utiliza para cocinar las tortillas, ya que María cuenta con una cocina típica D. esta región la cual se conoce como “comal”. Con esto ella espera mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
María Delia M. D. M. is 52 years old and resides in the departmental capital of Santa Ana, where she and her life partner live by themselves. María is a hardworking individual who wants to proviD. all the help she can to her husband so that they can get ahead. She makes and sells tortillas out her home Monday through Sunday. Even though the work is tedious, María maintains a positive attituD..

She is requesting a loan so that she can have the necessary funds to invest in the purchase of corn and lime for making tortillas. In addition, she will buy firewood that will be used for cooking the tortillas. María has a traditional cooking surface that is common in the region known as a “comal” (tortilla griddle). With this support, she hopes to improve her family’s finances.

loans.use: Purchase corn, lime, and firewood

loans.name: Joreynelle

texts.en:
Joreynelle A. is a 26-year-old single woman from the village of Clarin Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Joreynelle owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. More specifically, her primary source of income is derived from raising pigs for sale. Joreynelle has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Joreynelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. In turn, she has been better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her standard of living. Notably, Joreynelle has already successfully repaid two prior loans from GDMPC (i.e., this would be her third loan through GDMPC). Joreynelle is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 13,000 PHP ($300), which will be used to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve her living conditions.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is mostly comprised of farmers, fishermen and women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business

loans.name: Ervin Francisco

texts.es:
ERVIN FRANCISCO H., ES DE MANAGUA, TRABAJA COMO AGENTE DE SEGURIDAD,  ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS Y DOS DE ELLOS ESTAN EN EL COLEGIO.
DON ERVIN ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: CEMENTO, ARENA, BLOQUES PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR SU CASA DE HABITACION. 
ERVIN H. DICE QUE GRACIAS A LOS FINANCIAMIENTOS OTORGADOS POR CEPRODEL HA VENIDO MEJORANDO SU CASA DE HABITACION Y A BRINDADO MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Ervin Francisco H. is from Managua. He works as a security guard and is the father of three children, two of whom attend high school.

Ervin has approached Kiva partner Ceprodel to ask for a new loan to make improvements to his house. He wishes to buy construction material such as cement, sand, stones and piedrin (a type of building stone) to finish building his house.

Ervin is grateful for the loans obtained through Ceprodel. He has been able to improve his house and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: purchase construction materials

loans.name: Angel Adrian

texts.es: Ángel Adrian tiene 45 años. El es un hombre muy trabajador y tiene mucho tiempo. La actividad económica de Don Ángel es la venta de mariscos. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio. El dio inicio con muy pocos productos, pues no tenía el capital suficiente pues decide recurrir a los financiamientos los que son de mucho apoyo, además en esos momentos el no tenía trabajo y encontró este medio de vida, el ofrece sus productos en un pequeño termo en donde prepara sus deliciosos ceviches. El financiamiento está destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que podrá comprar conchas, camarones, pescados y termos. El siempre tiene el sueño de obtener su propio local.
texts.en:
Ángel Adrian is a 45 year old gentleman who has been working hard for a long time. He sells seafood and has been in business for more than 18 years. Don Ángel started out with very few products because he did not have sufficient capital. He decided to take advantage of the loans and they have been a great help. At the time he did not have a job and discovered that he could earn a living in this manner.

Ángel offers his products from a small cooler in which he prepares delicious “ceviches” (marinated seafood cocktails). This loan will be used as operating capital to purchase shellfish, shrimp, fish, and another cooler. He always dreams about getting his own shop.

loans.use: To purchase shellfish, shrimp, fish, and a cooler.

loans.name: Hacienda Chacrasana Group

texts.es: Milagros es una D. las 8 socias D. la Alcancía Comunal “Hacienda Chacrasana” a sus 27 años ha logrado poner su propio negocio en casa, recientemente inauguro una pequeña bodega  a la cual le puso D. nombre “Víctor Manuel”, han mejorado las cosas para milagros  pues hace 8 meses vendía en forma ambulatoria pasteles. Milagros nos cuenta que junto con su esposo que trabaja como cocinero en un club privado han logrado adquirir un auto y un terreno para poder construir su casa. Su sueño es tener un restaurante para vender comida marina. El préstamo que obtuvo esta vez, será invertido en comprar productos D. primera necesidad para su bodega. En la foto podemos ver a las socias D. nuestra Alcom  contentas luego D. desembolso D. su crédito una D. ellas tarjo consigo a su pequeño bebe.
texts.en:
Milagros is one of the 8 members of “Hacienda Chacrasana” communal bank.  At the age of 28 she’s managed to install her business in her house; she recently opened a small grocery store that she named “Víctor Manuel.”

Things have improved for Milagros because 8 months ago she was a pastry peddler.  Milagros tells us that together with her husband, who’s employed as a cook in a private club, they’ve managed to acquire a car and a piece of property on which to build their house. Her dream is to open a seafood restaurant.  The loan she got this time will be used to buy stock items for her store.

In the photo we can see the members of the communal bank happy after getting their loans; one of them brought along her little baby.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a married woman with six children, four of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. She has operated a firewood-selling business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbouring community members. 

Damaris experiences a challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal from rural areas to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Mweni

texts.en: Mweni B. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children who are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and her daughter). Mweni has a business selling bitenge (African Tunics).  She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Mweni sells her products from home. Mweni has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of bitenge and more handbags. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenge(s) for Mweni include transportation and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell only at wholesale. Mweni lives in a home that she owns and has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bitenge and handbags

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 53 years old, married, and has three children.  She sells rice and tea leaves to earn a living.  She saves part of her business profits with a group in Faulu Kenya.  Through the group, she is able to get a loan because the members guarantee each other's loans.  She used her previous loan from Faulu Kenya to boost her business.  She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES, which she will use to buy rice.

loans.use: To purchase rice

loans.name: Coralia

texts.es:
La señora Coralia de los Ángeles es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es propietaria de un taller de costura. Este negocio lo inicio hace 15 años  con  una docena de cotonas y una pequeña máquina de coser en la actualidad tiene tres máquinas de coser cuenta con tres colaboradores y comercializa cotonas,  maxi y vestidos.
Esta señora de 36 años con dos niñas de 12 y 10 años invertirá el  crédito en la compra de  telas, hilos y una máquina de coser con el fin de tener un taller cada día mejor. Ella tiene cuatro siglos en Adim en los cuales se ha perfilado como una clienta A y este es su segundo crédito con kiva.
texts.en:
Coralia de los Ángeles is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who owns a dressmaking shop.  She started this business 15 years ago with a dozen work shirts and a small sewing machine.  Now she has three sewing machines and three people helping her.  She sells work shirts, long skirts, and dresses.

This 36-year-old woman, with two daughters who are aged 10 and 12, will use the loan to purchase fabric, thread, and a sewing machine in order to have a shop that is improving all the time.  She has had four cycles with ADIM in which she stood out as an A borrower.  This is her second loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and a sewing machine

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Fe has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, biscuits, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, and beverages. Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2009 and hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, and beverages

loans.name: Gakuwebwa Mono Womens Group

texts.en: Clothing sales has been Christine's business for the last decade. Ten years down the road in this kind of highly competitive business is not an easy accomplishment. The happily married mother of 6 says she has learned to take most challenges that come with her business philosophically. Hard work, determination and prayers have been her towers of strength. This business generates profits of 320,000 shillings per month. The purpose of this loan is to purchase more new clothes to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more new clothes to resell

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 54-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children, two of them are still attending school and the oldest is attending university. 

He has been working as a real estate broker for the past 20 years. He works hard in cooperation with his wife who works as a teacher in a local school to maintain the family's financial status at a good level. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his son's university education fees. His son is studying pharmacology and this is his second year. He says that his son is very ambitious and willing to open his own pharmacy in the future to be able to help the family with living expenses.

loans.use: to pay his son's university education fees

loans.name: Marnelia

texts.es:
Marnelia tiene 49 años de edad, es una madre soltera que vive desde hace 10 años en una zona urbana en vías de desarrollo, perteneciente al distrito de Pacanga en Chepén- La Libertad.

Marnelia se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, como hierbas medicinales, en un pequeño puesto ubicado en las afueras del mercado de su localidad, tiene muchos años de experiencia en el negocio lo que la han llevado a contar con clientela establecida y con un buen desarrollo de su actividad.

Marnelia solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para acondicionar su puesto de trabajo. Ella desea comprar una mesa más grande que le permita exhibir sus productos con mayor facilidad. Además, utilizará otra parte del crédito en la compra de mercadería  y en gastos personales.

Marnelia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales. Ella tiene muchos deseos de prosperar en su negocio para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marnelia is 49 years old. She is a single mother who has lived for 10 years in an urban zone which is still developing, in the district of Pacanga in Chepén- La Libertad.

Marnelia works selling natural medicines, such as medicinal herbs, from a small stand located on the edge of the market in her area. She has many years of experience with this work, and thanks to this she has built up an established customer base and a good level of development for her business. 

Marnelia is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 Peruvian new soles to fix up her sales stand. She would like to buy a larger table which will allow her to exhibit her products more effectively. In addition, she will use another part of the loan to buy merchandise, and also to pay some personal expenses.

Marnelia is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has excellent personal and work references. She has a great desire to prosper in her business so she can provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to improve her sales stand, buy merchandise and pay some personal expenses.

loans.name: Wendy Noelia

texts.es: La Señora Wendy tiene 28 años. Es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería ropa. Hace más de 5 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba, sus clientes recurrían a su negocio ya que la atención  de Wendy es muy buena y además atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa en sus labios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo y comprar pantalones, camisas, trajes para salir, ropa en general y ropa interior. Su mayor sueño es que su hijo logre finalizar sus estudios y que siga adelante con esta actividad.
texts.en:
Ms. Wendy is 28 years old. She is a single mother and has one child in her care. Her income-generating activity is the selling of clothes, a business she has had for more than five years. The location of her business is as a street vendor. Little by little she increased her inventory with the small profit her business generated. Her customers turned to her business because Wendy provides very good customer service, and furthermore she waits on her customers with a smile on her lips. 

The loan she is requesting is for working capital and to purchase pants, shirts, dressy apparel, clothes in general and undergarments. Her greatest dream is that her son would successfully complete his studies and that she would continue on in this business.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, dressy apparel, clothes in general and undergarments.

loans.name: Rhea Amor

texts.en:
Rhea  is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Rhea  has a food shop that sells chicken, pork & hotdog kebabs. She has had this business for 1 year. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making kebabs.
Rhea  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rhea  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making kebabs

loans.name: Walter Gregorio

texts.es:
Walter nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 45 años de edad, él tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, él vive en la misma  ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, él tiene un molinera donde procesa los productos alimenticios a base de trigo, cebada, maíz y otras cosas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  
  
Walter requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos como por ejemplo maíz, cebada, trigo, cebada y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Siempre Adelante” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Walter was born in the city of Cusco (Perú) and is 45 years old.  He’s in a common law relationship and has four children.  He currently lives in the same city where he was born and where he carries out his activities.  He has a mill where he processes foodstuffs based on wheat, barley, corn and other things.  He’s been in this business for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  Walter needs the loan to buy more products like, for example, corn, barley, wheat, and others.
  
The “Siempre Adelante” (Always Forward) communal bank meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Perú). Cusco is known for tourism, commerce, for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy more producs like corn, barley, wheat and others.

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Thu was born in 1982. She lives in Dai Bi village. She is married and has two sons who are small. Her husband is a driver. Mrs. Thu has a shop in the market. She sells dresses and other clothes. She has had this job for five years. Her family has a monthly income of about 7,000,000 VND. Since 2009, she has participated in SEDA and always repays loans punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy more clothes and dresses to resell.

About other borrowers in her group:
Mai is 52 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
Thao is 52 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
Trung is 26 years old. He has two children. He wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and dresses to resell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Letecia has a retail shop that sells food supplements from HEALTH WEALTH. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy food supplements from HEALTH WEALTH.
