Letecia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Letecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food supplements from HEALTH WEALTH

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 51 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Helen runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store. Helen has borrowed and paid back 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening and dealing in herbal medicine.
Helen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 25, runs a second-hand clothes business in Yei in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. Mary and her husband have two children, one of whom is enrolled in school.

Mary has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan in order to enable her to purchase more clothes to offer for sale. She intends to save the profits from this loan toward her goal of building a house for her family in future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is married and has two children. She has received a junior high school education. Esther sells food stuffs (as shown in the picture above) in Takoradi and has done so for five years. Her husband is a farmer. Esther supports her husband to provide the basic needs of the home. Esther will use the loan to purchase food stuffs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Ruferia

texts.en: Ruferia is 58 years old and lives in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor. She is married and has no children. For the last six years, she has earned about PHP 6,000 a month by selling fish. She is applying for a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy fresh fish from boats arriving in the local harbor. Ruferia has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year, and hopes to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Darling José

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, Darling José es un joven muy trabajador que ha alcanzado gran deseo de superación con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar compuesta por sus dos hijos a los que debe de mantener y brindarle las condiciones necesarias para que estos se desarrollen satisfactoriamente. 

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en el mejoramiento de su vivienda por medio del cambio de techo que le urge a lo inmediato. Por esta razón requiere la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como: hierro, cementó e indispensablemente las láminas de zinc para llevar a cabo su obra de construcción.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Santa Rosa de Peñón, Darling José is a hardworking man who has achieved his great dream to excel in order to improve the conditions of his home made up of his two children. He owes it to them to maintain his home so that his children may grown and develop successfully. 

He is currently applying for a loan to invest in improving his home by changing his roofing that requires immediate attention. This is why he needs to purchase construction materials such as iron, cement, and essential zinc sheets to carry out the construction.

loans.use: to purchase iron, cement, and zinc sheets

loans.name: Mutio

texts.en:
For the last 20 years, Mutio has been running a salon. She earns a monthly profit of KES 21,000. She is a 51-year-old single mother with three children. 

She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after paying back the previous loans fully and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more salon products like weaves, cosmetics, braids, shampoo, and nail polish. 

She will save the profits she makes and provide for her family's basic needs. Mutio hopes to grow her business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more salon products like weaves, cosmetics, braids, shampoo, and nail polish.

loans.name: Saly

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée.Elle vend des tissus et des produits de mercerie.Sa boutique, située en centre ville à coté des ateliers de tailleurs attire une grande clientèle et génère des revenus assez consistants.Ceci lui permet d'entretenir correctement ses quatre enfants et de soutenir son mari dans les dépenses de location et de paiement de factures d'eau et d'électricité.Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et améliorer ainsi ses revenus, elle sollicite un prêt de 250000f pour acheter des tissus, des fils , des boutons et d'autres produits cosmétiques.Son ambition est d'ouvrir une seconde boutique.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman. She sells fabric and notions. Her store is situated downtown, next to the tailor workshops, which attracts a large clientele and generates consistent income. This allows her to look after her four children correctly and to help her husband with the expenses, such as rent, water and electricity bills. To increase her business funds and also to improve her income, she is requesting a loan of 250000 francs to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other cosmetic products. Her goal is to open a second store.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other cosmetic products

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal   ”QORI ORCCO”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra Delfina;  La socia tiene 24 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 1 hijo de 4 meses de edad; La socia es docente de profesión y trabaja en una comunidad alejada en el nivel primario, la socia en esta semana entra de vacaciones hasta el mes de abril, la socia desea invertir su tiempo estos meses e invertir en un pequeño negocio en casa, ella pondra un emporio de venta de pollos, la socia comprara pollos y los vendera crudos en su emporio. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de pollos e implementar su negocio.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Delfina belongs to the Qori Orcco Community Bank located in Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, in the department of Cusco. 

She is 24 years old, lives with her partner, and has a 4-month old son. Delfina is a primary school teacher in a remote community. This week she is starting vacations which will last until April. She wishes to use these months to start a small business in her home selling chickens. Delfina will buy chickens and then sell them uncooked. She is seeking a loan so she can buy chickens and begin her business.

Delfina is grateful for the laon and promises to make the repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy chickens and start her business

loans.name: Elida Del Socorro

texts.es: Elida del Socorro tiene 54 años de edad, su actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería  está ubicada en su casa de habitación, sus mayores clientes son sus vecinos y los clientes eventuales de la localidad donde está ubicada, este negocio lo emprende Elida por la necesidad de generar ingresos a la familia. Elida tiene 2 hijos mayores en cual la apoyan económicamente. Elida del socorro está solicitando crédito a Fundación León 2000, para invertir en el negocio lo cual con el crédito comprara granos básicos, jabón, aceite, golosinas entre otros productos del hogar que son buscados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elida del Socorro, 54, has a grocery store located at home.  Most of her customers are her neighbors and walk-in customers from the surrounding area.  Elida is in this business because she needs to generate family income.

Elida has two adult children that help her out economically.  Elida del Socorro is asking Fundación León 2000 for a loan to invest in her store buying basic grains, soap, oil and snacks, among other household products that are sought after by her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: ِamal

texts.en: Amal is a 49 year old married woman who supports 1 family member from AL Bayader Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for materials for handcrafts such as embroidery, she plans to sell at a bazar market. In the future she would like to buy a home and car and she hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for materials for handcrafts to sell

loans.name: Chanchala

texts.en:
Chanchala is a 33 years old widow from a small village of Nabarangpur district,Odisha,India. She is a widow and has one son and a daughter in her care.Being the only breadwinner of the family,she strives hard in order earn a good and decent income to fulfill all the necessary needs of her children and lever let them feel their father's absence.She is engaged in vegetable vending business in a market nearby her house and sells all kind of seasonal vegetables.

She is requesting for a loan amount of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to purchase additional amount of vegetables from a wholesaler and resale them and fetch a pretty good amount of income.Rise in her income will lead to a better standard of living and she can get access to more resources and make her children pursue higher education.

Chanchala is in dire need of your kind help and is eagerly awaiting for the same.

loans.use: to purchase additional amount of vegetables from a wholesaler and resale them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Emmah would like to renovate her pig shed and buy animal feeds for her animals.

loans.name: Shakhmurad

texts.en:
29-year-old Shakhmurad is a very active and responsible man. 2 years ago he decided to start a small grocery store.
He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in Fizuli region, Kayidish village. He is married and has a child.
Having borrowed $400 he bought foodstuffs.
He believes that his business will be a success.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to expand the area of his grocery store and to buy more foodstuffs to offer to his clients and in this way increase his income.

loans.use: To expand the area of his grocery store

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en: Yayah  is 34 years old, and is married with four children. 2 of them are boys while the others are girls. To supplement her husband’s income, Yayah sells various decorated flower plants in front of her house. In a week Yayah can earn  of $5 and eventually she can earn around $20 in a month. She needs a loan of $100 to buy more plants and with this loan, she can increase her working capital and thus more or less double her income. She really wants to have more income for her children's education and to give  them a better life than she grew up with.

loans.use: To buy more plants

loans.name: Mercy

texts.es:
Business Description

Mercy has been selling lunches for one and a half years. She sells around 30 lunches a day and works from 7am – 2pm every day. She started her business because her Mother had taught her to work from an early age and this is how she learnt, and she therefore decided to start this business. Her diner is in her house.

Loan Use

Mercy wants a loan to buy a semi-industrial cooker as she does not have one and her current one does not meet her needs as there is more and more demand for her food. She also wishes to buy more tables and chairs.

Personal Information

Mercy is 25 years old, is single and lives with her Mother and sister. They have a single floor house which is made of cement and is not yet finished. Mercy and her sister make these lunches and they both help their Mom to cover the household costs. She is a very hard-working woman and she makes an effort to help her family move forward. She also wishes to, bit by bit, improve their home.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Mercy se dedica hace 1 1/2 años a la venta de almuerzos. Ella vende 30 almuerzos en el día y trabaja todos los días desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 14:00pm. Ella inicio su negocio porque su mama le ha enseñado a trabajar desde muy Pequeña y así ella fue aprendiendo y decidió empezar con el negocio. Su comedor esta ubicado en su domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

Mercy desea el crédito para comprar una cocina semindustrial, ya que no cuenta con una y cada vez la demanda de sus clientes es mas alta y la cocina que tiene no le permite satisfacer esta demanda. Además que desea comprar mas sillas y mesas

Información Personal

Mercy tiene 25 años de edad es soltera, vive con su mama y su hermana. La casa es de cemento de 1 piso y aun esta en construcción, ella trabaja junto a su hermana con los almuerzos y juntas sirven de soporte para su mama y ayudan a solventar los gastos del hogar. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia. Y también desea poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda.

loans.use: To buy a semi-industrial cooker/Comprar una cocina semi industrial

loans.name: Felicia Roble

texts.en: Years ago, the husband of this brave 55 years old lady had an accident and became paralyzed. Since that day she had to do everything herself. Her best skill is dressmaking and that’s how she has raised her 6 boys. She buys the cloth and sews it into uniforms, sheets, tablecloths and other articles that people buy from her. She now has 30 years of experience. She realizes that she could be much more productive if she could buy even more fabric and make more articles. She hopes to borrow an amount of US $175.00 that she’ll repay in 6 months in order to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy more fabric in order  to sew more articles and sell a larger amount of products.

loans.name: Solotua

texts.en: Solotua is a 28 year old mother who is married with 3 children. Her husband is unemployed. Fishing is their only source of income. Solotua decided to do something so she could earn money herself to assist her husband and her family. In her handcrafting business, she makes fans, baskets, kava bowls of different sizes, and many other intricate objects. She is very talented in designing handcrafted objects. Solotua's second loan will help her to buy more equipment and to build a proper place to store and sell her handcrafted objects.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Thi Huong

texts.vi:
Mrs Huong is thirty years old and she has two children in the first grade. Her husband is Mr. Dung who is the city chief police. He works during the week and helps with the family business during the weekend. Mrs. Huong is mainly in charge of managing the business. She sells flowers, fashion hats and eyes glasses. Her store is located downtown so it is very advantageous. She requests a loan of US$150.00 to buy more flowers to service the retail stores and weddings. Monthly revenue will help her pay it back easily and she likes the idea of term payment since that will reduce the burden.

Translate from Vietnamese by Hien T. Lam, KIVA volunteer.

Chị Hương 30 tuổi, chị có 2 con nhỏ đang đi học cấp 1. Chồng chị là anh Dũng, làm trưởng công an của Thị trấn. Anh đi làm việc cả ngày nên chỉ giúp chị được vào ngày nghỉ cuối tuần. Mọi việc kinh doanh chủ yếu chỉ một mình chị đảm nhiệm. Chị kinh doanh hoa tươi, kính và mũ thời trang. Cửa hàng của chị ở trung tâm nên việc kinh doanh rất thuận lợi. Chị vay vốn để lấy thêm hoa tươi về bán, chị làm chủ yếu cho các đám cưới và bán lẻ. Thu nhập hàng ngày giúp chị có khả năng trả vốn dễ dàng hơn. Chị rất thích được trả dần vì như thế sẽ giảm gánh nặng cho chị.

loans.use: To purchase flowers for sales

loans.name: Catalina Del Carmen

texts.es: Catalina del Carmen Gutiérrez G. is from the city of Bluefields. She is 34 years old and is married to Santos Bonilla. They have 2 minor children who are studying. Mrs. Gutiérrez owns a small grocery store where she sells different types of cheese, cream, beans, corn, rice, and a cornmeal and cacao-based beverage mix called pinolillo. She has more than 11 years of experience. Her customers are people with families, owners of smaller grocery stores, and women who sell corn tortillas. They prefer her because she offers a variety of products. Mrs. Gutiérrez needs to buy 3 boxes of eggs at $20.00 per box, 1 quintal (100 pounds) of cheese at $80.00 per quintal, 1 drum of cream at $21.00 per drum, 50 pairs of cuajada (a soft, mild-flavored cheese) at $0.80 per pair, 14 pounds of pinolillo mix at $1.00 per pound, 5 100-pound sacks of rice at $35.00 per sack, and 10 100-pound sacks of corn at $11.00 per sack. With this inventory, she will be able to satisfy the demand from her customers, which has increased considerably in the last few months. It is worth noting that in our city people consume large quantities foods that are derived from dairy products, beans, rice, and corn.   Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer. La Sra. Catalina del Carmen Gutiérrez G. es de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 34 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Santos Bonilla ambos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad que estudian. La Sra. Gutiérrez es propietaria de un tramo donde vende queso, crema, cuajada, frijoles, maíz, arroz y  pinolillo, tiene mas de 11 años de experiencia sus clientes son padres de familia, pulperías y las mujeres que venden tortilla de maíz, la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos. En estos momentos la Sra. Gutiérrez necesita comprar 3 cajas de huevos a $ 20.00 dólar cada caja, 1quintal de queso a $ 80.00 dólares el quintal, 1 bidón de crema  a $ 21.00 dólares el bidón, 50 pares de cuajada a $ 0.80 centavos dólar el par, 14 libras de pinolillo a $ 1.00 dólar la libra, 5 quintales de arroz a $ 35.00 dólares el quintal y 10 quintales de maíz a $ 11.00 dólares el quintal con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que ha aumentado considerablemente en estos meses , cabe mencionar que en nuestra ciudad se consume en gran cantidad los productos derivados de lácteos , frijoles , arroz y maíz.

loans.use: To buy eggs, cream, cheese, pinolillo, rice, and corn

loans.name: Djélika

texts.fr:
Mrs. Djélika Traoré is a 29 year old married woman and mother of 2 boys (10 and 8 years old), both attending school. She lives with her husband in a polygamous family with her husband’s other wife and his parents.

Mrs. Konaté Djélika Traoré abandoned her schooling very early on and quickly devoted herself to commercial pursuits, notably catering. She has12 years of experience in this business and masters all the aspects of the catering business.

Mrs. Djélika Traoré runs a restaurant across from an industrial cotton processing plant, and on the edge of an international road to the Ivory Coast. The restaurant is specialized in the preparation of fast meals (rice plates, potatoes, plantain, spaghetti etc…) intended for workingman and truck drivers for breakfast and lunch. Her purchases are renewed every time her stock goes below a certain level. She stocks up in Bamako (the capital of Mali) and in Siskasso (the 3rd administrative area of Mali).

Mrs. Konaté Djélika Traoré has been working with the microfinance institution Soro Yriwaso for the last seven (7) years. She started out with an interdependent [group] loan (in a women’s association) before qualifying for an individual loan. The amount of her loan went from 75.000 FCFA (~USD 166) to 450.000 FCFA (~USD 1000) her current loan. All the loans have been properly repaid.

She manages her business all year long without noteworthy problems. Mrs. Berthé takes in, on average, 50.000 CFA (~USD 111) a day, with a daily profit of 6.000 (~USD 13). With her profit, she provides for the most part of her expenses and helps her husband cover the expenses of the family (health, education, food etc…).

n.b. =Mrs. Djélika Traoré is seen with her employee on the photo

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

• Madame Djélika Traoré est une femme mariée de 29 ans, mère de 02 garçons (10 ans et 08 ans) inscrits à l’école. Elle vit avec son mari dans une famille polygame avec une coépouse et les parents de son mari. • Ayant vite abandonné l’école dès son jeune Madame Konaté Djélika Traoré s’est vite adonnée aux activités commerciales notamment la restauration. Avec une expérience de 12 ans dans cette activité, elle maîtrise tous les aspects de la restauration.

• Madame Djélika Traoré exploite un restaurant en face d’une unité industrielle de traitement de coton et au bord d’une route internationale en direction de la république de Cote d’Ivoire. Le restaurant est spécialisé dans la conception de plats rapides (Plats de riz, de pomme de terre, de banane Plantin, de Spaghetti etc…) destinés aux ouvriers et aux chauffeurs routiers pour le petit déjeuner et le déjeuner. Ses achats de stock sont renouvelés chaque fois qu’elle diminue d’un certain niveau. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (la capitale du Mali et à Sikasso (la 3e Région administrative du Mali)

• Madame Konaté Djélika Traoré travaille avec l’Institution de Microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis sept (07) ans. Elle a commencé avec le crédit solidaire (Dans une association de femmes) avant d’obtenir un prêt individuel. Son montant de prêt a passé de 75.000 FCFA (~USD 166) à 450.000 FCFA (~USD 1000) son prêt actuel. Tous les prêts se sont correctement dénoués.

• Elle mène son activité durant toute l’année sans difficultés notables. Madame Berthé réalise en moyenne un chiffre d’affaire de 50.000 CFA (~USD 111) par jour pour un bénéfice journalier de 6.000 (~USD 13). Avec les bénéfices réalisés elle assure l’essentiel de ses dépenses et aide son mari à assurer les dépenses de la famille (Santé, Education, Nourriture etc…).

nb =Madame Djélika Traoré est avec son employe sur la photo

loans.use: Purchase of 1 ton of rice, three (3) 20-liter  jugs of oil, beverage racks, various spices.

loans.name: Shamakhi

texts.en: Shamakhi A. is an Internally Displaced Person from Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She settled with her family in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan in 1993. She is 53 years old.  She is married and has four children. She raises chickens in her yard and sells them in the Beylagan City bazaar. She has been doing this for four years. She applied to the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan of $700, which she plans to use to build a new hen-house.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia A. S., born in Raiwind, Pakistan, is married and a mother of three: two boys and one girl. She belongs to a poor family but she has high hopes for her kids whom she plans to send to school. Her husband runs a small restaurant and they need a loan in order to improve their business.

Her loan group has several other women who would also like to improve their businesses: Rehana B. sells milk; Safia I. wants to buy animal fodder; Zainab B. would like to improve her family’s food stall and Shahnaz S. wants to buy a cow.

loans.use: Improve restaurant

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Between my husband and I we've been able to build the house where we currently live. But, we have not been able to complete it because we need to finish some bedrooms for our children. For this reason we request a loan of $1,200 to buy materials needed to complete these rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Entre mi esposo y yo hemos construido la casa donde vivimos. Pero no esta total mente terminada nos esta haciendo falta la terminación de unas cuartos los cuales son para mis hijos. Es por eso que solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para comprar del material para la terminación de los cuartos.

loans.use: Completion of construction

loans.name: Zulayho

texts.ru:
Zulayho R. lives in the region of Shahrinau. She is married and has 5 children. Zulaiho finished high school. She sells dishes and other household items. Zulayho wants to repair her shop in order to improve the service. This will help attract new customers and receive additional profit. In order to do this, she needs a loan. Zulayho plans to pay back the loan within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Рахмонова Зулайхо жительница района Шахринау , замужем и имеет 5 детей. Имеет среднее образование.Занимается торговлей . Имеет небольшой магазинчик рядом с домом. Торгует посудой и другими бытовыми предметами. Хочет отремонтировать магазан для того . чтобы улучшить условия обслуживания. Это поможет привлеч новых клиентов и получить дополнительную прибыль. Дляэтого необходимо получить кредит. Погасить его он планирует в течении 18 месяцев.

loans.use: To repair the shop

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou M., 52, is married and raising one child. She has been a member of the village bank of Khodoba in Thiès for 7 and ½ years. She buys seasonal fruit (mangoes, oranges, mandarins, etc.) and cartons of eggs and retails these items. The income from her business allows her to improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Fatou M., 52 ans mariée, 01 enfant en charge est membre du banc villageois de Khodoba à Thiès depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle achète des fruits de saison (mangues, oranges, mandarine etc) et des tablettes d’œufs et revend au détail. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
Buying and selling fruit and eggs

Achat et revente de fruits et œufs

loans.name: Sreylot's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreylot K. (shown in picture on the left, with her group member) was selected by her co-members to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima (Kiva’s Field Partner). In the group there are two families including hers. All the group members live on an island in the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Sreylot K. (age 27) and her husband, Mr. Chansokha Sam, 28, were married in 2002 and have one son. Sreylot has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old, employing a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband has been a silk weaver for ten years as well. Now Sreylot is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase silk material for weaving.

2-Mrs. Sokkhen K. (age 29) and her husband, Mr. Thol Pho, 32, were married in 2001 and have one daughter. Sokkhen has been a silk weaver for eleven years, also using a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband has been a silk weaver for ten years as well. Now Sokkhen is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Sabougnouman (Porte Bonheur) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq (5) membres du groupe Sabougnouman sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et 3 enfants vivant en général dans des familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Bozo du village de Sansanding sous préfecture de Markala (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). Unies par des relations sociales et économiques ces femmes du groupe Sabougnouma de Sansanding exercent le commerce de poissons fumés et des produits maraîchers (manioc, pomme de terre etc.).
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante ce groupe a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso (qu’il a connu à travers un des conseillers de leur village) avec lequel il est à son deuxième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter un panier de poisson fumé, 2 sacs de farine de blé, 4 sacs de pomme de terre et manioc « atieké ». Elles s’approvisionnent en poissons fumés à Macina une des préfectures environnantes de leur village, en produits maraîchers (la pomme de terre et l’atieké) auprès des forains fréquentant les marchés de Sikasso et de Koutiala et quant à la farine de blé au grand marché de la ville de Ségou. Les produits sont vendus à domicile à Sansanding, dans les foires des villages de Markala, Dougabougou, Siango et Seribala (au comptant ou à crédit) à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et d’enfants.  
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA qui servira à augmenter le fonds de commerce, payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elles envisagent devenir dans un futur proche des grossistes dans une de leurs activités respectives.
texts.en:
The five members of the Sabougnouman Group are married women who average 25 years in age and three children. They generally live in traditional extended families in the Bozo district of the village of Sansanding, Markala sub-prefecture (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). United by social and economic ties, these women do commerce in smoked fish and market garden produce (cassava, potatoes, etc.)

In order to meet continuously growing customer needs, this group decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso (discovered through one of the councilors of their village), through which the group is on its second solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding ones have been correctly repaid. The women intend to use this loan to buy a basket of smoked fish, two sacks of flour, four sacks of potatoes and "atieké" cassava. They get their supplies of smoked fish in Macina, one of the nearby prefectures from their village; their market garden produce (potatoes and "atieké") is from traveling vendors at the marketplaces of Sikasso and of Koutiala; and as for the flour, it come from the grand marketplace in the city of Ségou. The goods are sold out of the home in Sansanding and at the fairs in the villages of Markala, Dougabougou, Siango, and Seribala (cash or credit accepted) to customers essentially composed of women and children.

They each hope to realize a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will serve to increase working capital funds, to cover the loan interest, and to provide for family needs. They envision becoming wholesalers in the near future as part of their respective businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked fish, market garden produce, and flour

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives with her mother, daughter, and a granddaughter. They are from Simferopol, which is in the south of Ukraine on the Crimean peninsula. Anna is a private entrepreneur who sells household items in one of the local stores. Anna has been in this trade for two years. Her current income is over $400 a month.

Anna has had several previous loans from Nadiya Ukraine. Other entrepreneurs characterize her as a consistent and reliable market expert who is capable of repaying her loans without delinquency. Anna is seeking a 5000 Grivna loan ($900 USD) to increase her turnover capital. She plans to invest some of her profit in repair work for her house. Anna's business is the only source of income for the family of four. She is hoping to keep her business running and growing as a stable enterprise.

loans.use: increase turnover capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more goods to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en: The leader of this group of four people is Mrs. Khunthea M., who lives Preak Thei Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Khunthea M. is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by applying for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell to her customers. By doing this, she hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. She is a 43-year-old widow with five children, four of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one attends a local school.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit to meet customer demand

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem, a 47-year-old married man with four children, lives in Kfarhatta in southern Lebanon, where he has owned a small snack shop since 2007. Kassem has identified a potential opportunity to increase his income through the introduction of a pool table to the shop and so is asking for a loan of $1,000 to accomplish his plan.

loans.use: To buy a pool table for his business.

loans.name: Din

texts.en: Mrs. Din H. is a villager in Knar Roung village in Takeo province. She is a chicken middleman. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more chicken, and she would use the rest of the money to buy mangoes to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Din H. is a 60-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a translator while the other is employed in garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more chicken, and she would use the rest to buy mangoes to resell.

loans.name: Fatoumata Dite Awa

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata Koné dite Awa est une veuve  de 48 ans qui vit chez  son feu mari avec  ses 7 enfants dans le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école  pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt à mener une activité génératrice de revenu notamment la préparation et vente d’encens. En plus de l’encens elle aussi de l’habillement Elle a appris cette activité  de préparation d’encens auprès de sa tante qui avait une grande expertise dans cette activité. Son apprentissage n’a pris qu’un mois, elle l’a mène seule depuis 15 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation. Elle reçoit des commandes des grandes familles maraboutiques de  Ségou, de Bamako (capitale du Mali), et de l’extérieur (Sénégal, côte d’ivoire  et  la  France.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle, elle a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation  depuis trois ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et 2 prêts individuels tous correctement  remboursés, elle est à son  3ème prêt individuel
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 1kg de magnonkisén, 20 bouteilles d’eau de Cologne, 2 pièces de bazins car  en sus  de cette transformation d’encens elle vend aussi des habits. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières  sur place à ségou.
Madame Fatoumata Koné dite Awa vend généralement,  l’encens  au comptant  et les habits à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de supporter certaines charges familiales.
Elle ambitionne de faire l’embouche ovine et de se construire une maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Koné a.k.a Awa is a 48-year-old widow. She lives with her 7 children in her deceased husband’s home in the neighborhood of Bagadadji in Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She abandoned her schooling early due to social reasons; early on she started an income-generating business, in particular, the preparation and sale of incense. In addition to the incense she also sells clothing. She learned the business of preparing incense from her aunt who was a great expert in this field. Her training only took one month; she has practiced her trade alone for the last 15 years and enjoys a great reputation. She receives orders from large marabou families from Segou, Bamako (the capital of Mali), and from outside the country (Senegal, Ivory Coast and France).

In order to meet her customers’ needs, she receives helps from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has had a relation for the last 3 years. After 3 solidarity loans (group loans) and 2 individual loans, all fully paid back, she is requesting her third individual loan.

She wishes to use this loan to buy 1 kg of magnonkisèni [Highly valued exotic plant in West Africa], 20 bottles of eau de Cologne, and 2 pieces of bazin [fabric] because in addition to transforming incense she also sells clothing. She gets her supplies in raw material on the spot in Segou.

Mrs. Fatoumata Koné a.k.a Awa usually sells the incense for cash and the clothing on credit to customers who are men and women.

With this loan she hopes to make a profit of 40 000FCFA [about USD 77], which will allow her to provide for some of the family’s expenses.

Her ambition is to fatten sheep and to build herself a house.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material to make incense and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase variety of merchandise offered

loans.name: Maria Lino

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Lino R. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella vende frijoles, arroz, azucar, cafe, matequilla, manteca, huevos, carbon, verduras como ser yuca, papa, repollo, tomates, cebolla, etc. ella tiene su negocio en el mercado de Nacaome desde hace 5 años, ella es madre soltera y su meta es graduar a sus hijos.
este negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos por eso ella lo cuida mucho y trata de mantenerlo muy bien, ella atiende a sus clientes con mucha delicadesa y eso es lo que les gusta a muchos de ellos, por eso prefieren comprarle a ella, ademas que vende barato, mas barato que la competencia. ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mayores ventas y mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Lino R. dedicates herself to selling popular consumption products. She sells beans, rice, sugar, coffee, butter, lard, eggs, coal, and vegetables such as yucca, potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, etc. She has had her business in the Nacaome market for the past 5 years. She is a single mother, and her goal is to see her children graduate. This enterprise is her only source of income, which is why she maintains it very carefully. She tends to her customers delicately, which they appreciate and is the reason they choose to buy from her. In addition, she sells her goods at prices that are more reasonable than her competitors. She needs a loan to buy additional products, so she can sell more and therefore increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, salt, soaps, lard, cooking oil, coal, eggs, butter, margarine, beans, rice, sugar, coffee.

loans.name: Najminiso

texts.ru: Начминисо – женщина 44 лет. Замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Занимается продажей сладостей и кондитерских изделий, которые ей поставляют домашние кондитеры. Конфеты она закупает у фирменных поставщиков, которые доставляют товар на место деятельности. Муж занимается частной деятельностью (разнорабочий). Начминисо старается расширить свой бизнес и открыть еще одну точку, чтобы ее муж тоже мог торговать сладостями. Этим их семейный доход увеличится. Начминисо очень надеется что полученный кредит поможет ей в достижении ее цели.
texts.en:
Najminiso is 44 years, married and has 4 children. She is involved in sales of candy and sweets, which are supplied by private confectioners. She buys candy from brand-name suppliers who deliver to her place of business. Najminiso’s husband is involved in private enterprise as a handyman. Najminiso is trying to expand her business and open an additional retail outlet, so that her husband can sell sweets too. This will allow for their family income to increase. Najminiso hopes that this loan will help her in achieving her goal.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of sweets and candy

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es: La señora Maria Antonieta es originaria del cantón Patzarajmac del departamento de Totonican ella cuenta con un pequeño taller  de bordados y cuenta con tres operario que son mujeres en la elaboracion de blusas bordados ha mano dicho actividad necesita de mucha concentracion y pasiencia ya que les lleva dias en estar realizando para finalizar un producto hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de accesorio  para diseñar nuevos productos dicha mercaderia las vende en el municipio de San Cristobal y Salcaja los dia Jueves y domingos en la plaza.
texts.en:
Maria Antonieta is from Patzarajmac canton in the department of Totonicapán. She has a small embroidery workshop and employs three women who help her make embroidered blouses. She says that making blouses by hand requires much concentration and patience, since it takes her days to produce a finished product. At present she needs a loan to purchase accessories for designing new products. Maria Antonieta sells her merchandise in the plaza of the town of San Cristobal y Salcaja on Thursdays and Sundays.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her capital

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun K., a 45-year-old living in the province of Banteay Meanchey, earns a living selling marbles. She normally collects the marbles from mountains located far from her house and sells them around her village. Khun is a widowed mother of three children: one is married and the other two are single and employed in different jobs in Phnom Penh.  Because selling marbles is her main source of income, she s requesting a loan of $1000  to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business of selling marbles.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “Virgen del Rosario” están representados por el señor Juan Carlos quien es el presidente del grupo. En general una mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se dedica al comercio  D. diferentes productos como abarrotes, ventas D. cosméticos por catalogo, ropa, pan y empleados D. diferentes empresas. Dentro del rubro D. cada uno D. los miembros del grupo existe gran competencia, es por esta razón que los socios requieren D. capital para poder poner productos a la venta más atractivos para sus clientes e incrementar sus ingresos para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En general las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a financiamientos D. entidades similares a la Fundación Agrocapital, por lo que conocen la responsabilidad que implica un crédito grupal.
texts.en:
The members of the group, “Virgen del Rosario” are represented by Juan Carlos, who is the president of the group. In general, the majority of the group members are engaged in the selling of different products such as groceries, cosmetic sales by catalog, clothes, bread, and employed in different businesses. Within the sector of every one of the group members there is a lot of competition; it is for this reason that the members require the capital to be able to sell more attractive products to their clients and increase their income to offer their families a better quality of life. In general, the members have experience in group loans thanks to the financing of entities similar to Fundación Agrocapital, therefore they know the responsibility implied in group credit.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Sergelen

texts.en: Sergelen S., 54, is a married and has two children. His family lives in the Ger district on the plot of land he owns in the small town of Arhangay, one Mongolia's central provinces. His oldest daughter, Dorjdulam, is 19 and a university student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. His youngest son, Luvsandorj, is 15 and attends a local high school. Sergelen has a second-hand vehicle which he has used to run a taxi service for last 11 years. Since he has a lots of experience in this field, his daily income has more than doubled. He is a friendly, open and well-respected person. Since he lives is a very small town, most of his clients are local residents who know him very well. He is applying for this loan to buy tires and spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy tires and spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 25 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en la casa de unos familiares junto a su esposo Eddie de 42 años y sus dos hijos Cristian de 8 y Bruce de 2 años, a quienes desea dar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de abarrotes que más temprano habré en el barrio Bellavista de la ciudad de Juliaca, es la de Sabina, quien a partir de las 6 de la mañana empieza con la atención a sus clientes y no para hasta llegadas las 9 o 10 de la noche. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre recibe con una sonrisa en los labios a las personas que concurren a su tienda, pues lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientas y comentar sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio. Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir a la calle a realizar otras actividades. Sabina espera que en el futuro su tienda crezca y se convierta en la principal de su barrio. Este es el quinto préstamo con MFP y está segura de poder pagar todas sus cuentas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más alegres y responsables. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que vende en su tienda.
texts.en:
Sabina is 25 years old and is a very loving, hard-working mother. She and her husband Eddie, who is 42, and her sons Cristian (8) and Bruce (2) live together in the home of some family members. She wants to provide her sons with a higher quality of life. Sabina owns the earliest-opening grocery store in the Bellavista neighborhood of Juliaca, which she has been running for the past 6 years. At 6am each day she starts attending her clients, and she doesn't stop until 9 or 10pm. She is a very cheerful vendor and always receives her regular clients with a smile on her face. Her favorite part of the job is chatting with her female customers about goings-on in the neighborhood. Her least favorite part of the job is being stuck inside her store all day, unable to leave to go outside or do other things. Sabina hopes that her store will grow in the future and become the main store in the neighborhood. This is her fifth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is sure that she will be able to pay all of her loan installments on time. She is one of the most cheerful, responsible members of her village bank. With this requested loan of 1000 soles, she will purchase more products in order to increase the amount of merchandise she offers for sale at her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine Iñesa, 32, is one of CCT’s youngest successful entrepreneurs. She lives in Parola, Binondo, Manila, with her husband, Darwin, 34, her business-partner, and their two children who are both in grade school. Geraldine owns and manages a soft drinks depot and distributes/retails to small stores in the community. She attributes her business acumen to her mother, who is one of CCT’s pioneer members in Parola. Five years ago, Geraldine joined CCT and established her own small store. Now, her soft drinks dealership earns for her a daily income of P25,000. She has also employed the services of two assistants who attend to deliveries. Geraldine has just finished repaying her previous loan of P50,000 and is now applying for a new loan of the same amount. She will use her new loan to purchase additional inventory and will also embark on marketing soft drinks in cans. Geraldine believes that with her hard work and perseverance, she will soon realize her dream of establishing branches in other areas. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is fifty years old and is married with eight children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc.

Comfort deems this an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her stock of goods available for sale.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: Bayardo Francisco

texts.es: Bayardo Francisco R. M. tiene 37 años. Tiene 2 hijos con su esposa. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. el tenia que buscar el medio de vida para su familia, entonces poco a poco fue comprando ciertas cantidades de ropa, y por medio de los financiamientos que han sido de ayuda, el mayor desafío que enfrento fue que no tenía muchos clientes, pero esto no lo deprimió para salir adelante. Ahora solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisolas, pantalones, faldas y trajes para vestir. Su mayor deseo es establecer una tienda de calzado.
texts.en:
Bayardo Francisco R. M. is 37 years old. He and his wife have 2 children. For more than 5 years, he has been selling clothing in order to support his family. He buys clothing in certain quantities a little bit at a time with the help of loans. His greatest challenge is that he has had few customers. However, this has not discouraged him from succeeding.

Today he is requesting a loan to use as working capital for the purchase of shirts, pants, skirts, and formal attire. His greatest wish is to open a shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Frank's Group

texts.en: Frank K. is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is 49 years old and married with six children between the ages of 21 years and only 4 months, due to the fact that he cares for some of his siblings. All of his children are in school, with the firstborn at the University and the rest in secondary and primary schools. Frank has a retail shop in Lyabana county. He opened this business five years ago, and he is able to make about $78 in profits a week. He hopes that after transforming his shop into wholesale sales, he will be able to earn big money so that he can start a farm and raise poultry for increased earnings. He is a very hard working and determined man. He needs to increase his shop's profits so that the school fees payment will be manageable.

loans.use: To restock his shop for more profits.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel R. is married to Armando R.. She is now 37 years old while her husband is 40 years old and works as a carpenter in their place. They have 3 children namely: John Mark at the age of 18 working as a welder, Merlendeth 16 years old and currently studying as first year college and Arisa Mae now grade 2 in the age of 7 years old. Though her husband work hard for them, the daily income that she get is not enough for their big expenses, it only support their daily needs in the house, but it can’t support the other expenses of the family like the education of her two other children, because now a days it cost much to studied in college. So Maricel thinks of another business that can contributes to their daily income aside from the revenue of her husband and her sewing business, it comes out the buy and sell of banana. She decided to start up this business because in their place banana is common and not cost much.

The loan that she received from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) will be use for buying different kinds of banana for selling. Because more banana to sell more income for their family. They do this business for one year now and she is right that this business will grow if you are interested in doing it.

Maricel really hopes that through all her business they will reach the things that they dream like to have a comfortable house for them and a good education for her children.

loans.use: To finanace her buy and sell of banana business

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie E. is from the village of P-10, Tag-ibo, Iligan City. She is 40 years old. Josie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Josie operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She also runs a videoke (video karaoke) business. Josie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Josie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: P-10, Tag-ibo, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta D. is 35 years old, contented and happily married to a brave and responsible husband, Genaro D.. Genaro is same age as his wife, and in order to provide the needs of his wife and his children, Jolina Mae, 11 years old, and Julia Mariz, 9 years old, he works as a soldier. To help her husband in providing for their family,Julieta runs a fishing business. She decided to start this business because all the resources are since they live in an island village of Sapang in the Philippines, and also because she wants to save for the future of her children.

Both loans that she has received form Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) when she became a member has been used in improving this business. Now, her 3rd loan will be used in buying all the materials for making a fish cage, because their fish cage was damaged during Typhoon Ondoy. She will buy bamboo, fishnets and accessories for fishnets, different fingerlings (small fish) and also gasoline for the boat. She is hoping that with the help of this loan she can rebuild the fish cage that has been damaged and through its revenue they can add another fish cage for more income for them.

As a mother, her first priority in life is their children; she wants them to finish their studies until college. Through their hard work and with help from others like ASHI and Kiva lenders, Julieta knows she can do that.

loans.use: For buying all the materials needed in making a fish cage

loans.name: Elvisse

texts.pt:
Elvis absalome M. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, província de Gaza, tem 27 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 4, 3, 2, e 1 anos de idade, ainda sem idade escolar. Nunca frequentou escola. Vive na casa própria em Boane com a sua família e sustenta mais 4 pessoas que vivem com na mesma casa.

Saiu de Chibuto para Maputo durante a guerra, como forma de se refugiar, acabou ficando em Boane ate hoje. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 15 anos onde trabalha juntamente com a sua esposa das 8h as 22h. Esta actividade aprendeu na Republica da Africa do Sul quando esteve empregado numa loja. Vende mais bebidas alcoólicas e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 1.000.00mt por dia. Poupa algum mensalmente na sua conta do Banco comercial Millennium Bim.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outras instituições de crédito, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua sogra que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt, com o qual pretende adquirir produtos para o seu negócio (cerveja, vinhos, refrescos e produtos de 1ª necessidade) como forma de responder a demanda de seus clientes. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.500.00mt e 15.000.00mt, ambos para a mesma actividade.

Tem como objectivo, aumentar o volume de sua mercadoria, consequentemente o aumento também do seu rendimento. 
No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir a sua casa e mobiliário.
texts.en:
Elvisse Absalome M. was born in the district of Chibuto in the province of Gaza. He is 27, married, and the father of 4 children. His chidren are 4, 3, 2, and 1, so they still aren't of school age. Elvisse never went to school. He lives in his own home in Boane with his family and supports 4 more people who live in his house as well. He left Chibuto for Maputo during the war as a way to find refuge. He ended up staying in Boane until now. He has had his own business for more than 15 years, where he works along with his wife from 8 a.m. until 10 p.m. He learned this work in South Africa when he was employed in a store. He sells alcoholic beverages and makes an income of around 1,000 meticais per day. He puts away savings every month in his account in the Millennium Bim bank. He has never had a loan with another credit institution. He became familiar with Hluvuku through his mother-in-law, who is also a client with this institution. This is his third loan, and it is in the amount of 20,000 meticais. He will use it to acquire products for his business (beer, wine, soft drinks, and basic goods) as a way to respond to his customers' demands. His previous loans were for 6,500 and 15,000 meticais, both for the same purpose. He has a goal of increasing his merchandise so he can consequently increase his income. In the future, he would like to request more loans to construct his house and to furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling alcoholic beverages, soft drinks, and other items

loans.name: Magdi

texts.en:
Magdi is 26 years old and single and lives with his parents in Ramallah, Palestine. He is working hard because he is the only breadwinner in the family.

Magdi sells men's clothing. He tries to choose various goods of fine quality and attractive prices which allows him to keep his clientele. The business provides a stable income and allows Magdi to improve his family's living conditions.

The loan amount requested is 3,000 USD. With the loan, Magdi intends to expand his business and reinvest the increased profit in the business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 55, married and has six children; her oldest, who is 30, does not live with them. She works hard on her rice farm and is now preparing the land for planting. She requests a loan of Php  7,000, which she will use to buy seeds and fertilizers. She will also pay the laborers who help at her farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
S. S. is 53 years old, married with seven children and lives just outside Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, in a village called Goba. Since 1997, S. has owned and operated a fish selling business. In the morning, he meets fishermen at the ferry terminal to buy fresh fish. He brings the fish back to his community, roasts it, and sells it from a small stall on the side of the road. At his stall, he also sells local food, which is his primary source of income. Earning only 40,000 Tanzanian shillings a month ($30 USD), S.’s family survives on the fish and the foodstuffs he sells.

This will be S.’s first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. He hopes to obtain this loan to increase his food inventory and improve the appearance of his food stall to attract more customers. 

S. will share this loan with his loan group, which totals 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture, S. is in the middle wearing a striped shirt.

loans.use: To make improvements to his food stall to attract more business

loans.name: Helenita

texts.en: Helenita O. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 56 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Helenita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Helenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Liliana

texts.en:
Liliana B., 46, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Serenio B., a vendor, and they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own walis tambo-making (broom) business for ten years now.

Liliana has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow five times from CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her broom-making business.

Now with your help, she would like to receive a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos. This money will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business to buy equipment and raw materials needed to continue production. Liliana dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a good and comfortable life with her family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy equipment and raw materials needed for making brooms

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 33 year old man married to a primary school teacher looking after five people in his home stead. He dreams of constructing a modern home for his family. His business interests are butchery and car washing in Fort Portal Uganda.  He has ten years of experience in butchery and four years in car washing. Before doing all that, he was a luggage carrier in Kampala, Uganda’s capital city. He then worked in some one else’s butchery before starting his own using small credit. He believes with more credit from Hofokam he will be able to transform his car washing bay into a modern one.  The  purpose of this loan is to buy cows for his butchery for selling as beaf.

loans.use: cows for selling as beaf

loans.name: Noel Rene

texts.es:
El Señor Noel Rene R. Rodrigues, es  una persona de 56 años quien  Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua, el tiene dos   hijo a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado diez créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido diez créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como, arena, cemento, piso y alambres Nuevos para el sistema eléctrico de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Noel dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Noel Rene R. R. is 56 years old and works as a guard in the Ivan Montenegro de Managua Market. He is married and has two children, who are of school age. He has received ten loans through CEPRODEL in the last seven years, and during this time period he has invested in improving his home, thanks to financing by CEPRODEL. This loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials, such as sand, cement, flooring, and new wires for his house's electric system. All of this is for the purpose of providing greater safety and better living conditions to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand his home

loans.name: Mouy's Group

texts.en:
This is a small borrowing group of 4 members and Mrs. Mouy M. is the group leader. Mouy M., 34, is a grocery seller from her house in the village. She has a small store and runs her grocery business to earn her daily income. She is able to earn US$ 3 per day. She is a single woman without aN. children. To increase the amount of grocery items in her inventory and satisfy her customers, Mouy M. is requesting a loan to purchase more cooking ingredients, plastic goods, and cane goods for her store. 

The other three members of the group are:

Mrs. Paoch N., 46, a fish catcher, who is requesting a loan to buy more fishing accessories;

Mrs. Muoy S., 37, a fresh fish seller, who needs a loan to accumulate capital for her fish sales; and

Mrs. Chhay R., 41, a fisherman, who is asking for a loan to buy implements for fishing activities.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking ingredients, plastic goods, and cane goods for her store

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal L., 28, has been married since 2005 and has two children: one son and one daughter. She lives with her widowed mother on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sophal has been a silk weaver since she was 18 years old. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. She is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: 16.05.01 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
"Sáu N. Thị (1) is a 50-year-old female who lives in the town of Thanh Hóa.  Sáu is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 16.05.01 Đông Hải (16.05.01 Đông Hải).


Sáu is married and has 2 adult children. She owns & operates a butcher shop where she mainly butchers & sells pork to the local community. Sáu has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month.


In 2004, Sáu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Sáu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Sau from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to make improvements to her house.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. Thị Lệ (49) is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her general store.


2.  H. Thị Dung (48) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


3.  N. Thị Chung (30) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her food making & selling business.


4.  N. Thị Hiếu (4) is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Sáu N. Thị (1) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa.  Sáu là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 16.05.01 Đông Hải (16.05.01 Đông Hải).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Sáu thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Sáu kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2004, Sáu đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Sáu đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. Thị Lệ (49) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  H. Thị Dung (48) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


3.  N. Thị Chung (30) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


4.  N. Thị Hiếu (4) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
Jaafar is a 36-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with two family members. He has been working as an auto-repairman for 18 years. He specializes in tires. In 2006, he opened his own tire shop. He sells, buys, and fixes tires as well as sells car lubricant. He notes that securing sufficient capital for his business has been a challenge. He is proud of his experience and hopes to further expand and improve his work in the future.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to invest in a new electric generator for his work. This is important in Lebanon where there are frequent power outages, often for multiple hours in the day. He says that the generator will help him increase his work productivity.

loans.use: To invest in a new electric generator for his work.

loans.name: Jeanly

texts.en:
Jeanly D. is from the town of Banga. She is 33 years old. Jeanly is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Jeanly owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jeanly has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jeanly joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeanly has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jeanly is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Jeanly from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Zaffarjon

texts.en:
A. Zaffarjon is a very courageous man who can manage tough jobs like raising cattle and agriculture. He is the father of three children, and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, Zaffarjon has been able to get ahead in his business by purchasing cattle which he breeds on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It is for this reason that Zaffarjon has come to IMON International for a loan to purchase more animals for breeding.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history.  It was the site of a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 
	
But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after it gained its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for breeding

loans.name: Maryam Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Maryam bibi lives with her family in a a mid-sized city called Vehari in Pakistan. She is the mother of four children who are all working. Her husband has a business selling gas cylinders and has of seven years of experience in this business. Maryam is a housewife who takes care of her family by staying at home.

Maryam is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest in her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will expand his gas cylinder business by buying more cylinders of LPG (Liquid Petroleum Gas) gas. He hopes that this will increase his sales especially as he earns a good profit on each cylinder.

In the photo, Latifan, another group member, is demonstrating her shoemaking business.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase more LPG cylinders for his business

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El comité “FORTALEZA” se encuentra trabajando dentro de las 3er. ciclo del Programa en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. 
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, para ingresos para sus familias. 
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Graciela quien se dedica a la venta de la venta de joyas y es muy medio muy importante para su familia porque le genera ingreso para los gastos de alimentación diario. 
Comenta que las capacitaciones de las asesoras la ayuda mucho para mejorar el manejo de los ingresos con que cuenta. 
Ella pertenece a una familia muy humilde pero muy trabajadora que procura para salir delante de la mejor manera posible.
