Solicita el préstamo para la compra de joyas para vender como cadenas, gargantilla, pulseras, anillos, aros.
texts.en:
The “Fortaleza” (Strength) committee is in the Program’s 3rd cycle in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All the group members are involved in independent activities to earn income for their families. The members form a very unified group that is capable of undergoing group activities than strengthen their companionship. One of the members is Graciela who sells jewelry. This is an important means for her family because it generates income to cover their daily food expenses. She comments that the training she gets helps her improve managing her income. She belongs to a very humble but very hardworking family that tries to get ahead the best way they can. She is asking for funds to buy jewelry to sell like: chains, necklaces, bracelets, rings, hoops, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted silver jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase groceries, soft drinks, snacks etc.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van A., 44, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. A. and her husband sell hand-made brooms for an income of $3 US each per day.  A. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more brooms to resell. In the future, she would like to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more brooms to sell

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is from the village of Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. She is 43 years old, married and has 2 school-age children. To earn a living, Merlina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. More specifically, she sells bananas. Merlina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Merlina joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she will be able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her family's standard of living. Merlina is requesting her first loan from PMPC in the amount of 3,000 PHP ($75), which will be used as additional capital for her existing business.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additional capital for banana vending

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy A. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35 years old. Daisy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Daisy runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community while her husband is working on their farm. Daisy is just starting this business. In 2008, Daisy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Daisy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl P., age 22, is from the village of Poblacion, Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. Cherryl and her husband have two school-aged children. To make a living, Cherryl owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Cherryl has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Cherryl joined HSPFI this year in order to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Cherryl is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cherryl from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Nnrthern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ema

texts.es:
Ema vive en anticrético cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de el alto en la zona 16 de febrero. Es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de dulces y golosinas en el colegio 16 de febrero de la misma zona, vive con su hijo quien le colabora en los gastos, dicha venta es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de dulces, galletas chocolates y pipocas el cual le permitirá aumentar su capital.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Ema lives in a rental property obtained through an "anticrético" agreement in the city of El Alto in the 16 de febrero area. She has a business selling sweets and candies at the 16 de febrero school in the same area. She lives with her son who helps her with expenses. Her business is her main source of income to support herself.

Ema will use the loan to purchase sweets, chocolate cookies and popcorn, which will enable to increase her capital.

This is her first loan with Impro.

loans.use: Purchase sweets and other products

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina pertenece al banco comunal “Juntas y Unidas” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base D. la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Guillermina tiene 56 años, es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cuatro hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su pequeño negocio D. preparación y venta D. tortas y  bocaditos a pedido del cliente, ella también se dedica a la elaboración D. tejidos como chompas. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Guillermina desprenD. una imagen D. una madre trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Guillermina que espera recibir $ 500 USD. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar insumos como harina, azúcar, leche, etc.
 
Guillermina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Guillermina belongs to the “Juntas y Unidas” (Together and United) communal bank of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco; she lives in the same city. Cusco is a beautiful city that goes back to Incan times; it was built in the base of the ancient Inca city.

Guillermina is 56 years old, is married and through this union she has four children. She alternates her activities in the home with her small business where she prepares and sells cakes as well as candies on the request of her customers, she also knits sweaters. It has been a few years that she has been involved in this business and she does very well thanks to the hard work that she puts into her business. Guillermina is a picture of a hardworking and responsible mother. With the next loan that Guillermina hopes to receive of $500 USD, she hopes to expand her business and will buy foodstuffs like flour, sugar, milk, etc.

Guillermina is very grateful for the opportunity given to her through this medium and is committed to meet with the payments agreed according to schedule.

loans.use: To expand her business and to buy foodstuffs like flour, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Janneth

texts.es:
Janneth   solicitó 600 $us.
Ella  se dedica a  la docencia en una escuela de la zona de Rio Seco en la ciudad de El Alto, donde vive junto a sus hijos, pues su esposo trabaja en el interior del país. 
Con el crédito comprará una computadora para los estudios de sus hijos. Es el tercer  crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Janneth asked for $600 US.  

She is a teacher at a school in the Rio Seco section of El Alto where she resides just with her children because her husband works in the interior of the country.

She will use the loan to buy a computer for her children’s school work. 

This is her third Impro and first Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy a computer to facilitate her children's school work.

loans.name: Benta Atieno

texts.en:
Benta K. is a twenty-seven-year-old lady from the county of Migori, an upcoming town situated along the shores of Lake Victoria, Kenya. She is married to David, also a business man, and they have three children. 

Benta operates a vehicle spare parts shop in Migori town, and has been doing this for the last two years. She makes a monthly income of Kshs.  20,000.  Need for growth and expansion arose and she decided to join Kadet Limited to access micro credit.  She has now qualified for a first loan of Kshs 40,000. She intends to use this loan to buy more vehicle spare parts for sale.  Later on she will use her profits to add more stock of spare parts.

Her hope is to diversify into the hotel industry and has plans to open one soon in Migori town.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for resale

loans.name: Via Ferrea Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Vía Férrea de la  cuidad de Pirayu que dista a 20 km de la oficina regional Caacupé.

La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Feliciana F. ella es Costurera, es una mujer muy sacrificada vive con su marido que se dedica a la construcción y  tiene 3 hijos estudiantes ella este año termina su sexto curso.

Ella hace buzos, romeras, camisas y todos los tipos de prendas de vestir por pedido y ella mismo los entrega. 

La Sra. Feliciana está muy feliz con el importante apoyo que le da la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva para seguir creciendo comercialmente y personalmente.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de distintos tipos de telas y otros accesorios que ella utiliza para la confección.
texts.en:
The women of this communal bank are from the Vía Férrea neighborhood in the city of Pirayu, which is 20 km from the Caacupé regional office.

Feliciana F. is president of the communal bank.  She is a seamstress and a very self-sacrificing woman.  She lives with her husband, who works in construction.  She has three children, and they go to school.  This year she is finishing her sixth cycle.

She makes thick winter pants, sweatshirts, shirts, and all types of clothes by order.  She delivers them herself.  

Feliciana is very happy with the important support from the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.  The support is important in order for her to keep growing commercially and personally.

She is requesting the loan to buy different types of fabrics and other accessories that she uses to make clothes.

loans.use: Buy fabric and other supplies

loans.name: Gloria Luz

texts.es: Gloria Luz se dedica a la venta de mercadería general, ella disfruta de su actividad el relacionarse con sus clientes y saber lo que ellos le solicitan. Desde hace más de 11 años inicio ya que necesitaba algo que le ayudara a salir adelante y pagar los gastos de su familia, el objetivo que tiene es surtir su inventario ya que no tiene mucho en existencia. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de materia prima como calzado, perfumes, ropa en general y trajes ya que debido a la época navideña tiene varios encargos.
texts.en: Gloria Luz makes a living selling general supplies. She enjoys relating to her customers and knowing what they are looking for. She started her business more than 11 years ago because she needed something to help her make headway and pay for family expenses. Her objective is to stock her inventory because she doesn't have much at the moment. She plans to use the loan to purchase merchandise such as footwear, perfumes, general clothing and dresses since during Christmas time she has various orders.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Namig

texts.ru:
Namig H. rodilsya v 1971 qodu. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so sovyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey, odin iz kotorix uhcitsya v kolledje a druqoy v shkole. On ochen lubit svoyu jenu i detey i svoyu rabotu.
Namig uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodtvom, etomu biznessu on nauchislya u svoyeqo starsheqo brata. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa. Namig prodayot u sebya doma  yogurt i kefir kotoriy delayet sam i moloko, na yeqo produkti imeyetsya bolshoy spros.
texts.en:
Namig Hadiyev was born in 1971. He is an Internally Displaced Person, a refugee from the town of Fuzuli, now living in the Region on Fuzuli together with his family. He is married and has two children, one of whom is a college student and the other is in secondary school. Hamig loves his wife and children and his work.


Namig has been raising cattle for nine years. He learned this work from his older brother. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy a cow and expand his business. Namig sells milk, homemade yougurt and kefir out of his home. His milk products are in big demand.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
This is Dolores O., 51, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Felipe, a tricycle driver, and mother to their children. By the grace of God, Dolores has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send them all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Dolores, as she herself is a college graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Dolores operates a charcoal retailing business along with her buying and selling of tropical fruits. She also oversees the tricycle transport business. In the Philippines, many still use the old ways of cooking (on an earthen stove where charcoal is used) to save money. Charcoal is much cheaper than LPG fuel, which, in the current market, costs as much as Php600.   Many people prefer to buy charcoal, which is so cheap that it can be bought for Php5. More people are also switching to firewood, which can be foraged or found in the trash.  Dolores also sells tropical fruits on her stall because they are usually requested by her customers.  Among these three businesses, she earns an estimated net income of around Php9,000 monthly.
 
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of charcoal in sacks to be repackaged and retailed to her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Dolores hopes to be able to see her business mature and grow. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of charcoal in sacks to be repackaged, and also varieties of tropical fruits to add to her current inventory

loans.name: Somreang

texts.en: Mrs. Somreang S. is a widow with seven children - five sons and two daughters. Three of them are married; one is a motorcycle repairman, one sells grocery items, one is a weaver and one is a garment factory worker. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Somroeung is a weaver. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help with her daughter’s grocery store by purchasing more grocery items and to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: to buy items for her daughter’s grocery store and to buy materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
la señora Lucia P. tiene 48 años de edad, vive en la colonia 21 de Septiembre en San Marcos de Colon, Lucia es una mujer luchadora que se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y utiles escolares, Lucia vende sus productos en lugares como San Francisco, Orocuina, Yusguare.
lo distribuye en pulperias y tambien a personas que le encargan.
todas las semanas viaja a estos lugares a repartir su mercaderia.
tiene la ayuda de su esposo para cubrir con los gastos del hogar, juntos trabajan duro para sacar adelante el hogar y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de zapatos, camisetas, camisas, boxers, blusas, bikinis, libretas, cuadernos, lapices, colores, cuadernos unicos.
texts.en:
Lucia P. is 48 years old and lives in '21 de Septiembre' neighborhood, in San Marcos de Colón.  Lucia is a determined woman who sells new clothes and school supplies.  She sells her products in places such as San Francisco, Orocuina and Yusguare.  She distributes her goods to grocery stores and also to people who place orders with her.  She travels to these places every week to distribute her merchandise.  Her husband helps her to cover their household expenses.  Together they work hard to get their family ahead, so that they can enjoy a better quality of life.

Lucia will use her loan to buy shoes, t-shirts, shirts, boxer shorts, blouses, bikinis, notebooks, standard exercise books, pencils, colored pencils and special exercise books.

loans.use: to buy shoes, t-shirts, shirts, boxer shorts, blouses, bikinis, notebooks, standard exercise books, pencils, colored pencils and special exercise books

loans.name: Magaly Lucía

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, su gente es muy trabajadora, dedicada a sus familias y muy orgullosa de sus raíces.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Magaly, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un  bebé  de 7 meses. El marido es ebanista. Para ella este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada por los beneficios que brinda la institución.

Ella realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo, él tiene un taller de ebanistería en el cual realiza una gran variedad de productos con la madera como por ejemplo: camas, muebles, puertas, cajoneras anaqueles, ventanas, etc. Trabaja a base de encargos de personas que llegan hasta su establecimiento. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00hasta las 16h00 y cuando tiene mucho trabajo hasta más tarde. La madera la compra en su propia localidad ya que es más barata.

Este crédito es para comprar madera, pinturas, selladores, clavos, pega, entre otros productos.
 
Su sueño es tener casa propia ya que vive en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The communal bank "La Sequita" meets in Sequita parish, which is located in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí province. Its people are very hard working, devoted to their families, and very proud of their roots.

In this place, we find Magaly, 21, who is in a common-law marriage and has a 7 month-old baby.  Her husband is a cabinetmaker.  This is her 3rd loan cycle with her communal bank, and she is grateful for the benefits that the institution provides.

She is taking a loan to help her husband.  He has a carpentry workshop where he makes a great variety of wood products such as: beds, doors, dressers, windows, other furniture, etc.  He works based on orders he takes from people who come to his establishment.  He works every day from 8am until 4pm, and when there is a lot of work he works even later.  He buys the wood in his area, since it is the most economical.

This loan will be used to buy wood, paint, sealants, nails, glue, and other products.

Magaly's dream is to have her own house, since she lives with her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, sealants, nails, glue, and other inputs

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with grown children. She lives in Novomoskovsk. Ludmila sells women’s clothing items in one of the local markets called ‘Slavyanskyi’, i.e. dresses, skirts, blouses, etc. Ludmila’s vending facility can boast a favorable location at the marketplace which only adds to the success of her business. She has loyal clientele who trust her taste and choice of fashionable clothing inventory.  

Ludmila has been in this business for over 6 years. She has invested about 50,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Currently, Ludmila is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase a variety of trendy women’s clothing and classic dresses for spring/summer season. She has already placed her order with a wholesaler and presently only needs to pay for it. Ludmila can be characterized as entrepreneurial and optimistic which has been instrumental on her road to success in business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of women’s clothing and dresses

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is 51 years old and is a married man with five children. His wife works as a municipal bookkeeper.

Gregorio has been in the business of raising hogs for eight years. He plans to use his loan to purchase pig feed, vitamins and other supplies. Gregorio works hard for his family. One of his priorities is his children's education as he wants them to finish college and find jobs.

In the future, Gregorio hopes for his family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, vitamins and other supplies.

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Luz, vive en el Barrio Concepción de Copainala Estado de Chiapas. Ella es viuda y tuvo cuatro hijos quienes ya están casados: francisco de treinta años, Israel de  veinte  ocho años, Efraín de veinticinco años y David de veinte tres y la apoyan con los ingreso de su hogar.

    Ella se dedica a la elaboración de comida, como son: pollo fritos, pollo en caldo, bistec, carne de puerco frito, entre otros y solicito el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes y así poder elaborarlo, como son: carne, verduras, tortilla, entre otros, y comenta que le va bien pues con ello está logrando salir adelante.

     Ella inicio por su propio creatividad, para así tener ingresos y cubrir su gastos que se generan en su vida diaria a un así también apoya a su  nuera con el crecimiento de su nieta.

     Su más grande deseo es tener  un local en donde pueda vender mas cómoda mente la comidas que elabora, así también darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes que le compran del diario.
texts.en:
Blanca Luz lives in the Concepción neighborhood of Copainala in the state of Chiapas. She is a widow and has four children who are already married and help support her: Francisco, 30, Israel, 28, Efraín, 25, and David, 23. 

She works making foods to sell, such as fried chicken, chicken soup, beefsteak, fried pork, and others. She requests the loan to purchase ingredients for her foods, including meat, vegetables and tortillas. 

She says things are going well for her and with this income she is managing to make ends meet. She started her business on her own so she could have an income and cover the expenses she has in her daily life, as well as to help her daughter-in-law raise her granddaughter. Her greatest desire is to have a location where she could more comfortably sell the foods she makes, as well as provide better service to her customers so they will come every day.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Misael; el tiene 27 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de confección de ternos y también trabaja en el negocio de internet desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y la confección de ternos lo realiza en forma independiente vendiendo y confeccionando al publico que realiza pedidos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de confección de ternos y negocio de internet. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como telas para confeccionar los ternos y para implementar el internet.                           
                             
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Misael belongs to the community bank 'Kanchary', located in the district of Cusco, a part of the Cusco province in the department of Cusco.

Misael is 27 years old and single. Each day he alternates between making suits and working in an internet cafe from 8am until 6pm. He works independently making and selling suits to order according to customer demand. He would like to expand and improve both of his businesses. He has applied for a loan to buy fabric to make suits and to install the internet.

Misael is happy to be receiving this loan and promises to make his loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make suits and to install the internet.

loans.name: Noroneza

texts.en:
Noroneza is 24 years old and married with one child.

Noroneza works hard to provide for her family. She sells sunglasses and watches in the Philippines, and she has requested a 25,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Noroneza has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sunglasses and watches business for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling jewelry.

Noroneza aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Banga, in the province of South Cotabato, with her family. 

Nonita is engaged in farming. She grows rice crops and vegetables and sells her harvest at her town's market. Nonita also runs a small sari-sari store (convenience store) where she sells items such as detergent and shampoo. Nonita plans to use her loan to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs. Nonita hopes this loan will help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jessica Patricia

texts.es:
Jessica de 25 años,  vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Es una joven emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Empezó hace un tiempo por medio de su mama que también se dedica a la venta de ropa pero un día le dijo que realizara esta actividad porque le conviene y generas mas ingresos para sus estudios universitarios. Labora todos lo días junto con su hermana promocionado sus mercadería de ropa. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería como ropas variadas para sus respectivas ventas. En un futuro quiere seguir en el negocio y la vez ayudar económicamente a sus hermanos.
texts.en:
Jessica, 25, lives in an urban zone in Las Orquídeas (so called because in the beginning there were many orchids there) in Guayaquil.  She is a young entrepreneur who sells clothes.

She started some time ago thanks to her mother who also sold clothes but one day told her to go into this activity because it’s to her advantage to do so because it will generate more income for her university studies.  She works every day with her sister selling her clothing merchandise.

With help from the loan she wants to buy more merchandise like assorted clothes for her respective sales.  In the future, she’d like to stay in business to help her siblings economically.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 42 años y tiene cinco hijos de las cuales dos son independiente y tres todavía están a su lado.     Ella es una persona responsable, amable y trabajadora y por esas cualidades le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Nueva Luz de Echarate” de la Asociación Arariwa. Marcelina nació en el distrito de Chinchero (Urubamba, Cusco). Actualmente, Marcelina vive en la ciudad de Echarate y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. 

Marcelina por las mañanas vende refrigerios en el colegio Nacional José María Arguedas, ella alquila el stand  a S/. 2,50 diarios y trabaja desde el mes de marzo de este año.  Pero el negocio del colegio está paralizado por qué están haciendo mantenimiento de los puestos de venta. En esta oportunidad Marcelina requiere el préstamo para comprar sillas, mesas y cubiertos para implementar el puesto de venta del colegio. Marcelina por las tardes se dedica a la venta bebidas heladas (Gaseosas, Cerveza) en su domicilio. 

La ciudad de Echarate es la ciudad capital del distrito de Echarate de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 42 years old.  She has five children, two of whom are independent and three of whom are still at her side.  She is a responsible person, kind and hardworking, and because of these qualities she was invited to participate in the communal bank “Nueva Luz de Echarate” ("New Light of Echarate"), part of Arariwa Association.  

Marcelina was born in the district of Chinchero (Urubamba, Cusco).  At present, Marcelina lives in the city of Echarate and this is where she carries out her work activities.

Marcelina sells refreshments in the morning at the Nacional José Maria Arguedas college.  She rents the stand for 2.50 New Soles per day, and has been working there since March of this year.  But the business at the school is paralyzed because they are doing maintenance on the sales area.  Marcelina is requesting the loan for this opportunity to buy chairs, tables and cutlery to create a sales area at the school.  In the afternoons, Marcelina works selling cold drinks (sodas, beer) from her home.

Echarate City is the capital city of Echarate District, in the Province of La Convención.  It is an important trading center for the valleys of Lares and a Convención.  Its main activities are the production of coca, coffee, cocoa and fruit.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and cutlery.

loans.name: Fanny De Los Angeles

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, la señora Fanny De Los Angeles es una persona trabajadora de bueno valores morales y se desempeña como cocinera en una  universidade  y se dedica a esta labor desde hace siete años. Es soltera tiene a su cargo dos hijo.

Actualmente ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de alambre, caja de registro y pago de mano de obra para reparar el todo  sistema electrico de su vivienda así brindarle más seguridad  a su familia, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Fanny de los Angeles is a hardworking person with good moral values who works as a cook at a university.  She has been doing this job for 7 years.  She is single, and has 2 children in her care.

Now she has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to improve the condition of her home.  She wants to pay for construction costs such as: wire, an electrical box, and labor, to repair the whole electrical system in her house so that she can provide more security for her family.  Through this work, she will provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Albert has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas per kilogram. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy green bananas to sell.

Albert is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Albert hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Suluama

texts.en:
Suluama is 37 years of age and married, with five children. Suluama owns & operates a business venture, selling food products in the local community.  She has 3 years of experience in this business. Suluama needs a loan of WST (Samoa Talas)1600 to purchase new items to expand product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Suluama joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Suluama's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 21 years old, married and lives with four family members of whom one works.

Ali has owned a store since 2008, selling construction and buildings materials. He has more than three years of experience and a good reputation, and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his store. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his store.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a single mother of one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Amina has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators. Amina dreams of building a family house and owning a motorcycle for transportation.

Amina is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which she will use to purchase three sacks of rice, cooking fat oil, and charcoal for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of rice, cooking fat oil, and charcoal for her food stall.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta, a 40-year-old married mother of two, lives in the Philippines where, for the past five years, she has been operating a retail shop that sells bananas and coconuts. A new member of HSPFI, Loreta has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy more coconuts and bananas to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

loans.name: Kirua Group

texts.en:
Edward, who is in his early 30's, is married with one child who still goes to school. Edward has been a taxi driver for 5 years now. He works from 7 a.m to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
 
This will be his 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Edward used the previous loans to open a business for his wife selling clothes, bought land, paid school fees and household expenses. Edward used to drive someone's taxi, but now he has bought his own taxi. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants the current loan to make bricks for building his house. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kirua", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to make bricks for building his house

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva sells food products such as fresh pepper, tomatoes, plantain, okra, garden eggs, and groundnut paste or peanut butter in Takoradi. She is married and has one child. Her husband is into sand-winning. Her loan will be used to buy more food products to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more food products to sell.

loans.name: Yuuya S.h.g B Group

texts.en:
Eliud is the facilitator of Yuuya group. Eliud and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Eliud takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Eliud had a very good maize yield, harvesting 12  bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eliud was only able to harvest 1.5 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eliud and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Eliud will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Yuuya group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha Luz, de 47 años de edad, estado civil conviviente pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sembrando Futuro”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 02 hijos,ambos en edad escolar.
El primer negocio que emprendió fue el de realizar recargas a celulares, pero no tenía mucha ganancia; así que, decidió tomar  en cuenta la sugerencia de un vecino que posee tres lavaderos de carros, motos y camiones para vender almuerzos a sus trabajadores y de esta manera vió la oportunidad de empezar con este negocio que cuenta con clientes fijos  y además vende menú (comida) al público, esta actividad la realiza todos los días; por las tardes realiza sus ventas de productos de belleza por catálogo, con estas actividades comparte los gastos de la educación de sus hijos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1300.00,  comprará  productos al por mayor e ingredientes para la preparación de su comida como arroz  y azúcar por sacos, aceite, menestras de esa manera atender a sus clientes como ellos se merecen.
Martha Luz es una mujer trabajadora y creativa,  su sueño es contar con un Restaurante con un ambiente adecuado que le permita crecer personal y económicamente, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Martha Luz is 47 years old and lives with her partner.  She belongs to the Sembrando Futuro Communal Bank in the Tarapoto District of San Martín Province in the department of San Martín.  She has two children, both of whom are school-age.

The first business she started was reloading prepaid cell phones, but it wasn't very profitable, so she decided to take the advice of a neighbor who has three car, motorcycle, and truck washes that she sell lunches to his workers.  She saw this as an opportunity to start a business with regular customers and she also sells set meals to the public.  She does this every day and in the afternoons she sells beauty products from catalogs.  These businesses allow her to share the expense of her children's education.

With this loan of 1,300 nuevos soles she will buy wholesale products and ingredients to make her meals, such as bags of rice and sugar, oil, and mixed vegetables.  This will allow her to serve her customers they way they deserve to be served.

Martha Luz is a hardworking and creative woman.  Her dream is to have her own restaurant with an atmosphere that allows her to grow personally and economically.  She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for offering opportunities to women like herself and allowing them to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as rice, oil, and mixed vegetables

loans.name: Risiki Group

texts.en:
Laban is the facilitator of the Risiki group. Laban and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Laban and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Laban takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Laban had a very good maize yield harvesting 24 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Laban was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Laban will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Risiki group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Laban with his group members. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en: Claudette is 39 years old and has 2 children ages 10 and 12. Both children are currently in school. She sells foodstuffs in a shop she has run for 12 years. Claudette would like a loan to buy peanuts, fish, and onions to sell in her shop. She will use any profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy peanuts, fish and onions.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Jire Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo de señoras que asisten a diferentes iglesias, Cuadrangular y Movimiento Misionero,viven en  la misma comunidad, se conocen entre sí; toman la decisión de formar un Banco Mujer, para tener acceso a capital de trabajo,  reforzando sus actividades comerciales y de cría de cerdos.
Estas mujeres estan ubicadas en la frontera Sur de Costa Rica-Panama, que es una de las zonas del país donde existe mayor desocupación tanto para hombres como mujeres, de allí que la generación de autoempleo sea una alternativa que estas señoras escojen para poder ayudar a sus compañeros o esposos a hacerle frente al presupuesto familiar, este préstamo sera destinado a la compar de mercadería de cátalogo, la que se comercializa entre clientes que cada una de ellas posee, que demandan diferentes articulos como lo son productos de cuidado personal, ropa para toda la familia, articulos para el hogar y una compañera Edith lo utilizara para la compra de cerdos los cuales engordara para su posterior venta.
A futuro las compañeras de este banco mujer tienen como un plan de vida mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas pero fundamentalmente las de su familia, dandoles la oportunidad a sus hijos de no abandonar sus estudios para poder tener un futuro mejor al que sus padres pudieron tener.
texts.en:
This is a group of women who attend different churches, Cuadrangular and Movimiento Misionero. They live in the same community and know each other well. They decided to form Banco Mujer to have access to working capital, strengthening their commercial activities and breeding pigs. 

These women live in the Southern Costa-Rican-Panama frontier, which is one of the areas of the country where there is as much unemployment for men as there is women.  From here the generation of self-employment is an alternative that these ladies choose to help their partners or husbands cope with the family budget. 

This loan will be allocated to buy catalogue merchandise, which is distributed among customers that each of them possess.  They all demand different goods such as personal care products, clothing for the whole family, articles for the home, and one friend, Edith, will utilize it to buy pigs to fatten and sell.  

In the future, the partners of this community bank have a plan to improve their living conditions, fundamentally those of their family, giving their children the opportunity to not abandon their studies and be able to have a better future than their parents managed to have.

loans.use: To buy catalogue merchandise and to buy pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Shirley Gabriela

texts.es:
Shirley de 22 años, es una joven emprendedora que tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que es vendedora de adornos y carteras. Comenzó su negocio trabajando con la mama ahora ella tiene sus propias ventas. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones de independizarse a su totalidad por eso trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano. Quiere continuar haciendo manualidades ya que le ha generado unos ingresos rentables. 

Quiere el préstamo para comprar carteras y materiales para hacer manualidades y poder hacer adornos para una venta con mas calidad. En el futuro quiere mejorar su casa y terminar de construir su negocio.
texts.en:
Shirley, 22, is a young entrepreneur with many hopes for her business; she sells decorations and purses.  She started the business working with her mother but now she has her own sales. 

She very much wants to become totally independent and this is why she works every day starting very early.  She wants to continue to make crafts since they have produced good profits for her.

She wants the loan to buy purses and materials for her crafts to make higher quality decorations to sell.  In the future she wants to improve her house and finish building her business.

loans.use: to buy purses and crafts-making supplies.

loans.name: Lilian Ruth

texts.es: La Sra. Lilian esta sacando otro credito con la institucion, ella tiene como actividad la atención de un Salón de belleza indica que  tiene experiencia de 5 años en esta actividad su salón se encuentra en la zona Oquendo donde realiza distintos tipos de trabajos como ser cortes de cabello, bases, tintes, manicure, pedicura y otros; vive en casa familiar su domicilio se encuentra en el noroeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba en la zona Hipódromo; tiene 2 hijos su esposo es transportista la señora indica  que con su actividad genera ingresos para su familia para el estudio y manutención; el dinero que se le otorga es para la compra de productos cosméticos y mejoramiento de los ambientes de su peluquería, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado, ya que gracias a la institución creció en su actividad.
texts.en:
Señora Lilian is looking for another loan from this financial institution.  Her business is running a beauty salon.  She indicates that she has five years of experience in this activity.  Her salon is located in the Oquendo area, where she she undertakes various types of work such as hair cuts, styling, color, manicures, pedicures, and other things.

She lives in the family home, which is located to the north-east of the city of Cochabamba, in the Hipódromo area.  She has 2 children and her husband is a trucker. She states that her business generates income to support her family and for education.  

The money being provided to her is for the purchase of cosmetic products and for improving her beauty salon . 

She is grateful to the lending institution for the help provided, as thanks to this institution she has been able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products and make improvements in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Reynaldo Leonidas

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Ha ejercido esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo atrás y siempre le ha resultado muy productiva.  Trabaja solo por su cuenta durante todo el día.  Es casado y su esposa se ocupa de las labores del hogar.  Tiene 4 hijos, quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal de su barrio.  Ahora necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de repuestos y llantas para su vehículo.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Libertad.  He has been in this business for a long time and has always achieved productive results.  He works alone throughout the whole day.  The borrower is married and his wife keeps herself busy with the household duties.  They have four children who attend a state school in their neighborhood.

For now, the borrower needs a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of spare parts and tires for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Criselda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Criselda is borrowing PHP 55,000 through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell for her fish vending business.

Criselda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Agossou

texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Anfoin-Kpodji, Mr. Agossou K. raises livestock. He is married and the father of three children. Having a good business sense, he realized there is a terrible dearth of feed in the area. And so he has an idea that would further his livestock business. But his new business venture requires substantial capital that he does not have. He has however an excellent credit history with a previous $550 loan that he repaid without a problem.

Given the ever-increasing demands that he has not been able to meet, Mr. K. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to stockpile enough feed in case of shortages. The success of his plan will expand his business and increase his income considerably. He could then better support his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1960 Anfoin-Kpodji, Monsieur K. Agossou est éleveur de bétails. Il est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Il a le sens des affaires et a pu déceler le manque cruel de provende dans la région et en fait un projet complémentaire à son élevage. Or, cette nouvelle activité nécessite un fonds de roulement consistant qu’il ne dispose pas. Aussi, a-t-il obtenu un crédit de $550 qu’il avait su bien géré et régulièrement remboursé sans incident. Vu les demandes sans cesse croissantes qu’il n’arrive pas à satisfaire, Monsieur K. Agossou sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour acheter des provendes et avoir un stock de sécurité. La réalisation de ce projet va accroître ses activités et augmenter considérablement ses revenus. Ce qui lui permettra de mieux entretenir sa famille.

loans.use: to buy feed for a dependable supply

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.en: N.  Muzaffar is an youngest son of his parents. He already has a family and two children. Muzaffar is a hard working guy. His elder brothers and sisters have their own families and live separately. Muzaffar lives with his parents and has to work a lot and make enough money for his big family. He has been engaged in livestock breeding for over 5 years. He already has experience in receiving loans. Muzaffar used his first loan for fodder. He will use the next loan to purchase two hogs. Muzaffar invests all the profit he makes back into his business.

loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of toolkits

loans.name: Loi

texts.en:
Loi and her husband are separated. She sells fruit at a small market to support her family. She borrowed $375 from a bank for the poor to build her house. Her two children are in school. Their average income is $ 12.50 per person per month.

Now Loi wants to borrow $ 75 to increase her available capital to get more income from her fruit stand so that she can encourage her children’s schooling. She plans to pay back this loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: expand her fruit stand

loans.name: Celeste

texts.pt:
Celeste N. is a 46-year-old married mother of 5. She lives in the Maxaquene area of Maputo. She runs a hardware store in the Urbanização neighborhood where she sells a variety of materials for construction, plumbing, tools, etc. She entered the program in January of 2006, taking an initial loan of 6,000 MT (meticais). She is entering her third cycle with a loan of 22,000 MT to be repaid in 9 months. She experienced substantial growth in the business as evidenced by the increase in volume. She has paid her loans on time and has proven to be a person of good character.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Celeste N. tem 46 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 5 filhos. Vive no bairro da Maxaquene na cidade de Maputo.Tem uma ferragem no bairro Urbanização onde vende diverso material como o de construção, canalização, ferramentas, etc.Entrou no programa em Janeiro de 2006 e tomou como primeiro empréstimo 6.000MT.Vai para o 3º ciclo e vai tomar 22.000MT pagáveis em 9 meses. Teve um crescimento substancial no negócio que é visível pelo aumento do volume do mesmo e ela tem pago pontualmente as prestações e demosntra ser uma pessoa de bom carácter.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Francisco Guadalupe

texts.es:
Sadly, Francisco's wife suffers from uterine cancer, which makes her unable to work and help with the household expenses. It is because of this, and because of all the expenses from this illness and their young daughter, that he started working in construction. Five years ago he worked as a bricklayer's helper. Thanks to Francisco’s dedication and his ability to learn quickly, he raised to the rank of bricklayer. As a bricklayer he was able to learn more things about construction, and so he can now work on construction.

Currently, he as many jobs to do, but the tools he has are very old and often make his job harder, rather than easier. This is why he is requesting a loan for US $925 to be paid in 6 months. With this money he will be able to buy a mixer, which will allow him to do his job better. With your help, Francisco will be able to cope with this terrible illness and do what is necessary for his wife and daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Desgraciadamente la esposa de Francisco se encuentra enferma de cáncer en la Matriz, lo que hace que ella no pueda trabajar y ayudar en los gastos del hogar, y por eso y por todos los gastos que requiere esta enfermedad y su pequeña hija comenzó a dar servicio para la construcción. Hace 5 años trabajó como ayudante de albañil, gracias a su dedicación y a la facilidad de aprender subió al rango de albañil, y ya como albañil, le permitió aprender más cosas sobre la construcción. Y poderse dedicar a la construcción.

Actualmente tiene varios trabajos por hacer, pero las herramientas que tiene son muy viejas y en muchas ocasiones en lugar de ayudarle hacen más difícil su trabajo, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar una revolvedora para poder hacer mejor su trabajo. Con tu ayuda Francisco podrá sobrellevar esta terrible enfermedad y pagar lo que le sea necesario para su esposa e hija.

loans.use: buying a cement mixer.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is sixty eight years old man. He had married two wives but the first one died. In his first family, he had ten children but five of them passed on and now only five are live. On the other hand, he has seven children from his second family.
To sustain his big family, Nathan operates a shop at Adanya area in Angurai division of Teso District. This shop is estimated to be worth KES 10,000/=; he basically foods and small stuffs such as salt, sugar, flour and many more.
 To supliment his income, Nathan is a small scale farmer where he plants corn and beans. When harvested, he usually disposes them to pay his children school fees and the remaining kept as food security.
With successful completion of the first loan, Nathan wishes to get another loan so as to harness bigger sales and profit in this December festive season.

loans.use: Increase on his stock.

loans.name: Carolina's Group

texts.en:
Maria, Karen, and Carolina have been associates of the community bank “Alborada” for the past year and a half, four months, and eight years respectively.

Maria is 34 years old. She is married and has five school-age children. She had a small grocery store for five years, but she decided to change businesses and planted a small farm in order to be closer to her children.

Karen lives with her partner and one son. For the past six months, she has had a small booth where she sells a typical food called "adobo" made from pork and onion. Before that she sold cell phones.

Carolina is 22 and lives with her partner and two children. She sells “chapla”, a typical bread from the region, as well as cheese, pork, corn meal, and other products which she transports to the La Parada market in Lima. In Lima she buys fruits such as papaya, mango, and grapes, which she sells in Ayacucho.

Their loans are for 400, 400, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively, which they will invest in buying farm animals, rice, sugar, beans, soap, milk, potatoes, and chicken in order to sell a larger variety of foods.

From their community bank, Maria, Karen, and Carolina have learned to be more responsible, punctual, and how to use money more effectively, improve their self-esteem, to be better mothers and to save.

Maria's dreams are to save more and have a bigger store, while Karen dreams of having a restaurant, and Carolina wants to work hard and improve the quality of life for her children.

loans.use: invest in and expand their various businesses

loans.name: Blessing Bassey

texts.en: Blessing Bassey K. is married and 35 years old. She hails from Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2004. She sells cloth. She needs the loan amount of $1,200 to buy more cloth for sale.

loans.use: To buy cloth for sale

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Despite being an excellent mother and teacher, Luisa has not been able to carry on her business successfully due to unemployment in her city. Because of what is required to sustain a family, she has had to find another job, and now along with her children prepares delicious dishes. She offers these dishes during festival days and with the revenue obtained from the sale of these dishes she is able to contribute to her family's future. She asks for a loan to attend to the necessity of renting a commercial space to offer these dishes with greater convenience and security.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Luisa, a pesar de ser una excelente madre y maestra, no ha podido ejercer con éxito su profesión por la falta de oportunidad laboral que existe en su ciudad, debido a que tiene una familia que mantener tuvo que recurrir a otra actividad y ahora prepara un delicioso platillo en compañía de sus queridos hijos para ofertarlos en las ferias dominicales y contribuir con los ingresos que obtiene con el desarrollo de su querida familia.Su solicitud de un préstamo atiende a la necesidad de alquilar un espacio de ventas para ofertarlos con mayor comodidad y seguridad.

loans.use: To rent a space to facilitate the sale of her food

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosaria is a widow and has 2 sons who are 32 and 30 years old. She started her business because sometimes her children didn’t have enough money to give her and therefore she didn’t have enough resources to cover the household expenses. She says “I was in despair and had to find a way to start working and earn some money in the short term”.

Some years ago she started selling shoes, covers and other products. Now she sells shoes from a catalogue and the business is doing very well. Every month she has a big amount of orders as people always buy her shoes.

She now asks for a loan of US $475 that she will pay within a month. This loan will help her to pay a pending order and fulfill the obligation she has toward her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

María del Rosario es viuda y tiene dos hijos ya mayores de 30 y 32 años. Inició el negocio por La necesidad de no tener los recursos suficientes para los gastos de su casa y ya que sus hijos no siempre tenían para darle por eso en la desesperación tuve que buscar la forma de ponerme a trabajar y ganar dinero a corto plazo.

Todo comenzó hace alguno años y desde entonces ha vendido calzado, colchas y otras cosas de las que se vaya pudiendo, ahorita esta vendiendo calzado por catalogo, y le esta yendo muy bien porque cada mes tiene gran volumen de pedidos y la gente siempre le compra.

Solicita un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 1 mes. Este crédito le va a ayudar para sacar un pedido de calzado que tiene pendiente y poder cumplir con el compromiso que tiene con sus clientes.

loans.use: This loan will help her to pay a pending order and fulfill the obligation she has toward her clients

loans.name: Thị Quý

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thị Quý (MS: 070002), 49 years old, has been a loan group leader before and trusted by her group members. She sells pork at the open market. Her children are grown up and have jobs. She like this type of loans. They are convenient and encourage her to save. That’s why she volunteers to be a group leader. She is applying for a loan of 2,478.000 VND to buy bean for selling back to tofu makers. Her group has 4 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Nguyễn Thị Hiền (MS: 2.478.000 VND), 33 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her grocery stand.
  • Nguyễn Văn Minh (MS: 070010), 30 years old, applies for a loan to invest in his electronic shop.
  • Chương Thị Duyên (MS: 070007), 25 years old, applies for a loan to buy wood for making furniture.
  • Nguyễn Khắc Ngọc (MS: 070013), 37 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for chickens and buy scrap.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô N. Thị Quý (MS: 070002), năm nay 49 tuổi. Cô làm nhóm trưởng của kỳ trước, được các thành viên trong nhóm tín nhiệm nên cô lại tiếp tục làm nhóm trưởng của kỳ tiếp. Cô bán thịt lợn ở chợ. Cô có con đã lớn và đã đi làm. Cô rất thích với việc trả góp sẽ giúp mọi người tiết kiệm, Chính vì vậy cô làm nhóm trưởng để khuyến khích mọi người tham gia. Cô vay 2.714 để mua đỗ tương về bán cho các hộ làm đậu. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền (MS: 2.478.000 VND), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND về để bán hàng tạp hoá. Anh Nguyễn Văn Minh (MS: 070010), năm nay 30 tuổi. Anh vay 2.478.000 VND để mua đồ điện về bán. Chị Chương Thị Duyên (MS: 070007), năm nay 25 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua gỗ về đóng bàn ghế để bán. Chị Nguyễn Khắc Ngọc (MS: 070013), năm nay 37 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua cám cho gà, và đi mua bán phế liệu.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Karimjon

texts.ru:
Karimjon H. lives in Yavan, Tajikistan. He is married with two children. Karimjon is a farmer. He grows vegetables on a piece of his own land and sells them on the market. He sells his harvest wholesale and uses the profits to support his family. This business serves as an additional source of income. To successfully run this business he needs to buy quality fertilizer. Karimjon is requesting a loan of $1025, which he plans to pay off in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Холбоев Каримджон проживает в городе Яван. Женат и имеет 2 детей. Занимается земледелием. Имеет землю , которую засеивает овощами. Получаемый урожай продает на рынке. Сдает товар оптом. Прибыль использует для своей семьи. Этот бизнес является дополнительным источником дохода. Поэтому для того , чтобы наладить весь бизнес ему нужно купить качественные удобрения . Для покупки удобрений клиент планирует получить кредит в размере 1025 долларов США. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 47 years old. She is a wife and a mother of two children.  One has completed senior high school and the other is in primary school. She has been trading in jeans, blouses and skirts, womens slippers, dressing bags and plastic materials for the past twelve years. Mercy says her working capital was provided by her husband, but is not adequate for her business; she cannot purchase quality products in large numbers. With a loan she has have resources to meet the tastes and preferences of her customers. She would like to use the loan to buy clothes, lace cloth, and linen materials. She belongs to the community group called Love Trust Group.  Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To buy clothes, lace cloth, and linen materials to sell.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is 31 years old and a married mother of three children. Her children are currently in school. Yaa sells frozen foods in the local market to support her family.  She says that demand for fish is high, but she does not have the capital required to meet such demands. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more frozen foods. This will enable her to earn enough income to support her children's education. She is a member of the group called Partners. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê  tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp. Hàng ngày chị ở nhà chăn nuôi và chăm sóc 2 con còn nhỏ, chồng chị  đi làm thuê mỗi ngày cho thu nhập 70.000/ngày. Với mong muốn cuộc sống của gia đình ngày càng cải thiện hơn nên vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để sửa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm 10 con lợn giống về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs Lê is a TYM fund member since 2006. Her family main income is from pig raising business. She's at home taking care of her 2 young children and raises pigs. Her husband is a labourer making 70.000 VND a day. Their wish is to improve their living condition so she is requesting a loan of 9.000.000 VND to repair the pig pen and buy 10 breeding pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria V., 53, is married with six children. She has five years of experience in the beans, cabbage, tomato and cucumber business. She sells to the villagers and the public four days per week. 

She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Maria's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. 

She will use her loan to buy chemicals, pesticides, vegetable seeds, a spade and shovel. Her husband is lending a helping hand in operating the business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, pesticides, vegetable seeds, a spade and shovel

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es: La señora Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito”, ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo Nº 1021 del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años y es madre de 2 hijos, 1 mayor de edad y 1 que aun depende de ella, es Viuda. Luz con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el Banco.nnEn la actualidad ella cuenta con la venta de golosinas, joyas y productos de belleza (UNIQUE) a domicilio, brindándole ganancias y poder pagar su préstamo con puntualidad. nnCon este préstamo de S/1.500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará: 1 caja de galleta, joyas (fantasía fina), y productos de bellezas. nnLuz manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para todas las mujeres ucayalinas que tienen el deseo de triunfar en la vida.n
texts.en:
Luz belongs to “Mujeres de Éxito” ("Successful Women"), a community bank located at 1021 Colonel Portillo Lane, Callería, Ucayali. She is 51 years old, widowed, and the mother of two children (one grown and one still in her care). She invested her first loan from Manuela Ramos (for S/300, approximately US $100) in merchandise for a grocery store. She has been working with the bank for eight years. She now sells sweets and jewelry and is a sales representative for Unique brand beauty products. These activities will enable her to repay her loan on time. With this loan of S/1,500 (US $500), which will be repaid in five months, Luz will buy: 1 case of cookies, costume jewelry, and beauty products. Luz attests that Manuela Ramos is a great help for all of the women of Ucayali that want to triumph in life.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of jewelry and beauty products

loans.name: Sinuon

texts.en: Mrs. Sinuon H. is 39-year-old fishmonger who lives in Thorm Ney village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeung Moeun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. On his farm, he has only one old buffalo of his own, so he usually pays a lot of money to hire a plowing team. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sinuon H. is seeking a loan to buy a buffalo to add to the old one to help plow the field. She is the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Neé vers 1985 à Akpadanou dans la commune d'Adjohoun dans la vallée de l'Ouémé au sud du bénin, dame K. Odile est marié à kpanou Félix et mère d'un enfant. Elle vent des chaussures et des condiments dans leur domicile. dame K. est désireuse de renforcer son activité en cette période, elle  sollicite ce crédit.
texts.en:
Born around 1985 in Akpadanou in the Adjohoun community in the Ouémé valley in southern Bénin, Ms. Odile K. is married to Félix Kpanou and a mother of one. She sells shoes and seasonings from their home. Ms. K. would like to build her business and seeks this loan.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecilia W. is a volunteer member of the Runyenjes Group in Runyenjes, Kenya. The group has received training from K-MET on home-based patient care services and is also part of the K-MET microfinance program.

She owns a retail shop in Gitare town near Runyenjes, Kenya. Her shop is in her own shamba (farm) and was built in 1985. She sells oils, food stuffs, flour, cabbages and bananas to the foot traffic that comes by her place on the way to town. Business used to be good, but because of the current drought and food shortage in Kenya, it has gone down. People do not have money to buy the products and have to buy on credit.

Cecilia has applied for a loan of approximately 275USD in order to add more stock and keep her business afloat until she receives payment from the customers who have bought items on credit.

Cecilia is married to a retired provincial administrator. Together they have 4 children, all of whom have finished school, though some are still dependents, since they attend college.

Cecilia wants to see her business grow and says that she is sure this loan from K-MET will help her to succeed.

loans.use: Acquire more stock for her business

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience S. is married and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high. Patience sells used clothing at Elmina, which she started not too long ago. Her husband is a commercial driver. Patience uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family's financial needs.

Patience will use the loan as additional capital to enable her increase the sale of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her custumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Patience plans to develop a plot of land which she bought with her husband to put up their family house.

loans.use: Increase the sale of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Rita es casada, tiene 56 años y 4 hijos, Rita tiene un molino en su casa en donD. brinda servicio D. molienda D. cereales, además procesa cereales que luego venD. en los mercados, también en temporadas elabora papa seca.
Rita necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. quinua y trigo.
Los sueños D. Rita son tener una empresa molinera y tener una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
Rita is a member of the Despertar Micronfinance Institute.

Rita is a 56-year-old married mother with 4 children. She has a mill in her house in which she offers milling services. She also processes grains that she later takes to the market to sell. During certain seasons, she makes freeze-dried potatoes as well.

Rita needs a 3,000.00 PEN loan to invest in purchasing quinoa and wheat.

Rita dreams of having her own milling company and a warehouse in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase quinoa and wheat

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorna B.,48, is a married mother of six. Her husband is a motorcycle driver in their village. Lorna is not satisfied with the income of her husband, considering that they have many children to feed. So she finds ways to earn income just to help her husband answer their immediate family needs.

She ventured into food vending and with her dedication, she was able to make home-made food for lunch and snacks to peddle in her village. She wants to have a small loan amounting to PHP5000 to purchase materials and ingredients to complete the needs of her food stall.

loans.use: To purchase materials and ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Nisolat

texts.ru: Нисолат - женщина 55 лет , замужем, имеет четверых детей.Нигде не работает, но занимается бизнесом продажи женской одежды.Товар завозит с Бишкека, ей помогает её дети.Она продаёт товар для молодёжи.Её ассортимент очень разнообразный,который пользуется большим спросом.Она очень энергичная женщина, которая каждый день выходит на продажу.Кредит хочет использовать для завоза нового товара.
texts.en:
Nisolat is a 55 year old woman; she is married and has four children. She does not have a job, but she sells women’s clothing. Nisolat brings her products from Bishkek; her children help her. She sells clothing for young people. Her product selection has a lot of variety and is in high demand. Nisolat is a very energetic woman and goes out to sell every day. She would like to use her loan to purchase new products to sell.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase women's clothing for sale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco A. tiene 48 años y esta casada con la Sra. Irma Nidia Orrego.  Ellos tienen tres hijos. El cliente es propietario de una despensa  bien surtida con articulos de primera necesidad (azúcar, arroz, mandioca, leche .huevos fideos, panificados, harina etc.) El negocio esta ubicado en un punto estratégico del Barrio Santa Ana a unos tres kilómetros de centro de Caacupe. 

El negocio funciona desde 1998 en donde trabajan toda la familia y ponen el mayor esfuerzo, para  que sus hijos puedan estudiar y ser profesionales.  El cliente realiza sus ventas todos los días en su domicilio en especial los días sábados y domingos.

El  dice que con los préstamos que le otorgo la Fundación pudo comprar mercaderías (arroz, azúcar almidón), así pudo aumentar su stock y brindar mayor calidad a su clientela. Su objetivo a muy corto plazo es de seguir comprando más mercaderías y agrandar más el negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco A. is 48 years old and is married to Mrs. Irma Nidia Orrego. They have three children. The client is owner of a store well stocked with essential items (sugar, rice, mandioca ( a type of squash), milk, eggs, noodles, breads, flour, etc.) The business is located in a good space of the Santa Maria neighborhood, a few kilometers from the Caacupe center. The business is functioning since 1998, the whole family works it and put all their efforts in making their children able to study and become professionals. The client sells every day especially Saturdays and Sundays. He says that with the loans he received from the Foundation he has been able to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, starch) and increase his inventory providing better service for his customers. His short term objectives are to continue acquiring merchandise and increasing the size of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, starch.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells baby items and clothes. She is 48 years old and married with 4 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more baby clothes to sell. Theresa says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby clothes to sell

loans.name: Sabiduria Ii Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Sabiduría inicia su tercer ciclo con 21 socias. 
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de abarrotes en general, prendas de vestir, artesanía, verduras, cereales, carne, comida, cosméticos, repuestos, quesos.
	 
Como es el caso de Basilia que es casada, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Basilia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija, además los días sábados y domingos viaja a las ferias en donde compra queso y animales menores.
Por otro lado Teofila es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Teofila junto a su esposo realizan bellos trabajos en telar como pasadizos, productos que vende en el mercado de la ciudad, además Teofila vende alfalfa en el mercado de Carmen Alto.
	
Mientras que Aydee es soltera, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Aydee se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos, sus ventas son a trabajadores de instituciones y al crédito. Además Aydee vende cereales en la ciudad de Chincha. 

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total de 11,950 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de bebidas, arroz, azúcar, alfalfa, trigo, cebada, maíz, quesos, animales menores.

Los sueños de las socias son mejorar sus negocios, salir adelante, ahorrar y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Sabiduría communal bank is starting its third loan cycle with 21 members. The members are involved in various businesses such as selling groceries, clothing, handicrafts, vegetables, grains, meat, food, cosmetics, spare parts, cheese, etc. As an example there is Basilia, who is married, 35 years old with 3 children.
