She has a stO. in her house where sells groceries, vegetables, and meat, which she does with the help of her daughter. In addition, on Saturdays and Sundays she travels to various markets where she buys cheese and young animals. Another example is Teofila, who is married, 36 years old and has 2 children. Teofila, along with her husband, make beautiful woven products such as ponchos, which they sell in the city market. In addition, Teofila sells alfalfa in the Carmen Alto market. Finally, there's Aydee, who is single, 31 years old with 2 children. Aydee works selling and buying cheese. Her sales are to workers and on credit. In addition, Aydee sells grains in the city of Chincha. The members need differing loan amounts such as 300 Soles, 600 Soles, 900 Soles, etc. with a total of 11,950 Soles for the entire communal bank. The loans will be invested in the purchase of drinks, rice, sugar, alfalfa, wheat, barley, corn, cheese and young animals. The member's dreams are to improve their businesses, get ahead, save and that their children become profressionals.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodas, rice, sugar, alfalfa, wheat, barley, corn, cheese, and young animals

loans.name: Pionita

texts.en:
Pionita G. is a rice grower. She is a 49 year old mother of only one child. Her husband, Arsenio G., is also a farmer. They work so hard to be able to grow their crops well for an abundant harvest. They have been tilling their farm since the start of their marriage. Their income supports the expenses of their home, as well as their daily needs.

She is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to pay for seedlings for the 4.5 hectare rice field. Part of the loan will be used to buy carabao (buffalo) to make their life easier when it comes to farming.

To date, Pionita receives not just loans from CEVI, she also receives training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To pay for seedlings for the rice field.

loans.name: Phạm Thị

texts.en:
L. Phạm Thị (524050608) is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên.  She is widowed and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, L. owns & operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  L. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4100000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  L. is now requesting a new loan of 15000000 VND, which will be used to expand the business.  The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the Upendo borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. Her children are aged 20, 17, 12, and 9 years. She also cares for 3 other dependents.

Joyce started her own cafe business selling food three years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 50,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Joyce’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice, wheat, and sugar. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Joyce hopes to save money, get more food for her family, and expand her business. .

loans.use: To buy more rice, wheat, and sugar

loans.name: Hernan Freddy

texts.es: Hernan tiene 40 años de edad. Su esposa se llama Natividad y tienen un hijo de que depende de ellos. Hernan se dedica al transporte de taxi desde hace 5 años y su esposa vende productos de belleza por catalogo y también joyas. Tiene su casita propia en la cual viven desde hace 5 años atrás. El crédito se destina para la reparación de su vehículo y para realizarle mantenimiento en general. Es un regular cliente que ha tenido algunos atrasos pero no son significativos.
texts.en:
Hernan is a 40-year-old man whose wife’s name is Natividad. They have one dependent son together. Hernan has been a taxi cab driver for 5 years, and his wife sells beauty products by catalog and jewelry. He has owned a house for 5 years. This loan will be used to repair his vehicle and give it general maintenance. He is a regular client who has had some minor issues.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la foto es la esposa del señor Roberto D. A. M..

Roberto D. A. M. es un esposo que quiere apoyar a su mujer con la venta D. ropa usada, para ello el piD. un préstamo para que ella compre mas mercancía para tener variedad en su venta. La esposa tiene mas D. dos años con la venta D. ropa usada y se pone en dos partes D. esta ciudad que por la gente ya es muy conocida, aparte D. esto ella es costurera y hace trajes para colocarlos en la veta a precios accesibles.  Ahora entre los dos quieren un préstamo para compra D. material y variedad D. ropa.
texts.en:
The woman in the picture is Mr. Roberto D. A. M.’ wife.

Roberto D. A. M. wants to support his wife in selling used clothing. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that she can purchase merchandise and offer a wiD. variety of apparel. His wife has been in the used clothing business for two years, and she sets up in two different parts of the city because she is now very well-known. AsiD. from selling used apparel, she is also a seamstress who makes outfits and sells them at affordable prices. They now want to obtain a loan together so that they can purchase fabric and a wiD. selection of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Wilma Monica

texts.es: La Señora Wilma tiene su propia pension el la zona de Achumani, ella vive con su mama y  sus dos hijas, ella esta separada del esposo. Se mantienen con los ingresos que el negocio genera, por lo tanto, el dinero sera invertido en refaccionar el mismo y abastecerse de insumos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Wilma has her own cafe in the region of Achumani. She lives with her mother and her two daughters. She is separated from her husband. She and her family sustain themselves with the income that her business generates. Therefore, the money will be used to refurbish her cafe and to buy supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishment of her lodge and buy of supplies.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana S. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hijo.
La señora Juana es enfermera y trabaja en la policía de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para el acabado de una habitación en su vivienda y así tener espacio para su hijo que ya cursa la secundaria.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Juana S. lives with her son in her own home in the Llojecta area west of the city of La Paz. Juana is a nurse, and she works with the city’s police force. She supports her family with this income. The loan she is asking for is to finish a room in her house. This way she will have space for her son who is in high school. This is the third time she has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies her to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish a room in her house so that her son can be more comfortable

loans.name: Sourou Parfaite

texts.fr: A. Sourou Parfaite est née le 18 Avril 1981 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Sourou Parfaite vit depuis vingt deux ans à Houéyogbé un quartier de Porto-Novo. Mariée à ZOUNON Ignace, un peintre-auto, Sourou Parfaite est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Sourou Parfaite et Ignace vivent ensemble et supportent les charges de la famille. C’est depuis quinze ans que Sourou Parfaite vend des céréales au grand marché de Porto-Novo. Sourou Parfaite s’approvisionne en céréales à Ikpinlè au Sud du Bénin. Sourou Parfaite a bénéficié déjà d’un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et mieux répondre aux demandes  de sa clientèle, Sourou Parfaite sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Sourou Parfaite was born on April 18, 1981 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of the Republic of Benin.  For 28 years, she has been living in Houéyogbé, a district of Porto-Novo.  She is married to ZOUNON Ignace, an automobile painter, and is the mother of three children, who are all in school and in her care.  She and Ignace live together and are meeting family expenses.  Sourou Parfaite has been selling grains at the grand marketplace of Porto-Nov for 15 years.  She stocks up on grains in Ikpinlè in southern Benin.  She has already benefited from an ALIDé loan, which she repaid.  To increase her capital funds and to respond better to the demands of her customers, she's requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains (sacks of corn, beans, and rice)

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20201070020) is a 46 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Bạn nhóm 01 (1).

T. is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, T. operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from selling animal feed and farm-related products in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4200 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, T. joined SEDA to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. successfully repaid a previous loan of 5152 VND from SEDA which she used to expand her business. She is now requesting her 4th loan from SEDA, for 7392 VND, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. T. plans to use the additional revenue to make improvements to her house.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group

1. Nguyễn K. C. (20201070021) is a 38 year-old male who is requesting a 5152 VND loan to support his business raising livestock.

2. Nguyễn V. B. (20201070022) is a 42 year-old male who is requesting a 5152 VND loan to support his service-based business.

3. Nguyễn Thị T. (20201070023) is a 34 year-old female who is requesting a 5152 VND loan to support her recycling services business.

4. Nguyễn Thị M. (20201070024) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 5152 VND loan to support her service-based business.

5. Nguyễn Thị T. (20201070025) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 5152 VND loan to support her service-based business.

6. Nghiêm Thị L. (20201070026) is a 48 year-old female who is requesting a 5152 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About SEDA
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (20201070020) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Trung Bạn nhóm 01 (1). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm thức ăn gia súc & có liên quan đến nông trại trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 4.200.000 VND. Vào 2007, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn K. C. (20201070021) là 38 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nguyễn V. B. (20201070022) là 42 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 3. Nguyễn Thị T. (20201070023) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế. 4. Nguyễn Thị M. (20201070024) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 5. Nguyễn Thị T. (20201070025) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 6. Nghiêm Thị L. (20201070026) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: United We Stand Group

texts.en:
Mark K. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called United We Stand. He is 24 years old, a single father of a 3 year-old child who is in kindergarten.  He is an 11th grade student but also runs a business.  

Mark lives and work in the Waterside community, a community that has the largest wholesale market in downtown Monrovia, Liberia.  His business is the sale of T-shirts.  He buys them at wholesale and sells them at retail in the Waterside Market, downtown Monrovia, Liberia.  He has been running this business for 9 years, and hopes to improve it in the future.  Mark sells quality T-shirts in high demand to encourage his customers to continue buying from him.  He needs this loan to purchase more t-shirts to improve business.  Mark dreams of having a better education.

loans.use: To purchase more t-shirts for resale

loans.name: Alice Moraa

texts.en: Alice Moraa A., 19 years old, is married and has a two-year-old child.  She sells sodas and snacks to walk-ins and repeat customers  by the roadside near vehicle terminals in Kisii town.  Her business challenges are strong competition and up and down demand from customers.  In addition, she also sells cereals including maize, beans, and finger millet.  She is using the proceeds of KES20,000 to buy more soft drinks and snacks.  Alice describes herself as hard-working and ambitious and her dream is to own her own soda depot.

loans.use: To buy 50 crates of sodas at KES 416 each

loans.name: Loreta's Group

texts.en:
Loreta P. is from the village of Villa D., Angadanan, Isabela.

She is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Loreta is 42 years old. She is married and has 4 school-age children. Loreta operates a general store where she sells food and daily use products to the local community. Loreta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Loreta joined ASKI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her fourth loan, for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. Loreta plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

About ASKI

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Roy's Group

texts.en: Roy Z. is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a married lady with three children all in school, and she takes care of seven dependants. She has a boutique on Bugerere Road that she has been operating for 10 years and she is able to make 100,000 UGX as profits every week. This helps her to support her family, along with her husband who also helps a lot. She sells ladies’, children’s and men’s clothing and she would like to include tailoring in her offerings so that she can sell some of the clothes she makes in her boutique as well as taking orders from other customers. She needs a loan to be able to buy more clothes for her boutique.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Mrs. Ret M. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Khorn Porm, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. The have been married since 1975 and have 7 children: 5 sons and 2 daughters. One of was married and lives outside the family home, two sons are construction workers; one daughter works in garment factory and the other attend school. 

Mrs. Ret M. has been a silk weaver since she was sixteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then in turns them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband collects palm juice for sale in his village and to make palm sugar.

Ret used to ask for Kiva loan one time already. She now is requesting another loan in the amount of $600 to put concrete her house foundation and repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To put concrete in her house foundation and repair the house where she lives

loans.name: Norbasa

texts.en:
Norbasa G. is from the village of Adorable in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 41 years old. Norbasa is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Norbasa provides motorcycle transportation to local community members. Norbasa has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Norbasa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norbasa is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase spare parts so he can provide better service. This will be Norbasa's first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional Irish potatoes for sale

loans.name: Ermicenda

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo, comarca san ramón entrada a palo grande, la señora Ermicenda O. C.se dedica a la producción agropecuaria destacándose en varios rubros como son la crianza de ganado bovino y porcino también el establecimiento y producción de granos básicos como son maíz y frijoles.
La señora Ermicenda O. ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a estas actividades las que le proveen lo necesario para el sostén de sus cuatro hijos y su padre, también realiza actividades comerciales como es la venta de cosa de horno que le asegurara otros ingresos adicionales.
El crédito solicitado será empleado en para la compra de semilla, fertilizantes  he insecticidas para el establecimiento de maíz de primera.
texts.en:
In the Somotillo municipatility of San Ramón, Ermicenda O. C.dedicates herself to several farming endeavors such as raising cattle and pigs. She also grows some basic crops such as corn and beans. Ermicenda has been in this type of business for most of her life, and these activities have served to provide the necessary sustenance to care for her four children and her father. She also sells food, which helps her generate additional income. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to establish her corn crop.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her crops and a cow.

loans.name: Paciencia

texts.en:
Paciencia E. is from the village of Canibungan Daku, in the Philippines.  She is 69 years old, widowed and the mother of 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Paciencia cultivates fruit trees and sells fruit. Paciencia has been in this business for over 15 years.  She earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Paciencia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paciencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment.  She is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP o repair a ehicle used in the business.  This loan will be her 5th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue to support her family. 
-----------------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Repair a transport vehicle used in business.

loans.name: Srey Pao

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Pao S. and her husband, Mr. Phat Thon, are villagers in Check village in Kandal province and she was born in 1979. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice on to support her family. In the rice field, she has some problems because her field has infertile soil and it is far from the irrigation system. Thus, in order to improve rice production, Mrs. Srey Pao S. decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel. Her husband is a construction worker and she has a child who is one year old. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Wasanthi

texts.en:
Wasanthi is a married woman living with her husband and two children in the town of Hikkaduwa in the Galle district of Sri Lanka. She is 23 years old. Her husband is an army officer, and she runs her small business at home.

Wasanthi currently has just one sewing machine and provides sewing services to her neighbors and relatives as they place orders with her. She wants to develop her business and in the future hopes to buy more machines and create employment opportunities for other women as well. 

Wasanthi has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka for the improvement of her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more material to sew

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 47-year-old year old man who is married to a hairdresser. He runs a driving and computer college called Ikinu Driving and Computer College. He opened this college fifteen years ago. In addition, he has a retail shop. He belongs to Ikinu Jitahidi group in Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each other's loans. 

He wants to take his first loan of KES 20,000 from Faulu Kenya. He wants to use this loan, along with his savings, to service his driving school pick-up.  He hopes to expand his college to accommodate more students.

loans.use: To service his driving school pick-up

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Jacquelyn A. is from the village of Brgy. Escoting, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old. Jacquelyn is married and has three infant children. 

To make a living, Jacquelyn owns a general store which primarily sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Jacquelyn has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jacquelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacquelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jacquelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 32 years old and blessed with a three-year-old child.  Her husband works in a hotel while she runs a salon.  She has had her business for six months and hopes to expand it. 

Juliana belongs to the group called Transparency within Faulu Kenya, whose members are business people; some, like her, run salons.  Being a member of the group, she is able to save her money and she can be guaranteed a loan by the other members.  She is asking for a loan of KES 40,000 to buy beauty products and a hair drier.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and a hair drier

loans.name: Salvacion Babatid's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Salvacion B. is 57 years of age, married and a resident of Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Salvacion B.’s Group.

Salvacion is married to Fausto B., a farmer and her business assistant. They were blessed with 2 children who are now adults with their own families. Five years ago, Salvacion decided to help her husband and became involved in the food-selling business, specializing in "puso", or hanging rice, and native vinegar. She has been able to maintain the business and now earns an average net monthly income of not less than 3,000 PHP, which is so helpful to their family income.

Upon hearing the good news of PAGLAUM MPC being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and being awarded Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006, Salvacion joined the cooperative in 2009. As an active member of PAGLAUM MPC's PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP (her 3rd cycle loan) to be used for additional capital for her business. The future income from this loan will be used to improve her family's living conditions, to meet their basic needs, as loan repayments to PMPC and for possible business expansions.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business selling "puso" and vinegar

loans.name: Reynaldo José

texts.es: Don Reynaldo C. tiene 32 años de edad, su señora es ama de casa, tiene 3 hijos de 16, 11 y 8 años de edad, todos ellos se encuentran estudiando. Habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, en donde se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 16 años de experiencia, inició esta actividad con la ayuda de su papá, él siembre piña, y el crédito será usado para la compra de Insumos y fertilizantes para aplicárselo a su siembre y así asegurar la producción de esta fruta, y con eso también asegurará el poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que logren terminar sus estudios y llegar a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Mr. Reynaldo C. is 32 years old, his wife manages the home, they have 3 children of 16, 11 and 8 years of age, all of them are attending school. He lives in the Ticuantepe municipality where he has worked in agriculture for 16 years. He began his work with his fathers help, he grows pineapples. The loan will be used to buy supplies and fertilizer to use on his crops. This will ensure the production of his fruit and he will be able to support his children so that they can finish their studies and be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Erika Del Rosario

texts.es:
Erika es una joven comerciante de 27 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, inicio hace cinco años con préstamos.
Es madre de dos hijos, y su esposo trabaja como asistente en un banco.
Sus planes es comprar  dos vitrinas para poder exhibir sus productos y lograr la atracción del cliente.
Los productos que vende,  los compra en el mercado Oriental donde lo halla  a buen precio, y otros de Avon que gustan mucho al cliente y que trae por encargo. Vende al contado y al crédito.
Lo que quiere es invertir es en cosmético y perfumes, ropa de varón ya que tiene poco inventario y desea invertir logrando aumentar sus ganancias que es con la que ayuda a su pequeña familia. Lo que no ha logrado hasta el momento es su nivel alta en ventas, es por eso opta al financiamiento para dar otro jiro a su negocio.
texts.en:
Erika is a young, 27 year old merchant. She sells clothes and cosmetics. She started five years ago with loans. She has two children, and her husband works in a bank as an assistant. Her plan is to buy two display cases to be able to show her products and attract customers. She buys her products in the Oriental Market, where she finds good prices. She also gets Avon by order, which her customers like a lot. She sells for cash and credit. What she wants to do is invest more in cosmetics, perfume, and men’s clothes. She has a small inventory, and she wishes to invest in order to increase her earnings. She helps her small family with her earnings. Up until now she has not managed to have a high level of sales. That is why she opted for a loan to give her business another go round.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics, perfume, and men’s clothes to increase sales

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun S., 23, sells palm sugar in the local market of his Takeo Province. On average, he is able to make $4 USD of profit a day. His wife is a garment factory worker, making $2 USD per day. This couple has one young child living at home to support. Bun S. is now living with his mother.

Bun S. is asking for a loan of $350 USD to purchase more palm sugar to sell at the market.

(Bun S. and his wife were not available for picture so Bun S.'s mother is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase more palm sugar.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie G. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Margie owns and operates a specialized retail store dealing and selling daily personal products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Margie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Margie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Margie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Margie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en: Soeung S., 38, is married with three young children living at home in Takeo province. She raises and sells pigs, typically making US$ 1 each day; her husband works in construction. Her husband typically makes about US$ 3 each day. Soeung S. would like a loan of US$ 650 to raise more pigs.

loans.use: Raise pigs

loans.name: Togtohtuya

texts.en:
Togtohtuya D. is a 30-year-old married woman with one young son. She lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, in their own "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son attends a local kindergarten. 

Togtohtuya, with the help of her husband, operates a wheel-repair business in the local community. She and her husband have been engaged in this business since 2006 and since then, they have built a successful and stable operation. They hired two more workers. 

She is a very modest woman and is requesting a 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan in order to purchase a new house for their family.

loans.use: To purchase a new house

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
El señor Pascual es soltero, con 27 años, se dedica en macate, con 5 años de experiencia en el ramo, tiene clientela formada y con visión de progreso.   
    Proviene de una familia muy trabajadora, quienes le orientaron para trabajar en el ramo y le dieron un pequeño capital para emprender sus actividades.
 Como todo comerciante el necesita incrementar su cartera de clientela y la única forma de lograr es obteniendo los créditos y ya accedió a un crédito de un millón en doce meces el cual canceló en forma excelente y solicita nuevamente para la compra de colchas.
    Su sueño es tener su propia casa y un local comercial y lo cual va a lograr con los apoyos financieros que le brindamos, pues, actitud de superación tiene.
texts.en:
Pascual, 27, is single and lives in Macate.  He has five years experience in his line of work. He has a formed customer base and a vision of progress.

He comes from a very hard working family who trained him to work in this area and gave his a small amount of capital to start out.

Like all merchants he needs to increase his list of customers and the only way to do is by getting loans.   He already took out one for a million in twelve months which he repaid excellently and is now asking for another loan to buy bedspreads.

His dream is to own a house and a store.  He expects to do so with financial help from us because of his self-improvement attitude.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads.

loans.name: Rosa Verónica

texts.es:
Rosa Verónica C. A. tiene 27 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Rosa pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos, esta ventanilla tiene 20 miembros.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo fréjol y papa  y animales para engordar . Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es ponerse comprar casa y comprar animales para criar.
Le gusta hacer la limpieza en la casa.
texts.en:
Rosa Verónica C. A. is 27 years old. She is a married woman. She lives with her husband and children, in the Guaranda canton, in the Bolivar province. She has 2 children.

Rosa belongs to the the Casaiche Chilipamba community bank. It is located half an hour from Guaranda. The members of the group work in agriculture and farming, with dairy cows and pigs. The group has 20 members.

Rosa farms corn, wheat, beans, potatoes and she takes care of dairy cows. She buys them in Guaranda and sells them in the wholesale market in the same city.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for planting corn, wheat, beans, potatoes and for fattening animals. The loan’s support would allow her to help her family economically with the household expenses. Her dream is to be able to buy a house and animals to raise.

She likes to do the house cleaning.

loans.use: to buy supplies for planting corn, wheat, beans and potatoes and for fattening animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For clothing.
